Title: GitHub Copilot responds to 'Hey Code' but dictation doesn't work
Body:
As the title explains, I can start an inline chat session using the 'hey code' voice command in VS Code, but it doesn't pick up what I say afterward.
Dictation (CTRL+ALT+V) doesn't work either.
The mic icon is grayed out, indicating that is activated, but nothing happens when I talk. This used to work just fine.

I have checked the logs and no errors are being reported.
Any ideas what may be going on?
Title_Body:
<<GitHub Copilot responds to 'Hey Code' but dictation doesn't work>>
<<As the title explains, I can start an inline chat session using the 'hey code' voice command in VS Code, but it doesn't pick up what I say afterward.
Dictation (CTRL+ALT+V) doesn't work either.
The mic icon is grayed out, indicating that is activated, but nothing happens when I talk. This used to work just fine.

I have checked the logs and no errors are being reported.
Any ideas what may be going on?
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Why is my IDE/Code editor suggesting "Ask Copilot" when I have code on the next line?
llm_zero_shot_body:
I'm trying to use the "Ask Copilot" feature in my IDE, but it's not working as expected. When I click on the "Ask Copilot" button or use the keyboard shortcut, nothing happens. 

**Expected Behavior:**
I expect a dialog box or a similar interface to appear where I can type in my question or request for Copilot.

**Actual Behavior:**
Nothing happens. The IDE doesn't respond to my attempt to use the "Ask Copilot" feature.

**IDE and Copilot Version:**
[Please specify the name and version of your IDE (e.g., Visual Studio Code 1.70.2) and the Copilot version you have installed.]

**Troubleshooting Steps Taken:**
* I have checked that Copilot is installed and enabled in my IDE settings.
* I have tried restarting my IDE.
* I have verified that my internet connection is stable.

Has anyone else encountered this issue? Are there any specific settings or configurations I need to check to get "Ask Copilot" working?

Title: How can I fix my Workflow file to successfully deploy my app?
Body:
I am trying to use Github Actions with Azure Static Web App to deploy a web app. I am using node version 20.18.0 and .NET 8 in my React app, and used the default vite configurations that came when I created the project in Visual Studio with some changes for my project.
The project keeps failing -- here are the current workflow file configurations:
jobs:
  build_and_deploy_job:
    if: github.event_name == 'push' || (github.event_name == 'pull_request' && github.event.action != 'closed')
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    name: Build and Deploy Job
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          submodules: true
          lfs: false
      - name: Setup .NET Core
        uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v4
        with:
          dotnet-version: 8.0.402
      - name: Setup Node
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: 20.18.0
      - name: Build And Deploy
        id: builddeploy
        uses: Azure/static-web-apps-deploy@v1
        with:
          azure_static_web_apps_api_token: ${{ secrets.AZURE_STATIC_WEB_APPS_API_TOKEN_GREEN_MUSHROOM_0A9558C1E }}
          repo_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }} # Used for Github integrations (i.e. PR comments)
          action: "upload"
          ###### Repository/Build Configurations - These values can be configured to match your app requirements. ######
          # For more information regarding Static Web App workflow configurations, please visit: https://aka.ms/swaworkflowconfig
          app_location: "./mksite.client" # App source code path
          api_location: "./mksite.Server" # Api source code path - optional
          output_location: "dist" # Built app content directory - optional
          ###### End of Repository/Build Configurations ######

This is the vite.config.ts file:
const target = env.ASPNETCORE_HTTPS_PORT ? `https://localhost:${env.ASPNETCORE_HTTPS_PORT}` :
    env.ASPNETCORE_URLS ? env.ASPNETCORE_URLS.split(';')[0] : 'https://localhost:7012';

export default defineConfig({
    build: {
        watch: null
    },
    plugins: [plugin(), basicSsl()],
    resolve: {
        alias: {
            '@': fileURLToPath(new URL('./src', import.meta.url))
        }
    },
    server: {
        proxy: {
            '^/experience':{
                target,
                secure: false
            },
            '^/about':{
                target,
                secure: false
            }
        },
        port: 5173
    }
})

The .esproj file:
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.VisualStudio.JavaScript.Sdk/1.0.1184077">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <StartupCommand>npm run dev</StartupCommand>
    <JavaScriptTestRoot>src\</JavaScriptTestRoot>
    <JavaScriptTestFramework>Jest</JavaScriptTestFramework>
    <!-- Allows the build (or compile) script located on package.json to run on Build -->
    <ShouldRunBuildScript>false</ShouldRunBuildScript>
    <!-- Folder where production build objects will be placed -->
    <BuildOutputFolder>$(MSBuildProjectDirectory)\dist</BuildOutputFolder>
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>

And finally the error, which occurs once dotnet is installed and the app is run from the server:

It says it can't find the npm run build command, which is not an issue I am seeing locally or when I run the app on a VM with Docker. I did see something similar when I had the wrong version of node installed when running the server but I don't know enough about Azure to troubleshoot.
Any suggestions?

The project keeps failing -- here are the current workflow file configurations:

    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

      - uses: actions/checkout@v3

        with:
          dotnet-version: 8.0.402
      - name: Setup Node
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4

        uses: Azure/static-web-apps-deploy@v1
        with:
          azure_static_web_apps_api_token: ${{ secrets.AZURE_STATIC_WEB_APPS_API_TOKEN_GREEN_MUSHROOM_0A9558C1E }}
          repo_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }} # Used for Github integrations (i.e. PR comments)

This is the vite.config.ts file:
const target = env.ASPNETCORE_HTTPS_PORT ? `https://localhost:${env.ASPNETCORE_HTTPS_PORT}` :
    env.ASPNETCORE_URLS ? env.ASPNETCORE_URLS.split(';')[0] : 'https://localhost:7012';

It says it can't find the npm run build command, which is not an issue I am seeing locally or when I run the app on a VM with Docker. I did see something similar when I had the wrong version of node installed when running the server but I don't know enough about Azure to troubleshoot.
Any suggestions?

llm_zero_shot_title: "npm: not found" error when deploying .NET Core app to Azure App Service using Oryx build system
llm_zero_shot_body:
I am trying to deploy my ASP.NET Core application to Azure App Service, but the build is failing with the following error:

```
/bin/sh: 2: /tmp/MSBuildTemproot/tmp1ae44ba6a125402c9a1df2a4beabcacf.exec.cmd: npm: not found
/var/nuget/microsoft.visualstudio.javascript.sdk/1.0.1184077/Sdk/Sdk.targets (312,5): error MSB3073: The command "npm run build" exited with code 127. [/github/workspace/mksite.client/mksite.client.esproj] | 1 |
Please build your app locally before publishing. | https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/app-service/configure-language-dotnetcore?pivots=platform-linux
```

It seems like `npm` is not found during the build process. However, I have Node.js and npm installed locally, and the build works fine on my machine.

**Expected behavior:**

The build should succeed, and the application should be deployed to Azure App Service.

**Actual behavior:**

The build fails with the error message above.

**What I have tried:**

* I have verified that Node.js and npm are installed on my local machine.
* I have tried restarting my computer and rebuilding the application.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

I am trying to publish my .NET Core application to my local server using the command `dotnet publish` but I am getting an error. The error message says "The command "npm run build" exited with code 27." I have tried building my app locally before publishing but I am still getting the same error.

The error message also says "Microsoft.WebTools.BrowserLink.targets(412,5): error MSB3073" but I am not sure what this means.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

llm_cot_body:
I am trying to deploy my ASP.NET Core application to Azure App Service, but the build is failing with the following error message:

```
/bin/sh: 2: /tmp/MSBuildTemproot/tmp1ae44ba6a125402c9a1df2a4beabcacf.exec.cmd: npm: not found
/var/nuget/microsoft.visualstudio.javascript.sdk/1.0.1184077/Sdk/Sdk.targets (312,5): error MSB3073: The command "npm run build" exited with code 127. [/github/workspace/mksite.client/mksite.client.esproj] | 1 |
Please build your app locally before publishing. | https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/app-service/configure-language-dotnetcore?pivots=platform-linux
```

It seems like the build process cannot find `npm`, which I need to build my frontend project. I have confirmed that `npm` is installed locally and I can build the project without any issues on my machine.

I have tried the following:

* Restarting the App Service
* Redeploying the application
* Running `npm install` manually on the Kudu console

However, the error persists.

What could be causing this issue and how can I resolve it?

Title: LINQPad 8 Dump Property Order different that LINQPad 5
Title_Body:
<<LINQPad 8 Dump Property Order different that LINQPad 5>>
<<In LINQPad 5 with Linq-to-Sql DataContext, if I dump out a table.
Users.Take( 5 ).Dump();

The results pane has properties in order they were defined in the .dbml file, and thus in the order they were placed in the generated C# class.
In LINQPad 8 with EF Core DbContext objects, if I dump out the same table, the properties are always dumped in alphabetical order vs the order of property declaration in the scaffolded class.
Is there a way to make it dump based on order of declaration?
I saw post about Change order of dump properties which I could maybe implement, but would rather just get a default behavior of order properties appear in class.
Using reflection, if I do typeof( KAT.Camelot.DbContexts.Evolution.AWS.User ).GetProperties().Dump(); the order of the properties listed is in order of declaration.
Update: Screenshot of output and code.

Here is scaffolded class:
[Table("User")]
[Index("AuthID", "GroupKey", Name = "UniqueAuthID", IsUnique = true)]
[Index("Email", "GroupKey", Name = "UniqueEmail", IsUnique = true)]
public partial class User
{
    [Key]
    [Column("User_id")]
    public int Key { get; set; }

    
    /// <summary>
    /// Foreign Key to Group
    /// </summary>
    [Column("User_Group_id")]
    public int? GroupKey { get; set; }

    [Column("User_Authenticate_id")]
    [StringLength(100)]
    [Unicode(false)]
    public string? AuthID { get; set; }

    [Column("User_Register_id")]
    [StringLength(255)]
    [Unicode(false)]
    public string? RegisterID { get; set; }

    [Column("User_Profile", TypeName = "text")]
    public string? Profile { get; set; }

    [Column("User_Email")]
    [StringLength(200)]
    [Unicode(false)]
    public string? Email { get; set; }

    [Column("User_Pin")]
    [StringLength(100)]
    [Unicode(false)]
    public string? Pin { get; set; }

    [Column("User_Timeout", TypeName = "datetime")]
    public DateTime? Timeout { get; set; }

    [Column("Create_Date", TypeName = "datetime")]
    public DateTime? CreateDate { get; set; }

    [Column("Mod_Date", TypeName = "datetime")]
    public DateTime? UpdateDate { get; set; }

    
    /// <summary>
    /// Date user last logged onto the system.
    /// </summary>
    [Column("User_LastOn", TypeName = "smalldatetime")]
    public DateTime? LastOnDate { get; set; }

    
    /// <summary>
    /// Whether or not the user can log onto the system.
    /// </summary>
    [Column("User_Active")]
    public bool? Active { get; set; }

    [Column("userPasswordExpire", TypeName = "smalldatetime")]
    public DateTime? PasswordExpire { get; set; }

    [Column("uFailureCount")]
    public int? FailureCount { get; set; }

    [Column("userAdmin")]
    public bool? Admin { get; set; }

    
    /// <summary>
    /// The 'AuthID' the admin will use to sign in with (if not same as real auth id - use when people are both participants and admins)
    /// </summary>
    [Column("uAdminAuthID")]
    [StringLength(255)]
    [Unicode(false)]
    public string? AdminAuthID { get; set; }

    [Column("User_Token")]
    [StringLength(50)]
    [Unicode(false)]
    public string? Token { get; set; }

    
    /// <summary>
    /// If this matches cookie in users browser then they can autologon.
    /// </summary>
    [Column("User_AutoLogon")]
    [StringLength(50)]
    [Unicode(false)]
    public string? AutoLogon { get; set; }

    [Column("uStayLoggedIn")]
    public bool? StayLoggedIn { get; set; }

    [Column("uProcessed")]
    public bool? Processed { get; set; }

    [Column("uIVRPin")]
    [StringLength(20)]
    [Unicode(false)]
    public string? IVRPin { get; set; }

    [Column("uEmailReset")]
    [StringLength(200)]
    [Unicode(false)]
    public string? EmailReset { get; set; }

    [Column("uSingleSignOnID")]
    [StringLength(100)]
    [Unicode(false)]
    public string? SingleSignOnID { get; set; }

    [Column("uAuthenticatorKey")]
    [StringLength(15)]
    [Unicode(false)]
    public string? AuthenticatorKey { get; set; }

    [Column("uMobileNumber")]
    [StringLength(15)]
    [Unicode(false)]
    public string? MobileNumber { get; set; }

    [Column("uAuthenticatorGrace")]
    public int? AuthenticatorGrace { get; set; }

    [ForeignKey("GroupKey")]
    [InverseProperty("Users")]
    public virtual Group? Group { get; set; }

    [InverseProperty("User")]
    public virtual ICollection<Preference> Preferences { get; set; } = new List<Preference>();
}

>>
llm_zero_shot_title: C# - LINQ Select new object with Property Type and Name from Existing Object
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<C# - LINQ Select new object with Property Type and Name from Existing Object>>
<<## C# Select Statement Returning Unexpected PropertyType

I'm trying to get a list of properties and their types for a user object using C# reflection. I'm expecting the `PropertyType` to be the actual type of the property, but instead, I'm getting `typeof( ... )` for each property.

Here's my code:

```csharp
var aws = await DbContexts.AWSAsync();
var user = await aws.Users.FirstAsync();
new[] {
    new {
        user,
        properties = user.GetType().GetProperties().Select(p => new { p.Name, p.PropertyType })
    }
}.Dump();
```

This is the output I'm getting in LINQPad:

[Image of LINQPad output showing user object and properties with "typeof" before each property type]

As you can see, the `PropertyType` column shows `typeof(Int32)`, `typeof(String)`, etc. instead of just `Int32`, `String`. 

How can I get the actual type of the property instead of `typeof`?>>

llm_cot_title: How to Select Specific Properties from a User Object in C#?
llm_cot_combined:
<<How to Select Specific Properties from a User Object in C#?>>
<<I'm trying to retrieve user properties and their data types using reflection in a C# project. I'm using LINQPad to test my code.

Here's the code I'm using:

```csharp
var aws = await DbContexts.AWSAsync();
var user = await aws.Users.FirstAsync();
new[] {
    new {
        user,
        properties = user.GetType().GetProperties().Select(p => new { p.Name, p.PropertyType })
    }
}.Dump();
```

This code successfully retrieves the user object and a list of its properties with their data types. However, I'm facing an issue with the `Preferences` property. It's of type `ICollection<Preference>`, but I'm only getting the type information and not the actual values within the collection.

**Expected Output:**

I want to see the values stored within the `Preferences` collection, similar to how other properties like `Email` and `AuthID` are displayed.

**Question:**

How can I modify my code to retrieve the values within the `Preferences` collection along with the other user properties?>>

Title: SyntaxError: Cannot use import statement outside a module ts-jest
Body:
I'm using TypeScript, ESM, npm, and ts-jest. Unfortunately, it seems that transformIgnorePatterns isn't working.
I've tried multiple configurations, but nothing has helped me run Jest with ts-jest successfully. The only workaround that worked was replacing imports with require directly in node_modules, but that's not a viable final solution.
the error is:

My package.json has "type": "module". I'm using npm workspaces, my setup in the root is very similar to the one in my child package:
jest.config.ts
export default {
  preset: 'ts-jest/presets/default-esm',
  testEnvironment: 'node',
  testMatch: ['**/*.spec.ts'],
  transform: {
    '^.+\\.tsx?$': ['ts-jest']
  },
  transformIgnorePatterns: ['/node_modules/(?!log-symbols|picocolors)']
};

ts.config.json
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "target": "ES2022",
        "module": "ESNext",
        "moduleResolution": "node",
        "declaration": true,
        "strict": true,
        "incremental": true,
        "esModuleInterop": true,
        "skipLibCheck": true,
        "forceConsistentCasingInFileNames": true,
        "composite": true,
        "types": ["node", "jest"],
        "allowImportingTsExtensions": true,
        "allowJs": true,
        "noEmit": true,
    },
    "ts-node": {
        "esm": true
    },
    "exclude": ["node_modules"]
}

I've tried various configurations with transformIgnorePatterns, target, and module values. The issue occurs not only with picocolors but also with chalk (versions 5 and 4).
Title_Body:
<<SyntaxError: Cannot use import statement outside a module ts-jest>>
<<I'm using TypeScript, ESM, npm, and ts-jest. Unfortunately, it seems that transformIgnorePatterns isn't working.
I've tried multiple configurations, but nothing has helped me run Jest with ts-jest successfully. The only workaround that worked was replacing imports with require directly in node_modules, but that's not a viable final solution.
the error is:

My package.json has "type": "module". I'm using npm workspaces, my setup in the root is very similar to the one in my child package:
jest.config.ts
export default {
  preset: 'ts-jest/presets/default-esm',
  testEnvironment: 'node',
  testMatch: ['**/*.spec.ts'],
  transform: {
    '^.+\\.tsx?$': ['ts-jest']
  },
  transformIgnorePatterns: ['/node_modules/(?!log-symbols|picocolors)']
};

ts.config.json
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "target": "ES2022",
        "module": "ESNext",
        "moduleResolution": "node",
        "declaration": true,
        "strict": true,
        "incremental": true,
        "esModuleInterop": true,
        "skipLibCheck": true,
        "forceConsistentCasingInFileNames": true,
        "composite": true,
        "types": ["node", "jest"],
        "allowImportingTsExtensions": true,
        "allowJs": true,
        "noEmit": true,
    },
    "ts-node": {
        "esm": true
    },
    "exclude": ["node_modules"]
}

I've tried various configurations with transformIgnorePatterns, target, and module values. The issue occurs not only with picocolors but also with chalk (versions 5 and 4).
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: "SyntaxError: Cannot use import statement outside a module" in Jest tests using TypeScript
llm_zero_shot_body:
## SyntaxError: Cannot use import statement outside a module in Jest test

I'm encountering a "SyntaxError: Cannot use import statement outside a module" error while running my Jest tests. The error seems to be triggered by an import statement in my `logger.ts` file.

Here's the relevant code snippet from `logger.ts`:

```typescript
// logger.ts
// import chalk from 'chalk';
import logSymbols from 'log-symbols';
import pc from 'picocolors';
```

And here's the error message and stack trace:

```
SyntaxError: Cannot use import statement outside a module

> 2 | import logSymbols from 'log-symbols';
    | ^
  3 | import pc from 'picocolors'
  4 | 
  5 | 

at Runtime.createScriptFromCode (../../node_modules/jest-runtime/build/index.js:1505:14)
at Object.<anonymous> (src/utils/logger.ts:2:1)
at Object.<anonymous> (src/execution-packages.ts:4:1)
at Object.<anonymous> (test/execution-packages.spec.ts:3:1)
```

I've tried enabling `esModuleInterop` in my `tsconfig.json` file, but the issue persists. I'm using Jest with Babel for transpilation.

**Expected behavior:** The import statement should work correctly, allowing me to use the imported modules in my tests.

**Actual behavior:** I'm getting a syntax error indicating that import statements are not allowed outside of modules.

What could be causing this issue and how can I resolve it?

Title: Typescript Polymorphic Component Event Handler
Title_Body:
<<Typescript Polymorphic Component Event Handler>>
<<I have written a strongly-typed Polymorphic Typescript React component that can accept any valid HTML tag.  I followed this example here: https://www.tsteele.dev/posts/react-polymorphic-forwardref.
// polymorphic component with forwarded ref thanks to
// https://www.tsteele.dev/posts/react-polymorphic-forwardref
// https://gist.github.com/kripod/4434e7cecfdecee160026aee49ea6ee8

import React, {
  forwardRef,
  useCallback,
  type ComponentPropsWithRef,
  type ElementType,
  type JSX,
  type JSXElementConstructor,
  type Ref,
} from 'react';

type IntrinsicAttributes<
  E extends keyof JSX.IntrinsicElements | JSXElementConstructor<any>,
> = JSX.LibraryManagedAttributes<E, ComponentPropsWithRef<E>>;

export interface BoxOwnProps<E extends ElementType = ElementType> {
  as?: E;
}

export type BoxProps<E extends ElementType> = BoxOwnProps<E> &
  Omit<IntrinsicAttributes<E>, keyof BoxOwnProps>;

export const Box = forwardRef(function Box(
  { as: Element = 'div', ...restProps }: BoxOwnProps,
  ref: Ref<Element>
) {
  const handleOnClick = useCallback((ev: HTMLElement) => {
    // 🚨 🚨  The type error is on the next line (see image)
    console.log(ev.currentTarget);
  }, []);

  return <Element ref={ref} onClick={handleOnClick} {...restProps} />;
}) as <E extends ElementType = 'div'>(props: BoxProps<E>) => JSX.Element;

For the handleOnClick callback, I assigned the event in the callback the HTMLElement type from @types/react-dom because it is the parent of all possible HTML dom elements and was generic enough to satisfy TypeScript.
But, I now specifically need access to the event.currentTarget property.

The only way I know of to make TypeScript aware of the currentTarget property is to change HTMLElement to a more specific type, like HTMLButtonElement. But that breaks polymorphism because the developer could pick a tag like "a" which means I would need to change the callback event type to HTMLAnchorElement
Is there a generic React Typescript type for HTMLElement that accepts a tag string?  Like HTMLElement<'button'>. I'm just not aware of a generic type that can allow me to set the event conditionally based on an HTML tag name.
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: TypeScript Error: Property 'currentTarget' does not exist on type 'HTMLElement' in event handler
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<TypeScript Error: Property 'currentTarget' does not exist on type 'HTMLElement' in event handler>>
<<## TypeScript error: "Property 'currentTarget' does not exist on type 'HTMLElement'"

I'm trying to access `ev.currentTarget` inside an event handler in my React component, but TypeScript is throwing an error:

```
Property 'currentTarget' does not exist on type 'HTMLElement'.
```

Here's the relevant code:

```typescript
export const Box = forwardRef(function Box(
  { as: Element = 'div', ...restProps }: BoxOwnProps,
  ref: Ref<Element>
) {
  const handleOnClick = useCallback((ev: HTMLElement) => {
    // do something
    console.log(ev.currentTarget); 
  }, []);

  return <Element ref={ref} onClick={handleOnClick} {...restProps} />;
}) as <E extends ElementType = 'div'>(props: BoxProps<E>) => JSX.Element;
```

I'm expecting `ev.currentTarget` to give me the element that the event listener is attached to. I'm not sure why TypeScript is complaining about this property not existing on `HTMLElement`. 

What am I doing wrong and how can I fix this error?>>
llm_few_shot_title: Property 'currentTarget' does not exist on type 'HTMLElement' in TypeScript React
llm_few_shot_combined:

<<I am working with a React project using TypeScript. I have a simple component where I need to log the `currentTarget` of a click event. However, I am getting a TypeScript error that says **Property 'currentTarget' does not exist on type 'HTMLElement'**.

This is the code snippet:
```typescript
const handleClick = useCallback((ev: HTMLElement) => {
  // do something
  console.log(ev.currentTarget);
}, []);
```

I have tried casting `ev` to `EventTarget`, but it didn't solve the issue. How can I access the `currentTarget` property of the click event in this case?>>

llm_cot_combined:
<<Property 'currentTarget' does not exist on type 'HTMLElement' in React TypeScript component>>
<<I'm encountering a TypeScript error in my React project that says "Property 'currentTarget' does not exist on type 'HTMLElement'". I'm trying to access `ev.currentTarget` inside an `onClick` handler, but it seems like TypeScript isn't recognizing it.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```tsx
export const Box = forwardRef(function Box(
  { as: Element = 'div', ...restProps }: BoxOwnProps,
  ref: Ref<Element>
) {
  const handleOnClick = useCallback((ev: HTMLElement) => {
    // do something
    console.log(ev.currentTarget); 
  }, []);

  return <Element ref={ref} onClick={handleOnClick} {...restProps} />;
}) as <E extends ElementType = 'div'>(props: BoxProps<E>) => JSX.Element;
```

I've tried searching for solutions, but I haven't found anything that directly addresses this issue. I'm not sure why `currentTarget` isn't recognized on the `HTMLElement` type. Any help would be greatly appreciated!>>

Title: Where to change the text color for tabs having modified files in PhpStorm?
Body:
In PhpStorm having the default Dark Theme, modified files are shown with a light blue color in the tabs' row.
I am customizing the color scheme via
Setting > Editor > Color Scheme > General
so that I can get more contrast, e.g.: have a strong highlight on the Selected Tab.
While I can change the background color of the Selected Tab, and have once the file is modified, the blue text color is used.
I assume the blue color stems from something indicating: Changed / Modified files.
Yet I cannot find where it comes from.

Title: Font-family from google fonts doesn't work in MJML
Body:
I am having trouble with using a google font on mjml.io even though I followed the instructions.
I tried some fonts, only for test purposes, but only the second one works.
But the font I actually need to use is "Source Sans 3".
Seems like it only accepts fonts with a single word name?
The font I need to make work:

https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Source+Sans+3

The fonts I used for testing:

https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Itim
https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Itim&family=Karla+Tamil+Upright

llm_zero_shot_title: Google Fonts Not Rendering Correctly in MJML Email Template
llm_zero_shot_body:
## MJML font import not working for specific fonts

I'm trying to use custom fonts in my MJML email template, but some fonts are not being applied correctly. I've imported the fonts in the `<mj-head>` section using `<mj-font>`, and they work fine for "Source Sans 3", but not for "Itim" or "Karla Tamil Upright".

Here's my MJML code:

```html
<mjml>
  <mj-head>
    <mj-attributes>
      <mj-font name="Source Sans 3" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Source+Sans+3" />
      <mj-font name="Itim" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Itim" />
      <mj-font name="Karla Tamil Upright" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Itim&family=Karla+Tamil+Upright" />
    </mj-attributes>
    <mj-text font-family="Inter, Arial" /> 
  </mj-head>
  <mj-body width="1000">
    <mj-section>
      <mj-column>
        <mj-text font-size="66px" color="#123021" font-family="Source Sans 3">Olá, Seja Bem-Vindo(a)</mj-text>
        <mj-divider border-color="#F45E43"></mj-divider>
        <mj-text font-size="20px" color="#F45E43" font-family="Itim">Whereas disregard and contempt for human rights have resulted</mj-text>
        <mj-text font-size="20px" color="#F45E43" font-family="Karla Tamil Upright">Whereas disregard and contempt for human rights have resulted</mj-text>
      </mj-column>
    </mj-section>
  </mj-body>
</mjml>
```

**Expected behavior:**

All three fonts ("Source Sans 3", "Itim", and "Karla Tamil Upright") should be applied correctly to the respective text elements.

**Actual behavior:**

* "Source Sans 3" is applied correctly.
* "Itim" and "Karla Tamil Upright" are not applied, and the text defaults to a generic font.

I've checked the font URLs, and they seem to be correct. What could be causing this issue, and how can I fix it?

```html

      <mj-column>
        <mj-text font-size="66px" color="#123021" font-family="Source Sans 3">Olá, Seja Bem-Vindo(a)</mj-text>
        <mj-divider border-color="#F45E43"></mj-divider>
        <mj-text font-size="20px" color="#F45E43" font-family="Itim">Whereas disregard and contempt for human rights have resulted</mj-text>
        <mj-text font-size="20px" color="#F45E43" font-family="Karla Tamil Upright">Whereas disregard and contempt for human rights have resulted</mj-text>
      </mj-column>
    </mj-section>
  </mj-body>
</mjml>
```

The "Source Sans 3" font seems to be working, but the "Itim" and "Karla Tamil Upright" fonts are not rendering as expected. I've double-checked the font names and URLs, and they appear to be correct.

I've tried using different font formats (e.g., .ttf, .woff) and importing them from different sources, but the issue persists. I'm not seeing any error messages in the console.

What could be causing this issue, and how can I resolve it to ensure my custom fonts render correctly in my MJML email?>>

Title: How to Reduce Verbosity of IntelliSense for Node.js in VS Code?
Body:
I'm using Visual Studio Code to write Node.js code, and the IntelliSense suggestions for Node’s core modules are extremely verbose.
For example, when I write:
const http = require('http');

http.createServer();

and hover over createServer(), I get the following IntelliSense output:
function createServer<typeof http.IncomingMessage, typeof http.ServerResponse>(requestListener?: http.RequestListener<typeof http.IncomingMessage, typeof http.ServerResponse>): http.Server<typeof http.IncomingMessage, typeof http.ServerResponse> (+1 overload)


This verbose suggestion makes it difficult to read the method’s basic structure.
I would like IntelliSense to show a simplified version, such as:
function createServer(requestListener?: (request: IncomingMessage, response: ServerResponse) => void): Server

I've already tried configuring "typescript.inlayHints" settings and adding a jsconfig.json file to simplify IntelliSense, but it hasn't had the desired effect.
Question: Is there a way to adjust VS Code settings or install specific plugins to reduce IntelliSense verbosity for Node.js functions, specifically to show only essential information?
Title_Body:

This verbose suggestion makes it difficult to read the method’s basic structure.
I would like IntelliSense to show a simplified version, such as:

I've already tried configuring "typescript.inlayHints" settings and adding a jsconfig.json file to simplify IntelliSense, but it hasn't had the desired effect.
Question: Is there a way to adjust VS Code settings or install specific plugins to reduce IntelliSense verbosity for Node.js functions, specifically to show only essential information?
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Node.js http.createServer - requestListener type error despite being optional?
llm_zero_shot_body:
## TypeScript error: Argument of type 'number' is not assignable to parameter of type 'http.RequestListener<...>'

I'm trying to create a simple HTTP server in TypeScript using the built-in `http` module. However, I'm getting a TypeScript error on the `server.listen()` method.

Here's my code:

```typescript
import * as http from 'http';
import * as routes from './routes';

const server = http.createServer(routes.handler);

server.listen(3000); // Error here
```

The error message is:

```
Argument of type 'number' is not assignable to parameter of type 'http.RequestListener<typeof http.IncomingMessage, typeof http.ServerResponse> | undefined'.
```

I understand that the `listen` method expects a `RequestListener` as an argument, but I'm not sure why it's complaining about the port number. I've tried passing the port as a string (`'3000'`) but that didn't work either.

What am I doing wrong? How can I fix this error and get my server to listen on the desired port?

Title: ExcelJS crashes unit tests in JEST
Body:
As you can see from the screenshot my unit test is crashing after I implemented exceljs.
Any idea how to fix it?
I have tried with
import * as ExcelJS from 'exceljs';

but it didn't help.
Also, tried with
 moduleNameMapper: {
   "ExcelJS": require.resolve('ExcelJS'),
   "uuid": require.resolve('uuid'), 
}

in jest.config.js, but it's still crashing

The suggested solution to modify the transformIgnorePatterns array in jest.config.js is not working because there is already line of modules and adding another line (array element) causes the conflict.

I'm trying to write some unit tests for my React application using Jest and I'm encountering a `SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'export'` when trying to import `exceljs`. I've tried various import statements, but nothing seems to work.

Here's my current Jest configuration:

```javascript
module.exports = {
  // ... other configurations
  transformIgnorePatterns: [
    // ... existing patterns
    '/node_modules/(?!exceljs)/' // Tried this, but didn't work
  ]
};
```

I've also seen suggestions to use Babel or other transpilers, but I'd prefer to avoid adding more complexity to my setup if possible.

What could be causing this error and how can I fix it?>>

llm_cot_body:
## Jest throws "SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'export'" when importing 'exceljs'

I'm trying to write unit tests for a React component that uses the `exceljs` library. However, when I run my tests with Jest, I get the following error:

```
SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'export'

  29 | import ExcelJS from 'exceljs';
      | ^^^^^^
```

The error seems to be coming from the `exceljs` library itself, specifically from the `dist/esm-browser/index.js` file. I've tried adding `exceljs` to the `transformIgnorePatterns` option in my `jest.config.js` file, but that didn't solve the problem.

Here's my `jest.config.js` file:

```javascript
module.exports = {
  // ... other configurations
  transformIgnorePatterns: [
    'node_modules/(?!(exceljs)/)'
  ],
};
```

I'm using the following versions:

* `exceljs`: 4.3.0
* `jest`: 27.5.1
* `babel-jest`: 27.5.1

I've also tried clearing the Jest cache and reinstalling my node modules, but the error persists.

How can I resolve this error and get my tests running with `exceljs`?

Title: Error 500 while deploying Prisma on Vercel
Title_Body:
<<Error 500 while deploying Prisma on Vercel>>
<<I am deploying my build on Vercel. It is working fine locally but when I build it on Vercel, I am getting an error when I try to access my database through Prisma:
"Request failed with status code 500"

Below you'll see my API route.ts file :
import { db } from "@/lib/db";
import { Prisma } from '@prisma/client'
import { NextResponse } from "next/server";


export async function POST (req : Request, ) 
{
    try 
    {
        const { email } = await req.json();
        const contact = await db.contact.create({data: {email}})
        return NextResponse.json(contact);
    } 

    catch (error) 
    {
        if (error instanceof Prisma.PrismaClientKnownRequestError) 
        {
            console.log("[CONTACT]", "Email déjà existant");
            return NextResponse.json({message: "Email déjà existant" }, {status : 520});
        }
        else { 
            console.log("[CONTACT]", error);
            return NextResponse.json({message: "Erreur de serveur" }, {status : 500});
        }
    }
}

Below you'll see my db.ts file :
// In Pre-Production ⬇️

/* 
import { PrismaClient } from "@prisma/client";
declare global {var prisma: PrismaClient | undefined;};
export const db = globalThis.prisma || new PrismaClient();
if (process.env.NODE_ENV !== "production") globalThis.prisma = db;
*/

// In production ⬇️

import { PrismaClient } from "@prisma/client";
export const db = new PrismaClient();

// Prisma Studio
// >>> npx prisma studio

I also include my schema.prisma file :
generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider      = "cockroachdb"
  url           = env("DATABASE_URL")
  relationMode  = "prisma"
}

model Contact {
  email     String   @id @unique
  creation  DateTime @default(now())
}

To solve this issue, here is what I've tried so far :

I updated my code in db.ts file by adding the "production" part (which didn't work)
In the package.json file I added a postinstall command whithin the script section

"scripts": {
    "postinstall": "prisma generate"
  }

Any idea on how to solve this issue?
>>

llm_zero_shot_title: FastAPI POST Request Returning 422 Unprocessable Entity: "Input should be a valid dictionary or object to extract fields from"
llm_zero_shot_body:
## 422 Unprocessable Entity when sending POST request with JSON data

I'm trying to send a POST request to an API endpoint (`/upload`) using `curl`. The API is built with Python and FastAPI. I'm sending a JSON payload with a list of dictionaries, but I'm getting a `422 Unprocessable Entity` error.

**Here's my curl command:**

```bash
curl -X 'POST' \
'http://127.0.0.1:8000/upload' \
-H 'accept: application/json' \
-H 'Content-Type: multipart/form-data' \
-F 'files=@github_access_token.txt;type=text/plain' \
-F 'params={"data":[{"name":"string", "header_exists":true, "rows_to_skip":0}]}'
```

**Here's the error response:**

```json
{
  "detail": [
    {
      "type": "model_attributes_type",
      "loc": [
        "body",
        "params"
      ],
      "msg": "Input should be a valid dictionary or object to extract fields from",
      "input": "{\"data\":[{\"name\":\"string\",\"header_exists\":true,\"rows_to_skip\":0}]}"
    }
  ]
}
```

**Expected behavior:**

The API should successfully process the JSON data and return a success response.

**Actual behavior:**

The API returns a `422 Unprocessable Entity` error, indicating that the provided JSON data is not in the expected format.

I've double-checked the JSON format, and it seems valid. I'm not sure why the API is rejecting it. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

llm_cot_title: FastAPI 422 Unprocessable Entity - Input should be a valid dictionary or object
llm_cot_body:
I am getting a 422 Unprocessable Entity error when trying to upload a file to my FastAPI backend using curl. The error message says "Input should be a valid dictionary or object to extract fields from", but I believe I am sending a dictionary in the 'params' form field.

Here is my curl command:

```bash
curl -X 'POST' \
'http://127.0.0.1:8000/upload' \
-H 'accept: application/json' \
-H 'Content-Type: multipart/form-data' \
-F 'files=@github_access_token.txt;type=text/plain' \
-F 'params={"data":[{"name":"string", "header_exists":true, "rows_to_skip":0}]}'
```

And here is the response body:

```json
{
  "detail": [
    {
      "type": "model_attributes_type",
      "loc": [],
      "body": "params",
      "msg": "Input should be a valid dictionary or object to extract fields from",
      "input": "{\"data\":[{\"name\":\"string\",\"header_exists\":true,\"rows_to_skip\":0}]}"
    }
  ]
}
```

I have tried different ways of formatting the JSON in the 'params' field, including escaping quotes, but nothing seems to work. I am using the latest version of FastAPI.

What am I doing wrong? How can I correctly format the 'params' field to be a valid dictionary for my FastAPI endpoint?
llm_cot_combined:
<<FastAPI 422 Unprocessable Entity - Input should be a valid dictionary or object>>
<<I am getting a 422 Unprocessable Entity error when trying to upload a file to my FastAPI backend using curl. The error message says "Input should be a valid dictionary or object to extract fields from", but I believe I am sending a dictionary in the 'params' form field.

Here is my curl command:

```bash
curl -X 'POST' \
'http://127.0.0.1:8000/upload' \
-H 'accept: application/json' \
-H 'Content-Type: multipart/form-data' \
-F 'files=@github_access_token.txt;type=text/plain' \
-F 'params={"data":[{"name":"string", "header_exists":true, "rows_to_skip":0}]}'
```

And here is the response body:

```json
{
  "detail": [
    {
      "type": "model_attributes_type",
      "loc": [],
      "body": "params",
      "msg": "Input should be a valid dictionary or object to extract fields from",
      "input": "{\"data\":[{\"name\":\"string\",\"header_exists\":true,\"rows_to_skip\":0}]}"
    }
  ]
}
```

I have tried different ways of formatting the JSON in the 'params' field, including escaping quotes, but nothing seems to work. I am using the latest version of FastAPI.

What am I doing wrong? How can I correctly format the 'params' field to be a valid dictionary for my FastAPI endpoint?>>

Title: TigerGraph GraphQL query of relation edges or neighbor vertices in where argument does not work
Title_Body:
<<TigerGraph GraphQL query of relation edges or neighbor vertices in where argument does not work>>
<<I am trying to make a graphql query in Tigergraph that filters based on an edge or neighbor vertex, something like the following
query myQuery {
  myGraph {
    Comment(where: {created_To_User: {to: {id: {_eq: 10}}}}) {
      body
      created_To_User {
        to {
          id
        }
      }
    }
   }
}

That shows up the following issue:
{
“data”: null,
“errors”: [
“\nType Check Error in query (TYP-8017): line 5, col 50\nno type can be inferred for v.created_To_User\n”
]
}

Screenshot:

>>
llm_zero_shot_title: "Type Check Error" in GraphQL query - "no type can be inferred"
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<"Type Check Error" in GraphQL query - "no type can be inferred">>
<<## Type Check Error in query: "no type can be inferred for v.created_To_User"

I'm encountering a "Type Check Error" while executing a query. The error message states: 

```
"Type Check Error in query (TYP-8017): line 5, col 50
no type can be inferred for v.created_To_User"
```

Here is the query I'm trying to execute:

```
query a {
  mysql_tadabbor_development {
    Comment(where: {created_To_User: {to: {id: {_eq: 10}}}}) {
      body
      created_To_User {
        to {
          id
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect the query to execute successfully and return the `body` and `created_To_User.to.id` fields for comments where `created_To_User.to.id` is equal to 10.

**Actual Behavior:**

Instead, I'm getting the "Type Check Error" mentioned above. 

I'm not sure why the type for `v.created_To_User` cannot be inferred. I've checked my schema and everything seems to be defined correctly. 

Any help in understanding and resolving this error would be greatly appreciated.>>

Title: How to authenticate to MS Teams in a Cypress script?
Title_Body:
<<How to authenticate to MS Teams in a Cypress script?>>
<<I wrote a script to log into the MS Teams web site. Unfortunately I am getting an error see the picture in this part of the code:
        // 1. Visit page with error handling
        cy.log('👉 Step 1: Visiting Teams');
        cy.visit('https://teams.microsoft.com', {
            timeout: 30000,
            failOnStatusCode: false,
            onBeforeLoad: (win) => {
                cy.log('🔄 Page starting to load');
            },
            onLoad: (win) => {
                cy.log('✅ Page loading');
            }
        });

How can I achieve this kind of authentication? I'm trying to solve it with a token login, but so far without success.

>>
llm_zero_shot_title: CypressError: Cypress detected that you return commands in that promise - cy.visit() inside cy.log() causing error
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<CypressError: Cypress detected that you return commands in that promise - cy.visit() inside cy.log() causing error>>
<<## CypressError: Cypress detected that you return commands in that promise

I'm getting a "CypressError: Cypress detected that you return commands in that promise" error when trying to visit a URL and then log a message in the `onBeforeLoad` event. I understand that Cypress commands are promise-like, but I'm not sure how to structure my code to avoid this error.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```javascript
cy.log(' Krok 1: Navštěvuji Teams');
cy.visit('https://teams.microsoft.com', {
  timeout: 30000,
  failOnStatusCode: false,
  onBeforeLoad: (win) => {
    // Code to be executed before the page loads
    cy.log('Page is about to load'); 
  }
});
```

**Expected behavior:**

I expect the code to:

1. Log "Krok 1: Navštěvuji Teams" to the console.
2. Visit the specified URL.
3. Log "Page is about to load" to the console before the page loads.

**Actual behavior:**

The code throws the "CypressError: Cypress detected that you return commands in that promise" error.

How can I correctly use `cy.log` within the `onBeforeLoad` event handler without encountering this error?>>
llm_few_shot_title: Cypress Error: Cypress detected that you returned commands in that promise
llm_few_shot_body:
I am encountering an error in my Cypress test suite that says "Cypress detected that you returned commands in that promise." This error occurs when I try to use `cy.visit()` inside a `cy.log()` command within a `beforeEach()` hook. I have verified that I am not returning any promises explicitly from the `beforeEach()` hook.

The error message specifically highlights the `cy.visit()` command as the source of the issue. It mentions that Cypress commands are already promise-like and should not be wrapped or returned within other promises.

How can I resolve this error and correctly use `cy.visit()` within my `beforeEach()` hook without encountering this promise-related issue?

llm_zero_shot_title: "zip END header not found" error during Gradle build in Android Studio
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Gradle build fails with "zip END header not found"

I'm trying to build my Android project but the Gradle build keeps failing with the following error:

```
Exception in thread "main" java.util.zip.ZipException: zip END header not found
at java.base/java.util.zip.ZipFile$Source.findEND(Unknown Source)
at java.base/java.util.zip.ZipFile$Source.initCEN(Unknown Source)
at java.base/java.util.zip.ZipFile$Source.<init>(Unknown Source)
at java.base/java.util.zip.ZipFile$Source.get(Unknown Source)
at java.base/java.util.zip.ZipFile$CleanableResource.<init>(Unknown Source)
at java.base/java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
at org.gradle.wrapper.Install.unzip(Install.java:214)
at org.gradle.wrapper.Install.access$600(Install.java:27)
at org.gradle.wrapper.Install$1.call(Install.java:74)
at org.gradle.wrapper.Install$1.call(Install.java:48)
at org.gradle.wrapper.ExclusiveFileAccessManager.access(ExclusiveFileAccessManager.java:65)
at org.gradle.wrapper.Install.createDist(Install.java:48)
at org.gradle.wrapper.WrapperExecutor.execute(WrapperExecutor.java:128)
at org.gradle.wrapper.GradleWrapperMain.main(GradleWrapperMain.java:61)
Error: Gradle task assembleDebug failed with exit code 1
```

**Expected behavior:** The build should complete successfully.

**Actual behavior:** The build fails with the "zip END header not found" exception.

I have tried the following:

* Invalidate caches and restart Android Studio
* Clean and rebuild the project
* Delete the `.gradle` and `build` folders

However, the error persists. 

What could be causing this issue and how can I fix it?

Title: Configuring LSP to recognize TailwindCSS @apply directives in Vue scoped SCSS with LazyVim
Body:
I'm using LazyVim in a Vue project. In <style lang="scss" scoped> blocks, I keep getting an "Unknown at rule @apply" error for TailwindCSS @apply directives.
LSP configs active in this buffer (I found this via the Lspinfo command):
(vtsls, tailwindcss, volar)
I've tried setting css.lint.unknownAtRules = "ignore" but still seeing the issue. Is there a way to configure an LSP to recognize @apply in these scoped SCSS blocks?

Any help would be appreciated!

llm_zero_shot_title: "Unknown at rule @apply" error in Vue.js scoped styles with SCSS
llm_zero_shot_body:
## "@apply" directive throwing "Unknown at rule @apply" error in Vue.js component

I'm working on a Vue.js project using SCSS and I'm encountering an error when trying to use the `@apply` directive within a scoped style block. 

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```vue
<template>
  </template>

<style lang="scss" scoped>
.action-icon {
  @apply w-6 h-6;
  @apply rounded-full;
}
</style>
```

The IDE (Visual Studio Code) is highlighting both `@apply` lines with the following error:

> Unknown at rule @apply

**Expected behavior:**

The `@apply` directive should apply the corresponding Tailwind CSS utility classes (`w-6`, `h-6`, `rounded-full`) to the `.action-icon` class.

**Actual behavior:**

The IDE throws an "Unknown at rule @apply" error, and the styles are not applied.

**What I've tried:**

* I've verified that Tailwind CSS is correctly installed and configured in my project.
* I've tried restarting the development server and clearing the browser cache.

I'm unsure why the `@apply` directive is not recognized within the scoped style block. Any insights into what might be causing this issue and how to resolve it would be greatly appreciated.

Title: Why is my post method on laravel not active
Title_Body:
<<Why is my post method on laravel not active>>
<<This is my problem:

Why is my post going to laravel home?
This is my code:

Controller:

public function store(Request $request){
    $request->validate([
        'fullName' => 'required|string|max:100',
        'email' => 'nullable|email|max:100|unique:accounts,email',
        'password' => 'required|string|min:6|max:100',
        'phone' => 'nullable|string|max:10',
        'status' => 'nullable|string|max:25',
        'role' => 'nullable|string|max:10',
    ]);

    $account = new Accounts();
    $account->full_name = $request->fullName;
    $account->email = $request->email;
    $account->password = $request->password;
    $account->phone = $request->phone;
    $account->status = $request->status;
    $account->role = $request->role;
    $account->save();
    return response()->json($account, 201);  
}

This get method is active .
I want that my post method can create account on the database.
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: POST Request Returns 200 OK But HTML Instead of JSON Response - Laravel API Endpoint
llm_zero_shot_body:
I am sending a POST request to create a new account using Postman. The request seems successful with a 200 OK status, but instead of receiving a JSON response with the created account details, I am getting an HTML response that looks like a default Laravel welcome page.

**Request:**

```json
{
  "full_name": "Pham Tri Minh",
  "email": "minhmap@gmail.com",
  "password": "123456",
  "phone": "0123456789",
  "status": "active",
  "role": "1"
}
```

**Response:**

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">

    <title>Laravel</title>

    <!-- Fonts -->
    <link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.bunny.net">
    <link href="https://fonts.bunny.net/css?family=figtree:400,500,600&display=swap" rel="stylesheet" />

    <!-- Styles / Scripts -->
    <style>
        
    </style>
</head>
<body>

</body>
</html>
```

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect to receive a JSON response containing the details of the newly created account.

**Actual Behavior:**

I am receiving an HTML response that appears to be a default Laravel welcome page.

I have verified that the endpoint is correct and the request body is properly formatted. What could be causing this issue and how can I resolve it to get the expected JSON response?

```html
    <!-- Fonts -->

    <link href="https://fonts.bunny.net/css?family=figtree:400,500,600&display=swap" rel="stylesheet" />

    <!-- Styles / Scripts -->

    </style>
</head>

</body>

```

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect to receive a JSON response containing the details of the newly created account.

**Actual Behavior:**

I am receiving an HTML response that appears to be a default Laravel welcome page.

I have verified that the endpoint is correct and the request body is properly formatted. What could be causing this issue and how can I resolve it to get the expected JSON response?>>

Title: ChatGPT API request with type:image_url — error while downloading, invalid_image_url
Title_Body:
<<ChatGPT API request with type:image_url — error while downloading, invalid_image_url>>
<<I am sending a request to the ChatGPT API with the following content:
        'model' => 'gpt-4o',
        'messages' => [
            [
                'role' => 'user',
                'content' => array_merge(
                [
                    [
                        'type' => 'text',
                        'text' => $prompt
                    ]
                ],
                [
                    'type' => 'image_url',
                    'image_url' => [
                         'url' => $image_url
                    ]
                ]
                )
            ]
        ],
        'max_tokens' => 300
    ]);

My task is to define the contents of an image in a few words. And this task is performed perfectly, without problems. But the problem is in cases where at least 1 image is not available. In this case, I get an error:

I want to upload multiple images at once, but if at least 1 image fails to upload, the entire API response becomes an error. I need to get a separate result for inaccessible images so that all other images will continue to be processed. How can I do this? I have already tried editing the prompt and asking to report an error. Uploading images one at a time is an extreme solution, I would like all of them together.
>>

Title: How to add additional fields in model serializer in django ModelViewSet?
Title_Body:
<<How to add additional fields in model serializer in django ModelViewSet?>>
<<Cart Serializer classs
class CartSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    user = UserSerializer(read_only=True)
    menuitem = MenuItemSerializer(read_only=True)
    price = serializers.SerializerMethodField(method_name='calculate_price')
    menuitem_id = serializers.IntegerField(write_only=True)
    user_id = serializers.IntegerField(write_only=True)

    class Meta:
        model = Cart
        fields = ['id', 'user', 'menuitem', 'quantity',
                  'unit_price', 'price', 'menuitem_id', 'user_id']
        validators = [
            validators.UniqueTogetherValidator(
                queryset=MenuItem.objects.all(),
                fields=('id',),
                message="Menuitem should be unique in this curt"
            ),
            validators.UniqueTogetherValidator(
                queryset=User.objects.all(), fields=('id'), message="User should be unique")
        ]

    def calculate_price(self, item: Cart):
        print(item.unit_price * item.quantity)
        return item.unit_price * item.quantity

add_cart method in CartItemsViewSet class
 @action(detail=True, methods=['post'])
    def add_cart(self, request, pk=None):
        if request.user.is_authenticated:
            user = request.user
        else:
            return Response('User is not authenticated', 403)
        # print(request.data)
        # print(request.user.id)
        # user_id = user.id
        # menuitem_id = request.data['menuitem_id']
        # quantity = request.data['quantity']
        # unit_price = request.data['unit_price']
        # id = request.data['id']
        # pack_data = {'user_id': user_id, 'menuitem_id': menuitem_id,
        #              'quantity': quantity, 'unit_price': unit_price, 'id': id}

        serializer = serializers.CartSerializer(
            data=request.data)

        if serializer.is_valid(raise_exception=True):
            print(serializer.validated_data)
            serializer.save(user_id=user.id)
            return Response('Item is added successfully.', 201)

Cart Model
class Cart(models.Model):
    user = models.ForeignKey(User, on_delete=models.CASCADE)
    menuitem = models.ForeignKey(MenuItem, on_delete=models.CASCADE)
    quantity = models.SmallIntegerField(),
    unit_price = models.DecimalField(max_digits=6, decimal_places=2)
    price = models.DecimalField(max_digits=6, decimal_places=2)

    class Meta:
        unique_together = ('menuitem', 'user')

I want to implement a login user add a menu item to their cart. But the problem is that I do not add additional field 'user_id' when save the table with the serializer the following error message has been shown.
{
"user_id": [
"This field is required."
]
}

>>

Title: How to get accurate code coverage report using gcovr for MSYS2 MINGW64 Clang project?
Body:
I try to use gcovr tool to obtain code coverage of a C++ project built on Windows using MSYS2 MINGW64's Clang toolchain.
I've decided to use such setup to mimic how the project is built on the CI system.
The project consists of a test executable E (it uses GoogleTest framework) and two static libraries, L1 and L2, having the following dependencies: L1 -> L2; L1, L2 -> E.
It is build using CMake system.
When building for code coverage, at the very beginning of the whole process I append to all targets the following compiler flags (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS): -g --coverage -fPIC -O0 -fno-elide-constructors
Then, I generate code coverage report using the following command:
-- C:/msys64/mingw64/bin/gcovr.exe --html index.html --html-details -r <PROJECT_ROOT> --object-directory=<BUILD_DIR> --gcov-executable=llvm-cov gcov --merge-mode-functions=merge-use-line-min --exclude-unreachable-branches --exclude-function-lines --exclude-lines-by-pattern '^\s*\}?\s*$'
The first problem I've encountered is that for at least one source file some functions were found on multiple lines in the same file - what makes no sense to me, as e.g. gcovr reported one of such functions to start in L183 and L185, whereas it actually starts in L185 and L183 contains the closing brace of totally different function. I have no clue why I got this error, but managed to bypass it by using --merge-mode-functions=merge-use-line-min flag.
However, the resulting report is garbage. In particular, numerous empty lines as well as lines containing only comments/closing braces are marked as "not hit" what makes the output rather not useful.
Note that I've used --exclude-lines-by-pattern '^\s*\}?\s*$' flag, but for some reason it did not filter out the mentioned problematic lines.
Here is an excerpt from the generated report:

What should I do to make the results more accurate? Use different compiler/linker flags? A different coverage tool?
A different toolchain is not so feasible solution, as then I would have to constantly rebuild the whole project to switch between e.g. Clang <-> GCC.
I've tried to add -Xclang -fprofile-instrument=clang compiler flags to all build targets, but then the build process was stuck at linking my test executable E (or the process was slowed down, that I assumed it became staled; instead of completing let's say in 10-20 seconds, it did not finished even after a few minutes). 
[EDIT: It finished after some 15-20 minutes, with a long list of "undefined reference" errors occuring for GoogleTest library (libgtest.a) and related to elements of C++ standard library, e.g.:
C:/msys64/mingw64/bin/ld: lib/libgtest.a(gtest-all.cc.obj):C:/msys64/mingw64/include/c++/14.2.0/bits/stl_tree.h:1964: more undefined references to '__profc__ZNKSt8_Rb_treeINSt7__cxx1112basic_stringIcSt11char_traitsIcESaIcEEES5_St9_IdentityIS5_ESt4lessIS5_ESaIS5_EE14_M_lower_boundEPKSt13_Rb_tree_nodeIS5_EPKSt18_Rb_tree_node_baseRKS5_' follow 
]
Title_Body:

Then, I generate code coverage report using the following command:

llm_zero_shot_title: OpenCV Ellipse Eccentricity Calculation Returning 0.0 When Contour Has Fewer Than 5 Points
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<OpenCV Ellipse Eccentricity Calculation Returning 0.0 When Contour Has Fewer Than 5 Points>>
<<## OpenCV eccentricity calculation returns 0 when it should be 1

I'm trying to calculate the eccentricity of a line segment using OpenCV's `fitEllipse` function in C++. I'm expecting an eccentricity of 1 for a line, but the code is returning 0.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```c++
double computeEccentricity(const cv::Mat& objectMask)
{
    static constexpr auto MIN_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_TO_FIT_ELLIPSE{5}; // Required by OpenCV.

    if (cv::countNonZero(objectMask) < MIN_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_TO_FIT_ELLIPSE)
    {
        return 0.0;
    }

    std::vector<std::vector<cv::Point>> contours;
    cv::Mat tmp = objectMask.clone();
    cv::findContours(tmp, contours, cv::RETR_EXTERNAL, cv::ContourApproximationModes::CHAIN_APPROX_NONE);

    const auto& contour{contours[0]};
    // ... further calculations using the contour to determine eccentricity
}
```

I've verified that:

* `objectMask` contains a valid binary image of a line segment.
* The number of non-zero pixels in `objectMask` is greater than `MIN_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_TO_FIT_ELLIPSE`.

I'm using OpenCV 4.5.5. What could be causing this discrepancy in the eccentricity calculation?>>

However, I am encountering a runtime error (most likely a segmentation fault) at the line where I access `contours[0]`. I have checked that the `findContours` function executes successfully and the `contours` vector is not empty. What could be causing this error? Is there an issue with how I am accessing the first contour in the `contours` vector?

llm_cot_title: OpenCV eccentricity calculation returns 0 for both circles and lines when using cv::fitEllipse
llm_cot_combined:
<<OpenCV eccentricity calculation returns 0 for both circles and lines when using cv::fitEllipse>>
<<I'm trying to calculate the eccentricity of a contour in an image using OpenCV in C++. I'm basing my approach on the `regionprops` function in MATLAB, which defines eccentricity as "the ratio of the distance between the foci of the ellipse and its major axis length."

Here's the code I'm using:

```c++
double computeEccentricity(const cv::Mat& objectMask)
{
    static constexpr auto MIN_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_TO_FIT_ELLIPSE{5}; // Required by OpenCV.

    if (cv::countNonZero(objectMask) < MIN_NUMBER_OF_POINTS_TO_FIT_ELLIPSE)
    {
        return 0.0;
    }

    std::vector<std::vector<cv::Point>> contours;
    cv::Mat tmp = objectMask.clone();
    cv::findContours(tmp, contours, cv::RETR_EXTERNAL, cv::ContourApproximationModes::CHAIN_APPROX_NONE);

    const auto& contour{contours[0]};
    // Calculate eccentricity here
}
```

I've successfully extracted the contour of the object from the mask, but I'm not sure how to proceed with calculating the eccentricity. I've found some resources online that suggest fitting an ellipse to the contour and then calculating the eccentricity from the ellipse parameters, but I'm not sure how to implement this in OpenCV.

Can anyone provide guidance or code examples on how to calculate the eccentricity of a contour in OpenCV, specifically following the definition used by MATLAB's `regionprops` function?>>

Title: Laravel Octane Swoole exit() triggered when using with 24Slides/laravel-saml2 package for SSO
Body:
I'm having problem when using this package with Laravel 11 Octane running Swoole. As my debug, the problem occur when WSO2 IS authenticated and request to my /saml2/{uuid}/acs route (i use the default route generated by this package).
I recieved swoole exit. Is there any way to resolve this problem?

Laravel: 11
Octane: swoole
PHP: 8.2
WSO2 IS: 7.0.0

error page:

Below is what has been logged in laravel.log
[2024-10-30 22:36:55] local.DEBUG: [Saml2] Tenant resolved {"uuid":"07bb3477-fc64-49e3-851d-b9aac6c6bb20","id":4,"key":"identity-provider"}

[2024-10-30 22:36:55] local.ERROR: swoole exit {"exception":"[object] (Swoole\ExitException(code: 0): swoole exit at /var/www/vendor/onelogin/php-saml/src/Saml2/Utils.php:377)

I tried to use middlware for saml to redirect without header() and exit() but not any better than.

llm_zero_shot_title: Laravel & OneLogin php-saml: Swoole\ExitException - "swoole exit" on SAML Login Redirect
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Swoole\ExitException: swoole exit during SAML redirect

I'm integrating SAML authentication into my Laravel application using the OneLogin SAML toolkit. Everything seems to be working fine until the very end of the authentication process. After successful SAML login, I'm getting a `Swoole\ExitException: swoole exit` error instead of being redirected back to my application.

Here's the relevant code snippet from the `vendor/onelogin/php-saml/src/Saml2/Utils.php` file:

```php
header('Pragma: no-cache');
header('Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate');
header('Location: ' . $url);
exit(); 
```

The error occurs on the `exit();` line. 

**Expected behavior:**

After successful SAML login, the user should be redirected back to the application.

**Actual behavior:**

The application throws a `Swoole\ExitException: swoole exit` error.

I'm running my application on a Swoole server. I suspect that the `exit()` function might be causing issues within the Swoole environment. 

Any help on how to resolve this issue and achieve the expected redirect behavior would be greatly appreciated.

llm_cot_title: Swoole\ExitException thrown when using OneLogin PHP SAML library for redirect in Laravel application
llm_cot_body:
## Swoole\ExitException after SAML login redirect in Laravel 

I'm implementing SAML authentication in my Laravel application using the OneLogin toolkit. While the authentication process seems to work, I'm encountering a `Swoole\ExitException` with the message "swoole exit" immediately after the SAML response is received and a redirect is attempted.

The exception is thrown at line 377 of `vendor/onelogin/php-saml/src/Saml2/Utils.php`, which is simply `exit();` after setting the `Location` header for the redirect.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```php
header('Pragma: no-cache');
header('Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate');
header('Location: ' . $url);
exit(); 
```

I'm running PHP 8.2.25, Laravel 11.30.0, and using Swoole as the web server. 

I've verified that:

- The `$url` variable contains the correct redirect URL.
- The SAML response is successfully processed and validated.
- The exception occurs only when using Swoole; it works fine with PHP's built-in server.

I've tried disabling Swoole's coroutine features, but the issue persists. 

How can I prevent this `Swoole\ExitException` and allow the redirect to complete successfully after SAML login?

<<Swoole\ExitException thrown when using OneLogin PHP SAML library for redirect in Laravel application>>

The exception is thrown at line 377 of `vendor/onelogin/php-saml/src/Saml2/Utils.php`, which is simply `exit();` after setting the `Location` header for the redirect.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

I've tried disabling Swoole's coroutine features, but the issue persists. 

How can I prevent this `Swoole\ExitException` and allow the redirect to complete successfully after SAML login?>>

Title: Hiding indentation background colors on Python line continuations in Visual Studio Code
Body:
Is there a way to hide the indentation background colors when using Python line continuation in Visual Studio Code? In the following image, I want to keep the two indentation backgrounds to the left of the attributes, but remove (or even just lower the opacity of) the backgrounds directly under them that are part of the line continuation.

And ideal solution would work for line continuation with brackets () or [], and explicit line continuations with backslash e.g.,
example = ("example line "
           + "continuation")
explicit_example = "example line " \
                    + "continuation"

However, a solution that doesn't handle explicit line continuation
The relevant bit of my settings.json file currently look like this
{
    "workbench.colorCustomizations": {
        "editorIndentGuide.activeBackground1": "#fc13c5",
        "editorIndentGuide.background1": "#00e5ff",
    }
}
Title_Body:
<<Hiding indentation background colors on Python line continuations in Visual Studio Code>>
<<Is there a way to hide the indentation background colors when using Python line continuation in Visual Studio Code? In the following image, I want to keep the two indentation backgrounds to the left of the attributes, but remove (or even just lower the opacity of) the backgrounds directly under them that are part of the line continuation.

And ideal solution would work for line continuation with brackets () or [], and explicit line continuations with backslash e.g.,
example = ("example line "
           + "continuation")
explicit_example = "example line " \
                    + "continuation"

However, a solution that doesn't handle explicit line continuation

{
    "workbench.colorCustomizations": {
        "editorIndentGuide.activeBackground1": "#fc13c5",
        "editorIndentGuide.background1": "#00e5ff",
    }
}

>>
llm_zero_shot_title: How to properly format test input and expected output arrays in Python?
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Syntax Error when defining lists in Python

I am trying to define two lists within a class but I am getting a syntax error. I have checked the syntax multiple times and it seems correct to me. 

Here is the code snippet:

```python
self.tokens_test_input = [self.token_test_input01,
self.token_test_input02,
self.token_test_input03]
self.tokens_test_expected_output = [self.token_test_expected_output01,
self.token_test_expected_output02,
self.token_test_expected_output03]
```

I am expecting the code to create two lists: `self.tokens_test_input` and `self.tokens_test_expected_output`. Each list should contain three elements, which are other variables defined within the class.

However, I am getting a syntax error on the lines where I define the lists. I have tried different variations of the syntax, but nothing seems to work. 

What could be causing this syntax error and how can I fix it?

```python
self.tokens_test_input = [self.token_test_input01,
                           self.token_test_input02,

                                     self.token_test_expected_output02,

```

However, when I run my tests, I am getting an error. I believe the issue might be related to how I am defining the lists, specifically the use of  "self." before each list item. 

Could someone please help me understand why this might be causing an issue and how to correctly define these lists for my test cases?

<<What configuration should be used to obfuscate Angular 18 project with javascript-obfuscator ?
I am using package.json
{
  "name": "angular.dev",
  "version": "0.0.0",
  "scripts": {
    "ng": "ng",
    "start": "NG_BUILD_PARALLEL_TS=0 ng serve",

  },

    "@angular/common": "^18.0.0",
    "@angular/compiler": "^18.0.0",

    "aws-amplify": "^6.5.3",

  "devDependencies": {

    "@angular/compiler-cli": "^18.0.0",
    "javascript-obfuscator": "^4.1.1",
    "typescript": "~5.5.0",
    "webpack-cli": "^5.1.4"
  }
}

with Angular 18, javascript-obfuscator version 4.1.1 and @angular-builders/custom-webpack version 18.0.0
My angular.json file is
{
  "$schema": "./node_modules/@angular/cli/lib/config/schema.json",
  "version": 1,
  "newProjectRoot": "projects",
  "projects": {
    "first-app": {
      "projectType": "application",
      "schematics": {
        "@schematics/angular:component": {
          "inlineTemplate": true,

          "skipTests": true
        },
        "@schematics/angular:resolver": {
          "skipTests": true
        },
        "@schematics/angular:service": {
          "skipTests": true
        }
      },
      "root": "",
      "sourceRoot": "src",
      "prefix": "app",
      "architect": {
        "build": {
          "builder": "@angular-builders/custom-webpack:browser",
          "options": {
            "customWebpackConfig": {
              "path": "./webpack.config.js"
            },
            "main": "src/main.ts",
            "outputPath": "dist/first-app",
            "index": "src/index.html",
            "polyfills": [
              "zone.js"
            ],
            "tsConfig": "tsconfig.app.json",
            "inlineStyleLanguage": "scss",
            "assets": [
              {
                "glob": "**/*",
                "input": "public"
              }
            ],

              "src/styles.css"
            ],
            "scripts": []
          },
          "configurations": {
            "production": {
              "budgets": [
                {
                  "type": "initial",
                  "maximumWarning": "500kB",
                  "maximumError": "1MB"
                },
                {
                  "type": "anyComponentStyle",

                }
              ],

            },
            "development": {

          },

        },
        "serve": {

          },

        },

        }
      }
    }
  },
  "cli": {
    "analytics": false
  }
}

and webpack.config.js is

 ],

Title: HttpContext.Current.Session returns Null in .NET Framework v4.8
Title_Body:
<<HttpContext.Current.Session returns Null in .NET Framework v4.8>>
<<I am moving my .NET solution to a new server that uses VS2022 and .NET Framework 4.8. Originally my codebase was targetting .NET 4.5.2 (now eol) version.
So when I moved a copy of the codebase and opened the solution, VS asked for updating the codebase to .NET 4.8 and that's all updated. Once updating the codebase, session setting in web.config:
<system.web>
    <sessionState timeout="40" mode="InProc"/>
    <compilation debug="true" targetFramework="4.8"/>
    <httpRuntime targetFramework="4.5"/>
</system.web>

The GetSession method has a line of code:
HttpContext.Current.Session.Contents[Parameter].ToString();

which now returns NULL and errors with

Object reference not set to an instance of an object

Code:
 public string GetSession(string Parameter)
 {
     try
     {
         return HttpContext.Current.Session.Contents[Parameter].ToString();
     }
     catch (Exception e)
     {
         return "";
     }
 }


The exact same codebase works perfectly fine in the old server with .NET framework 4.5.2. Any help on how to fix this?

UPDATE:
the getsession gets called in the page_load event of the master file:
protected void Page_Load(object sender, EventArgs e)
{

    try
    {
        if (IsPostBack == false)
        {
            if (sss.GetSession(xxx_Session_Type.UserRole) != null)
            {
                UserRole();
            }
        }

        if (sss.GetSession(xxx_Session_Type.UserID) != "")
        {
            divLogin.Visible = true;
            lblWelcome.Text = sss.GetSession(xxx_Session_Type.UserName).ToString();
            //UpdateConfirmItSync();
        }
        else
        {
            divLogin.Visible = false;
        }
    }

>>

Title: ClosedXML and System.Memory Error in .NET 8: Anyone Solved This?
Body:
I’m migrating a project from .NET 4.8 to .NET 8. The ClosedXML library is compatible with .NET 8, but I’m encountering an error when using the XLWorkbook class. Despite installing System.Memory, the error still occurs, as shown in the image below. Has anyone experienced this issue or found a fix? Thanks in advance for any help!

I attempted to install and reference System.Memory in my .NET 8 project, expecting this to resolve the error thrown by ClosedXML when using the XLWorkbook class. Given that System.Memory is supposed to address compatibility issues related to memory management across versions, I anticipated that adding this package would allow ClosedXML to function as it did in .NET 4.8 without error
Title_Body:
<<ClosedXML and System.Memory Error in .NET 8: Anyone Solved This?>>
<<I’m migrating a project from .NET 4.8 to .NET 8. The ClosedXML library is compatible with .NET 8, but I’m encountering an error when using the XLWorkbook class. Despite installing System.Memory, the error still occurs, as shown in the image below. Has anyone experienced this issue or found a fix? Thanks in advance for any help!

I attempted to install and reference System.Memory in my .NET 8 project, expecting this to resolve the error thrown by ClosedXML when using the XLWorkbook class. Given that System.Memory is supposed to address compatibility issues related to memory management across versions, I anticipated that adding this package would allow ClosedXML to function as it did in .NET 4.8 without error
>>
