Title: @Autowired property not injected by Spring for unique value validator
Title_Body:
<<@Autowired property not injected by Spring for unique value validator>>
<<I'm creating an application using Spring Boot, where I've got Employee entity with email field that has to be unique for each of the created entities.
Given entity:
package com.example.restcrudapi.models;

import com.example.restcrudapi.validators.ShouldStartWith;
import com.example.restcrudapi.validators.UniqueEmail;
import jakarta.persistence.*;
import jakarta.validation.constraints.*;
import lombok.Getter;
import lombok.NoArgsConstructor;
import lombok.Setter;

@Entity
@NoArgsConstructor
@Table(name="employee")
@Getter
@Setter
public class  Employee {

    @Id
    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    @Column(name="id")
    private int id;

    @Column(name="first_name")
    @NotBlank(message = "First name is required")
    @Pattern(regexp = "^(?!\\s).*(?<!\\s)$",
            message = "First name must not start or end with whitespace")
    @ShouldStartWith("Max")
    private String firstName;

    @Column(name="last_name")
    @Pattern(regexp = "^(?!\\s).*(?<!\\s)$",
            message = "First name must not start or end with whitespace")
    private String lastName;

    @Column(name="email")
    @Pattern(regexp = "^[\\w-\\.]+@([\\w-]+\\.)+[\\w-]{2,4}$",
            message="value must meet email format criteria")
    @NotBlank(message="email is required")
    @UniqueEmail
    private String email;

    @Min(0)
    @Max(100)
    @Column(name="number_of_points")
    private int points;

    public Employee(String firstName, String lastName, String email, int points) {
        this.firstName = firstName;
        this.lastName = lastName;
        this.email = email;
        this.points = points;
    }

    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return "Employee {" +
                "id = " + id +
                ", first name = " + firstName + '\'' +
                ", last name = " + lastName + '\'' +
                ", email = " + email + '\'' +
                '}';
    }
}

UniqueEmail annotation code:
package com.example.restcrudapi.validators;

import jakarta.validation.Constraint;
import jakarta.validation.Payload;

import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
import java.lang.annotation.Target;

@Constraint(validatedBy = UniqueEmailValidator.class)
@Target({ ElementType.FIELD, ElementType.PARAMETER })
@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
public @interface UniqueEmail {
    public String message() default "employee with given email is already registered";
    Class<?>[] groups() default {};
    Class<? extends Payload>[] payload() default {};
}

UniqueEmailValidator
package com.example.restcrudapi.validators;

import com.example.restcrudapi.repositories.employee.EmployeeRepository;
import jakarta.validation.ConstraintValidator;
import jakarta.validation.ConstraintValidatorContext;
import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;

@Component
public class UniqueEmailValidator implements ConstraintValidator<UniqueEmail, String> {

    @Autowired
    private EmployeeRepository employeeRepository;

    @Override
    public boolean isValid(String email, ConstraintValidatorContext context) {
        if (email == null || email.isBlank()) {
            return true; // Let other annotations like @NotBlank handle null/empty cases
        }
        var isUniqueEmail = employeeRepository.existsByEmail(email);

        return isUniqueEmail;
    }
}

and EmployeeRepository
package com.example.restcrudapi.repositories.employee;

import com.example.restcrudapi.models.Employee;
import jakarta.transaction.Transactional;
import org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository;
import org.springframework.data.rest.core.annotation.RepositoryRestResource;

import java.util.Optional;

@RepositoryRestResource
@Transactional
public interface EmployeeRepository extends JpaRepository<Employee, Integer> {
    boolean existsByEmail(String email);
}

With REST endpoints set up by spring-boot-starter-data-rest.
When calling POST /myapi/employees with an example request body:
{
    "firstName": "This One",
    "lastName": "Should not pass",
    "email": "pepefi11221@re.co",
    "points": 21
}

I can see that employeeRepository in UniqueEmailValidator is not injected despite using @Component and @Autowired annotations, and remains null, resulting in NullPointerException and HV000028: Unexpected exception during isValid call in the HTTP response.

I've tried using @Service instead @Component, also tinkered a bit with @Bean, to no avail - the result is always the same.
How to make Spring Boot inject employeeRepository correctly?
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: **Spring Boot - NullPointerException in Custom Validator when accessing Autowired Repository**
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<**Spring Boot - NullPointerException in Custom Validator when accessing Autowired Repository**>>
<<## Spring Boot @Component with @Autowired Repository throws NullPointerException

I'm working on a Spring Boot project where I'm implementing a custom validator to check for unique email addresses during registration. I've created a `@Component` annotated class `UniqueEmailValidator` that uses an `@Autowired` `EmployeeRepository` to check if an email already exists.

However, when I test the registration process, I get a `NullPointerException` at the line where I call `employeeRepository.existsByEmail(email)`. It seems the `employeeRepository` is not being injected properly and remains `null`.

Here's my code:

**UniqueEmailValidator.java:**

```java
import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;

@Component
public class UniqueEmailValidator implements ConstraintValidator<UniqueEmail, String> {

    @Autowired
    private EmployeeRepository employeeRepository;

    @Override
    public boolean isValid(String email, ConstraintValidatorContext context) {
        if (email == null || email.isBlank()) {
            return true; // Let other annotations like @NotBlank handle null/empty cases
        }
        var isUniqueEmail = employeeRepository.existsByEmail(email); // NullPointerException here
        return isUniqueEmail;
    }
}
```

**Debugging Information:**

The IDE debugger shows that `employeeRepository` is `null` at the point of the exception.

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect the `employeeRepository` to be properly injected by Spring so I can use it to check for existing emails.

**Actual Behavior:**

A `NullPointerException` is thrown because `employeeRepository` is `null`.

**Question:**

What could be causing this `NullPointerException` and how can I ensure my `EmployeeRepository` is correctly injected into my `UniqueEmailValidator` component?>>

The most important part of the error is the fact that the debugger shows `employeeRepository = null` despite the `@Autowired` annotation. This suggests that the dependency injection is not working as expected.

Could there be a configuration issue or a problem with the way I am using Spring's dependency injection mechanism? Any help in resolving this issue would be greatly appreciated.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```java
@Component
public class UniqueEmailValidator implements ConstraintValidator<UniqueEmail, String> {

    @Autowired
    private EmployeeRepository employeeRepository;

    @Override
    public boolean isValid(String email, ConstraintValidatorContext context) {
        if (email == null || email.isBlank()) {
            return true; // Let other annotations like @NotBlank handle null/empty cases
        }

        var isUniqueEmail = employeeRepository.existsByEmail(email); // NullPointerException here

        return isUniqueEmail;
    }
}
```

The debugger shows that `employeeRepository` is `null` at the point of the exception. I've already verified that:

- `EmployeeRepository` is an interface extending `JpaRepository`.
- The `@Autowired` annotation is present.
- The validator class is annotated with `@Component`.

I've tried various solutions like:

- Using `@Repository` annotation on `EmployeeRepository`.
- Manually creating a bean for `EmployeeRepository`.
- Checking for circular dependencies.

However, the issue persists. What could be causing the `employeeRepository` to be `null` despite using `@Autowired`?>>

Title: How can I show an unauthorized view when HttpClient gets 403 from calling API in .NET Blazor Web Assembly?
Body:
Basically here is my scenario that I'm going to achieve: I have two users: A and B, A has the permission to access my Restful API developed with ASP.NET Core Web API, B doesn't have the permission to access that API resource (API will return 403) In my Blazor Web Assembly app, there is a page which will read data from this Restful API, so, I would like when A user logs in, s/he can access this page correctly, but when B logs in, since B doesn't have the access to the API, therefore, when the page is loading and reading data from API, the page will get 403 error and should instead show something like "You don't have permission to access the page" So, in the OnInitializedAsync method of the Blazor page, it uses injected IHttpClientFactory to create an HttpClient, and makes a call to the API: using var httpClient = HttpClientFactory.CreateClient("stickersHttpClient"); var httpResponseMessage = await httpClient.GetAsync($"api/stickers?page={pageNumber}&size={pageSize}"); httpResponseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCode(); var responseJson = await httpResponseMessage.Content.ReadAsStringAsync(); PageContent = JsonSerializer.Deserialize(responseJson); If it is user B who opens this page, the httpClient.GetAsync will definitely return 403 error, but instead of showing a "You don't have permission to view this page" error on the page, the page actually reported an error in the console: I have already applied @attribute [Authorize] on the page, and in the App.razor it has the following authorized view settings: @if (context.User.Identity?.IsAuthenticated != true) { } else {

You don't have permission to view this page.

} Not found

Sorry, there's nothing at this address.

 I think there should be some gap between the API and the page, there should be the way allowing my razor page to "know" about the 403 returned by the API so that it could apply the routed authentication view. But I don't know how can I do that. (By the way, the authorization of the user is done against Keycloak with the policy based on user roles)
Title_Body:
<> <(responseJson); If it is user B who opens this page, the httpClient.GetAsync will definitely return 403 error, but instead of showing a "You don't have permission to view this page" error on the page, the page actually reported an error in the console: I have already applied @attribute [Authorize] on the page, and in the App.razor it has the following authorized view settings: @if (context.User.Identity?.IsAuthenticated != true) { } else {

You don't have permission to view this page.

} Not found

Sorry, there's nothing at this address.

 I think there should be some gap between the API and the page, there should be the way allowing my razor page to "know" about the 403 returned by the API so that it could apply the routed authentication view. But I don't know how can I do that. (By the way, the authorization of the user is done against Keycloak with the policy based on user roles) >>

I'm working on a Blazor WebAssembly application and encountering a 403 (Forbidden) error when attempting to render a component. The error message specifically states:

> Unhandled exception rendering component: Response status code does not indicate success: 403 (Forbidden).

This error occurs within the `ReadStickersAsync` method on line 118 of my `Stickers.razor` component, which is called during the `OnInitializedAsync` lifecycle method on line 110.

**Stickers.razor:**

```razor
@page "/stickers"

@code {
    // ... other code ...

    protected override async Task OnInitializedAsync()
    {
        await ReadStickersAsync(1, 10); // Line 110
    }

    private async Task ReadStickersAsync(int pageNumber, int pageSize)
    {
        // ... code to make API request ... // Line 118
    }
}
```

I've verified that the API endpoint I'm calling requires authentication, and I'm handling authentication using JWT tokens. The token is included in the request headers.

**What I've tried:**

* Double-checked the API endpoint URL and request method.
* Confirmed that the JWT token is valid and being sent in the request headers.
* Tested the API endpoint independently and it returns the expected data when accessed with a valid token.

I'm unsure why I'm still receiving a 403 (Forbidden) error despite seemingly correct authentication. Any help in resolving this issue would be greatly appreciated.>>

Title: Why doesn't Android Studio recognize the dependencies for googleId
Title_Body:
<<Why doesn't Android Studio recognize the dependencies for googleId>>
<<I'm trying to build an app that uses Google sign in, but I get unresolved references errors for GoogleIdTokenCredential, GoogleIdTokenParsingException, and GetGoogleIdOption
in this code:
coroutineScope.launch {
    try {
        // Call to get credentials
        val result = credentialManager.getCredential(context, request)
        val credential = result.credential
        val googleIdTokenCredential = GoogleIdTokenCredential.createFrom(credential.data)
        val googleIdToken = googleIdTokenCredential.idToken

        // Pass the token to the ViewModel
        loginViewModel.registerUserWithGoogleId(username, password, googleIdToken)

    } catch (e: GetCredentialException) {
        Toast.makeText(context, e.message, Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
    } catch (e: GoogleIdTokenParsingException) {
        Toast.makeText(context, e.message, Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
    }
}

and this code
@Provides
@Singleton // Ensure a single instance is used throughout the app
fun provideGoogleIdOption(): GetGoogleIdOption {
    val rawNonce = UUID.randomUUID().toString()
    val bytes = rawNonce.toByteArray()
    val md = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-256")
    val digest = md.digest(bytes)
    val hashedNonce = digest.fold("") { str, it -> str + "%02x".format(it) }

    return GetGoogleIdOption.Builder()
        .setFilterByAuthorizedAccounts(false)
        .setServerClientId("MY_CODE")
        .setNonce(hashedNonce)
        .build()
}

Android gives me the option to add the dependencies and import, like in the picture I added.

But if I press on the suggestion, nothing happens. And if I try to add manually the dependencies that I have copy-pasted from the android developers page (https://developer.android.com/identity/sign-in/credential-manager-siwg), I get this error when I build my project
Caused by: org.gradle.api.internal.artifacts.ivyservice.DefaultLenientConfiguration$ArtifactResolveException: Could not resolve all files for configuration ':app:debugRuntimeClasspath'.

These are the dependencies I have copied in my code:
implementation("androidx.credentials:credentials:1.3.0")
implementation("androidx.credentials:credentials-play-services-auth:1.3.0")

implementation("com.google.android.libraries.identity.googleid:googleid:1.3.0")

I have invalidated cache and restarted and cleaned the project, but I still get the same errors.
So what must I do to make the dependencies from the documentation work in order to be permit my users to sign in with Google?
>>

llm_zero_shot_title: React - userGang.members array has a length of 2 but username and role are undefined for both elements
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<React - userGang.members array has a length of 2 but username and role are undefined for both elements>>
<<## React.js: Why are the objects in my array undefined?

I'm having trouble with an array of objects in my React project. The array itself seems to have the correct length, but the objects inside are all showing as `{username: undefined, role: undefined}`.

Here's the relevant code:

```javascript
// Gangs.js:89
console.log(userGang); 
// Output: {id: 31, name: 'elton john', leader_id: 25, user_id: 25, members: Array(2), ...}

console.log(userGang.members);
// Output: (2) [{...}, {...}]

// Gangs.js:90
console.log(userGang.members);
// Output: (2) [{username: undefined, role: undefined}, {username: undefined, role: undefined}]
```

As you can see, the `userGang` object seems to be structured correctly and the `members` array has the expected length of 2. However, when I try to access the individual objects within the `members` array, their properties (`username` and `role`) are all `undefined`.

**Expected behavior:**

I expect the `members` array to contain objects with defined values for `username` and `role`.

**Actual behavior:**

The `members` array contains objects with `undefined` values for `username` and `role`.

I've double-checked that the data being used to populate these objects is correct. What could be causing this issue and how can I fix it?>>

Title: Why is Next.js throwing Error: WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE is not a function?
Title_Body:
<<Why is Next.js throwing Error: WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE is not a function?>>
<<I'm unable to figure out the problem. I'm exporting a function that serves the current authenticated user object (if present). I'm then using this user object to determine the addition of a nav link. This error won't go away no matter how much I've reformed the reference.
This is the function definition @/app/hooks/use-auth-user.ts
'use client';
import {
    fetchAuthSession,
    fetchUserAttributes,
    getCurrentUser,
} from 'aws-amplify/auth';
import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function UseAuthUser() {
    const [user, setUser] = useState<Record<string, any>>();

useEffect(() => {
    async function getUser() {
        const session = await fetchAuthSession();
        if (!session.tokens) {
            return;
        }

        const user = {
            ...(await getCurrentUser()),
            ...(await fetchUserAttributes()),
            isAdmin: false,
        };

        const groups = session.tokens.accessToken.payload['cognito:groups'];
        // @ts-ignore
        user.isAdmin = Boolean(groups && groups.includes('administrators'));
        setUser(user);
    }

    getUser();
}, []);

return user;
}

And Here is the function that I'm referencing it from @/app/lib/menus.ts
import UseAuthUser from '@/app/hooks/use-auth-user';

export function getResourceMenu(): Menu {
const user = UseAuthUser();
let links: Menu = [
    { name: 'Privacy Policy', href: '/privacy' },
    { name: 'Terms & Conditions', href: '/terms-and-conditions' },
    { name: 'Member Portal', href: '/auth/login' },
];

if (user) {
    links.push({ name: 'Dashboard', href: '/dashboard' });
}

return links;
}

I'm attaching a screenshot of the error here:
Error: (0 , _app_hooks_use_auth_user__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__.default) is not a function


I'd love some input on where I'm going wrong here because obviously - I am.
>>

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```typescript

export function getResourceMenu(): Menu {
```

```typescript
}
```

I've already checked the following:

- I'm calling the hook at the top level of my component, not inside a loop or conditional statement.

Title: Why these 2 query have same execution plan?
Body:
I have 2 queries and one of them has an inner query.
I think the second one is faster because in the first query, first load all Genre second apply where condition and top 1 on it, but when execution plan obtained, both queries have the same cost.
anyone can explain?
SELECT TOP(1) *
FROM (
    selecT * from Movie.Genre 
) AS [e]
WHERE [e].[IsDeleted] = CAST(0 AS bit) AND [e].[LastEditDateTime] IS NOT NULL
go  

selecT TOP(1) * 
from Movie.Genre e
where  [e].[IsDeleted] = CAST(0 AS bit) AND [e].[LastEditDateTime] IS NOT NULL


i expect second query execute faster and has less cost.

llm_zero_shot_title: Why does using a subquery in SELECT statement cause higher query cost compared to direct table selection?
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Why does a subquery increase the cost of this simple SELECT statement?

I have two nearly identical SQL queries in SQL Server. The first uses a subquery, while the second selects directly from the table. Both queries have the same WHERE clause.

**Query 1 (with subquery):**

```sql
SELECT * 
FROM (SELECT * FROM Movie.Genre) AS [e] 
WHERE [e].[IsDeleted] = CAST(0 AS bit) 
  AND [e].[LastEditDateTime] IS NOT NULL
```

**Query 2 (direct select):**

```sql
SELECT * 
FROM Movie.Genre e 
WHERE [e].[IsDeleted] = CAST(0 AS bit) 
  AND [e].[LastEditDateTime] IS NOT NULL
```

The execution plan shows that Query 1 has a cost of 100%, while Query 2 has a cost of 0%. Both queries perform a Clustered Index Scan on the same index.

**Expected Behavior:**

I would expect both queries to have the same execution plan and cost since they are logically equivalent.

**Actual Behavior:**

The query with the subquery has a significantly higher cost.

**Question:**

Why does the subquery affect the query cost in this case? Is there a way to rewrite the query with the subquery to achieve the same performance as the direct select?
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<Why does using a subquery in SELECT statement cause higher query cost compared to direct table selection?>>

I have two nearly identical SQL queries in SQL Server. The first uses a subquery, while the second selects directly from the table. Both queries have the same WHERE clause.

**Query 1 (with subquery):**


Title: In VSCode language extension while comment toggling, comment indicator goes to 1 column left side from cursor pointer
Body:
I am creating a language extension, we don't use 1st column in this language purposely. So My language code start from 2nd column only. Now when I comment using "CTRL+/" (comment toggling) language code statement, Comment indicator (!) goes to first column (which is invalid in my language), my code shift by 1 column to right side.
I have to explicitly move comment indicator to 2nd column. then only comments are recognised by Textmate grammar. Please checkout the below image.

Is there a way to configure such thing in vscode language extension.

Title: VSCode move primary side bar to bottom (*not* the activity bar)
Body:
In VSCode, I want to move the primary side bar to the bottom, so that it's easier to use VSCode in a profile-oriented monitor. Is this possible either in the settings or with an extension?
Note that I am not talking about the activity bar. I'm talking about the primary side bar, as described here:

By default, the Primary Side Bar is located on the left of the workbench and shows views such as the Explorer, Search, and Source Control views


I want to use a profile-oriented monitor, but having the sidebar on the side takes up ~1/3 of my screen. It'd be much more economical to have it on the bottom.

Title: Run Roboelectric in Unit Testing and Most Efficient way to perform instrument test at physical device
Title_Body:
<<Run Roboelectric in Unit Testing and Most Efficient way to perform instrument test at physical device>>
<<I'm doing some old codelab on testing here, But in the codelab it uses Roboelectric in UnitTest folder, but when I run that it stuck on this part

Here's the code.
@RunWith(AndroidJUnit4::class)
class TasksViewModelTest {

    // Subject under test
    private lateinit var tasksViewModel: TasksViewModel

    // Executes each task synchronously using Architecture Components.
    @get:Rule
    var instantExecutorRule = InstantTaskExecutorRule()

    @Before
    fun setupViewModel() {
        tasksViewModel = TasksViewModel(ApplicationProvider.getApplicationContext())
    }


    @Test
    fun addNewTask_setsNewTaskEvent() {

        // When adding a new task
        tasksViewModel.addNewTask()

        // Then the new task event is triggered
        val value = tasksViewModel.newTaskEvent.getOrAwaitValue()
        assertThat(
            value.getContentIfNotHandled(), (not(nullValue()))
        )
    }

    @Test
    fun getTasksAddViewVisible() {

        // When the filter type is ALL_TASKS
        tasksViewModel.setFiltering(TasksFilterType.ALL_TASKS)

        // Then the "Add task" action is visible
        assertThat(tasksViewModel.tasksAddViewVisible.getOrAwaitValue(), `is`(true))
    }

}

Well I know that the purpose of the UnitTest is to run the test faster, I on the later codelab it stated that it's faster to mock / fake the repository and pass it to the viewModel rather than using context and instantiate the viewModel (which remove the AndroidJUnit4 test runner) and remove the roboelectric test that takes ages to run.

My question is that so does the Roboelectric fall into the Instrumented test (which belong to the AndroidTest folder) or the unitTest, because it seems I can't run the test because it hang indefinately.

Also my other question, is how to setup your physical device for instrument and end to end testing efficiently. In many cases, you need to install the app, activate the Display pop up windows while running background for each app and run the testing. Does there any alternative way of doing the instrument / end to end testing in the physical device?


Thanks for reading this. And It will probably my reminder to doing testing in the future
I look up at some SO question about running test on physical device, but none of that are satisfy my question.
>>

Title: PgAdmin4 unable to query or view data generated in a table by prisma
Title_Body:
<<PgAdmin4 unable to query or view data generated in a table by prisma>>
<<I am making use of prisma ORM to connect to my database and create table to read or write data to the table using postgres server. I was able to follow the prisma get started tutorial prisma-get-started and and successfully created 3 tables, when I use prisma-client to read data from the tables in my code it successfully return data for me.
My schema
DATABASE_URL="postgresql://jideotetic:Jideotetic012345$@localhost:5432/mini_message_board?schema=public"
generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model Post {
  id        Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  createdAt DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt DateTime @updatedAt
  title     String   @db.VarChar(255)
  content   String?
  published Boolean  @default(false)
  author    User     @relation(fields: [authorId], references: [id])
  authorId  Int
}

model Profile {
  id     Int     @id @default(autoincrement())
  bio    String?
  user   User    @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
  userId Int     @unique
}

model User {
  id      Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  email   String   @unique
  name    String?
  posts   Post[]
  profile Profile?
}

My index.ts
import { PrismaClient } from "@prisma/client";

const prisma = new PrismaClient();

async function main() {
    const allUsers = await prisma.user.findMany({
        include: {
            posts: true,
            profile: true,
        },
    });
    console.dir(allUsers, { depth: null });
}

main()
    .then(async () => {
        await prisma.$disconnect();
    })
    .catch(async (e) => {
        console.error(e);
        await prisma.$disconnect();
        process.exit(1);
    });

The response
[
  {
    id: 1,
    email: 'alice@prisma.io',
    name: 'Alice',
    posts: [
      {
        id: 1,
        createdAt: 2024-10-27T19:06:37.382Z,
        updatedAt: 2024-10-27T19:20:26.176Z,
        title: 'Hello World',

llm_zero_shot_body:
I am getting an "ERROR: relation "post" does not exist" error when trying to run a simple SELECT query in pgAdmin 4. I have verified that the table is named "Post" and it exists in the database.

**Here is the query:**

```sql
SELECT * FROM Post;
```

**Here is the error message:**

```
ERROR: relation "post" does not exist
LINE 1: SELECT * FROM Post;
SQL state: 42P01
Character: 15
```

**Things I have tried:**

* Refreshing the database connection
* Verifying the table name and schema

I am using PostgreSQL 17 and pgAdmin 4. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Title: docker-compose: Getting fe_sendauth: no password supplied in pgadmin:8.12
Body:
I have been trying to create a passwordless set-up for pgadmin with a postgres DB instance via docker-compose.
services:
  db:
    hostname: dbserv
    container_name: dbserv
    image: postgres:12-alpine
    restart: always
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: root
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: root
    ports:
      - "5432:5432"
    networks:
      - dbnet
    volumes:
      - db-data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
    extra_hosts:
      - "host.docker.internal:host-gateway"
    healthcheck:
      test: [ "CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready" ]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 30s
      retries: 5
      
  pgadmin:
    container_name: pgadmin
    image: dpage/pgadmin4:${PGADMIN_VERSION-8.12}
    restart: always
    environment:
      PGADMIN_DEFAULT_EMAIL: ${PGADMIN_EMAIL-admin@admin.com}
      PGADMIN_DEFAULT_PASSWORD: ${PGADMIN_PASSWORD-root}
    ports:
      - "5050:80"
    networks:
      - dbnet
    volumes:
      - pgadmin-data:/var/lib/pgadmin
      - ./servers.json:/pgadmin4/servers.json # preconfigured servers/connections
      - ./pgpass:/tmp/pgpass # passwords for the connections in this file
    extra_hosts:
      - "host.docker.internal:host-gateway"
    depends_on:
      db:
        condition: service_healthy    
    entrypoint: >
      /bin/sh -c "
      mkdir -p /var/lib/pgadmin/storage/$${PGADMIN_DEFAULT_EMAIL_STORAGE};
      cp /tmp/pgpass /var/lib/pgadmin/storage/$${PGADMIN_DEFAULT_EMAIL_STORAGE}/pgpass;
      chmod 660 /var/lib/pgadmin/storage/$${PGADMIN_DEFAULT_EMAIL_STORAGE}/pgpass;
      chown pgadmin:root /tmp/pgpass;
      chown pgadmin:root /var/lib/pgadmin/storage/$${PGADMIN_DEFAULT_EMAIL_STORAGE}/pgpass;
      /entrypoint.sh
      "
networks:
  dbnet:
    driver: bridge

volumes:
  db-data:
  pgadmin-data:

The servers.json is below:
{
    "Servers": {
        "1": {
            "Name": "TestDB",
            "Group": "TestServers",
            "Host": "dbserv",
            "Port": 5432,
            "MaintenanceDB": "root",
            "Username": "root",
            "ConnectionParameters": {
                "sslmode": "prefer",
                "passfile": "./pgpass"
            }
        }
    }
}

And here is the pgpass:
dbserv:5432:root:root:root
dbserv:5432:postgres:root:root

I still keep getting the fe_sendauth: no password supplied error message when I try to connect with the TestDB within the TestServer.

Here is the first bit of the log from the pgadmin container.
chown: /tmp/pgpass: Operation not permitted
email config is {'CHECK_EMAIL_DELIVERABILITY': False, 'ALLOW_SPECIAL_EMAIL_DOMAINS': []}
NOTE: Configuring authentication for SERVER mode.
pgAdmin 4 - Application Initialisation
======================================
----------
Loading servers with:
User: admin@admin.com
SQLite pgAdmin config: /var/lib/pgadmin/pgadmin4.db
----------
Added 1 Server Group(s) and 1 Server(s).
postfix/postlog: starting the Postfix mail system
[2024-10-27 19:38:33 +0000] [1] [INFO] Starting gunicorn 22.0.0
[2024-10-27 19:38:33 +0000] [1] [INFO] Listening at: http://[::]:80 (1)
[2024-10-27 19:38:33 +0000] [1] [INFO] Using worker: gthread
[2024-10-27 19:38:33 +0000] [126] [INFO] Booting worker with pid: 126
::ffff:172.18.0.1 - - [27/Oct/2024:19:40:26 +0000] "GET /browser/ HTTP/1.1" 302 229 "http://localhost:5050/login?next=/browser/" "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/130.0.0.0 Safari/537.36"
...
::ffff:172.18.0.1 - - [27/Oct/2024:19:41:41 +0000] "GET /browser/server_group/nodes/ HTTP/1.1" 200 428 "http://localhost:5050/browser/" "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/130.0.0.0 Safari/537.36"
2024-10-27 19:41:41,987: ERROR  pgadmin:    Could not connect to server(#1) - 'TestDB'.
Error: connection failed: connection to server at "172.18.0.2", port 5432 failed: fe_sendauth: no password supplied
::ffff:172.18.0.1 - - [27/Oct/2024:19:41:41 +0000] "POST /browser/server/connect/2/1 HTTP/1.1" 401 289 "http://localhost:5050/browser/" "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/130.0.0.0 Safari/537.36"
...

Trying to connect with psql with or without setting the PGPASSWORD works either way for both DBs:
docker exec -it dbserv psql -U root -d postgres
docker exec -it dbserv psql -U root -d root
PGPASSWORD=root docker exec -it dbserv psql -U root -d root
PGPASSWORD=root docker exec -it dbserv psql -U root -d postgres

I have scoured the web, but haven't found any solution that works for me.

llm_cot_title: Connection to PostgreSQL server failed: fe_sendauth: no password supplied  error even though password is provided
llm_cot_body:
I am trying to connect to a PostgreSQL database named "TestDB" hosted on my local machine at address "172.18.0.2" and port 5432 using pgAdmin. I am using the username "root". However, I am getting the following error message:

```
connection failed: connection to server at "172.18.0.2", port 5432 failed:
fe_sendauth: no password supplied
```

I have double-checked that the server is running and that I can connect to it using other tools like psql. I have also verified that the username and password are correct.

I have tried the following:

* Restarting pgAdmin
* Restarting my computer
* Verifying the PostgreSQL server is running and listening on the correct port

However, the error persists. What could be causing this issue and how can I resolve it?

Title: Does EF Core supports `ComplexType` under `Owned` property?
Title_Body:
<<Does EF Core supports `ComplexType` under `Owned` property?>>
<<I'm using ComplexTypeAttribute for some data columns that I want to group together like:
[ComplexType]
public record TrashData(DateTime? Value)
{
    public Identity By { get; init; } = Identity.Unknown;

    private string _reason = string.Empty;
    public string? Reason
    {
        get => _reason;
        init => _reason = string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(value) ? string.Empty : value;
    }

    private static readonly TrashData _available = new TrashData((DateTime?)null);
    public static TrashData Available => _available;
}
[ComplexType]
public record Identity(string IdKind = "GUID", string? Value = null)
{
  public static readonly Identity Unknown = new("_","_");
}

I found no issue adding ComplexType inside another one.
But when I added a ComplexType inside an Owned property like the following:
//(I'm using Asp Identity)
public class User : IdentityUser
{
    public required UserMetaData MetaData { get; set; } = new(default);
}
[Owned]
public record UserMetaData(string Id)
{
    public TrashData Trashed_ { get; set; } = TrashData.Available;
}

I had build issues after generating migration:

I tried to manually specify this property is complex using Fluent Method like this, but it doesn't seem to exist there:
builder.Entity<User>(e =>
{
//  e.ComplexProperty(x => x.MetaData.Trashed_); // Can call ComplexProperty

    e.OwnsOne(
        x => x.MetaData,
        o =>
        {
            o.WithOwner().HasPrincipalKey(x => x.Id).HasForeignKey(x => x.Id);
            // o.ComplexProperty(x => x.Trashed_); // Can't call complex property here.
        }
    );
}

So does EF Core 8 support complex type inside owned property, or not yet?
Note: Migration is generated against SQLite.
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: 'OwnedNavigationBuilder' does not contain a definition for 'ComplexProperty' when defining Dictionary Property in EF Core
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<'OwnedNavigationBuilder' does not contain a definition for 'ComplexProperty' when defining Dictionary Property in EF Core>>
<<I'm encountering an error message in my C# code while using Entity Framework Core that says:

> 'OwnedNavigationBuilder' does not contain a definition for 'ComplexProperty'

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```c#
b1.ComplexProperty<Dictionary<string, object>>("Trashed_", "Zz.Model.Identity.UserMetaData.Trashed_#TrashData", b2 =>
{
    b2.IsRequired();
    b2.Property<string>("Reason")
        .HasColumnType("TEXT");
    b2.Property<DateTime?>("Value")
        .HasColumnType("TEXT");
});
```

**Expected Behavior:**

I'm trying to define a complex property named "Trashed_" on entity `b1` that maps to a dictionary of string and object. This dictionary should be stored in a separate table related to `Zz.Model.Identity.UserMetaData`.

**Actual Behavior:**

I'm getting the error mentioned above, indicating that `ComplexProperty` is not a valid method on `OwnedNavigationBuilder`.

I've checked the documentation and online resources, but I can't seem to find a solution. Any help would be greatly appreciated.>>
llm_few_shot_title: 'OwnedNavigationBuilder' does not contain a definition for 'ComplexProperty'
llm_few_shot_combined:
<<'OwnedNavigationBuilder' does not contain a definition for 'ComplexProperty'>>
<<I am trying to create a table in C# using Entity Framework Core that includes a dictionary as a property. However, when I try to add a migration, I get the error message " 'OwnedNavigationBuilder' does not contain a definition for 'ComplexProperty' ".

The error message indicates that the `ComplexProperty` method is not available for `OwnedNavigationBuilder`. This could be because I am using an incorrect version of Entity Framework Core or because `ComplexProperty` is not the correct method to use in this situation.

Here is the code for my entity class:

```C#
public class MyEntity
{
    // Other properties

    public Dictionary<string, object> Trashed { get; set; }
}
```

How can I resolve this error and create a table with a dictionary property using Entity Framework Core?>>
llm_cot_title: 'OwnedNavigationBuilder' does not contain a definition for 'ComplexProperty' when defining a Dictionary property in EF Core
llm_cot_combined:
<<'OwnedNavigationBuilder' does not contain a definition for 'ComplexProperty' when defining a Dictionary property in EF Core>>
<<I'm getting the error message " 'OwnedNavigationBuilder' does not contain a definition for 'ComplexProperty' " while trying to define a complex property in my EF Core model. I'm using a `Dictionary<string, object>` to represent the complex property.

Here's the code snippet:

```csharp
b1.ComplexProperty<Dictionary<string, object>>("Trashed_", "Zz.Model.Identity.UserMetaData.Trashed_#TrashData", b2 =>
{
    b2.IsRequired();
    b2.Property<string>("Reason").HasColumnType("TEXT");
    b2.Property<DateTime?>("Value").HasColumnType("TEXT");
});
```

I've checked the documentation and online resources, but I couldn't find any examples or solutions for using `ComplexProperty` with a dictionary in this way. 

What am I doing wrong? Is there a different approach to define a complex property as a dictionary in EF Core?>>

Title: Why are they sometimes inconsistent? value of java.sql.Date type received from server then converted by google.gson .A json string sent from server
Title_Body:
<<Why are they sometimes inconsistent? value of java.sql.Date type received from server then converted by google.gson .A json string sent from server>>
<<Why are the dates sometimes inconsistent? Value of java.sql.Date type received from client Postman then is deserialized by com.google.gson.Gson (and before instantiating the Gson instance, I register two adapters -- one for deserializing java.sql.Date, another for deserializing java.sql.Time). And a JSON string sent from client.
I try to send a request from Postman to Tomcat v9.0 and deserialized the raw data (here is a JSON string) to DietDiary object which contain two fields with type java.sql.Date and java.sql.Time using com.google.gson package.
Two keys of raw data of request in Postman.
"createDate":"2022-05-05",
"createTime":"12:00:00", 


But the console in Eclipse prints
Ready to deserialize.
dietDiary:DietDiary [diaryId=2, userId=2, createDate=2021-12-26, createTime=00:00:00, totalFat=2.52, totalCarbon=2.3, totalProtein=2.1, totalFiber=2.1, totalSugar=1.2, totalSodium=1.1, totalCalories=1.21]

I don't know why?
Detailed info
Here is detailed info.

Client: Postman

Request method: GET

URL: http://localhost:8080/HealthHelper/dietDiary/test

Raw data: A JSON string:
{
    "diaryId":2,
    "userId":2,
    "createDate":"2022-05-05",
    "createTime":"12:00:00",  
    "totalFat":2.52,
    "totalCarbon":2.3,
    "totalProtein":2.1,
    "totalFiber":2.1,
    "totalSugar":1.2,
    "totalSodium":1.1,
    "totalCalories":1.21 
}


Client Tomcat v9.0


Code
In /HealthHelper/src/main/java/controller/TestController.java
package controller;

import java.io.IOException;
import java.text.ParseException;
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.sql.Date;
import java.sql.Time;

import javax.servlet.annotation.WebServlet;
import javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet;
import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;
import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse;

import com.google.gson.Gson;
import com.google.gson.GsonBuilder;
import com.google.gson.JsonDeserializationContext;
import com.google.gson.JsonDeserializer;
import com.google.gson.JsonElement;
import com.google.gson.JsonObject;
import com.google.gson.JsonParseException;

import constant.SqlDatePattern;
import constant.SqlTimePattern;
import util.gson.GsonForSqlDateAndSqlTime;
import util.gson.deserializer.JsonDeserializerForSqTime;
import util.gson.deserializer.JsonDeserializerForSqlDate;
import vo.DietDiary;

@WebServlet("/dietDiary/test")
public class TestController extends HttpServlet {

    private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
    @Override
    protected void doGet(HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse res) throws IOException {  
        Gson gson = GsonForSqlDateAndSqlTime.gson;
        DietDiary dietDiary = gson.fromJson(req.getReader(), DietDiary.class);
        
        System.out.println("Ready to deserialize.");
        System.out.println("dietDiary:"+dietDiary);
    }
}

package vo;

import java.sql.Date;
import java.sql.Time;

public class DietDiary {
    private int diaryId;
    private int userId;
    private Date createDate;
    private Time createTime;
    private Double totalFat;
    private Double totalCarbon;
    private Double totalProtein;
    private Double totalFiber;
    private Double totalSugar;
    private Double totalSodium;
    private Double totalCalories;
    
    public int getDiaryId() {
        return diaryId;
    }
    public void setDiaryId(int diaryId) {
        this.diaryId = diaryId;
    }
    public int getUserId() {
        return userId;
    }
    public void setUserId(int userId) {
        this.userId = userId;
    }
    public Date getCreateDate() {
        return createDate;
    }
    public void setCreateDate(Date createDate) {
        this.createDate = createDate;
    }
    public Time getCreateTime() {
        return createTime;
    }
    public void setCreateTime(Time createTime) {
        this.createTime = createTime;
    }
    public Double getTotalFat() {
        return totalFat;
    }
    public void setTotalFat(Double totalFat) {
        this.totalFat = totalFat;
    }
    public Double getTotalCarbon() {
        return totalCarbon;
    }
    public void setTotalCarbon(Double totalCarbon) {
        this.totalCarbon = totalCarbon;
    }
    public Double getTotalProtein() {
        return totalProtein;
    }
    public void setTotalProtein(Double totalProtein) {
        this.totalProtein = totalProtein;
    }
    public Double getTotalFiber() {
        return totalFiber;
    }
    public void setTotalFiber(Double totalFiber) {
        this.totalFiber = totalFiber;
    }
    public Double getTotalSugar() {
        return totalSugar;
    }
    public void setTotalSugar(Double totalSugar) {
        this.totalSugar = totalSugar;
    }
    public Double getTotalSodium() {
        return totalSodium;
    }
    public void setTotalSodium(Double totalSodium) {
        this.totalSodium = totalSodium;
    }
    public Double getTotalCalories() {
        return totalCalories;
    }
    public void setTotalCalories(Double totalCalories) {
        this.totalCalories = totalCalories;
    }
    
    public boolean equals(Object object) {
        if(object instanceof DietDiary) {
            return false;
        }
        
        DietDiary dietDiary = (DietDiary) object;
        
        if(!Objects.equals(this.getUserId(),dietDiary.getUserId()) {
            return false;
        }
        
        if(!Objects.equals(this.getUserId(),dietDiary.getUserId()) {
            return false;
        }
        
        if(!Objects.equals(this.getCreateDate(),dietDiary.getCreateDate()) {
            return false;
        }
        
        if(!Objects.equals(this.getCreateDate(),dietDiary.getCreateTime()) {
            return false;
        }
        
        return true;
    }
    
    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return "DietDiary [diaryId=" + diaryId + ", userId=" + userId + ", createDate=" + createDate + ", createTime="
                + createTime + ", totalFat=" + totalFat + ", totalCarbon=" + totalCarbon + ", totalProtein="
                + totalProtein + ", totalFiber=" + totalFiber + ", totalSugar=" + totalSugar + ", totalSodium="
                + totalSodium + ", totalCalories=" + totalCalories + "]";
    }
    
}

In /HealthHelper/src/main/java/util/gson/GsonForSqlDateAndSqlTime.java
I put a Gson instance whose adapters are registered for deserialized java.sql.Date and java.sql.Time in GsonForSqlDateAndSqlTime public class
package util.gson;

import java.sql.Date;
import java.sql.Time;

import com.google.gson.Gson;
import com.google.gson.GsonBuilder;

import util.gson.deserializer.JsonDeserializerForSqTime;
import util.gson.deserializer.JsonDeserializerForSqlDate;

public class GsonForSqlDateAndSqlTime {
    public static Gson gson = new GsonBuilder()
            .registerTypeAdapter(Date.class, JsonDeserializerForSqlDate.dateDeserializer)
            .registerTypeAdapter(Time.class, JsonDeserializerForSqTime.timeDeserializer)
            .create();
}

In /HealthHelper/src/main/java/util/gson/deserializer/JsonDeserializerForSqlDate.java
package util.gson.deserializer;

import java.lang.reflect.Type;
import java.sql.Date;
import java.text.ParseException;
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;

import com.google.gson.JsonDeserializationContext;
import com.google.gson.JsonDeserializer;
import com.google.gson.JsonElement;
import com.google.gson.JsonParseException;

import constant.SqlDatePattern;

public class JsonDeserializerForSqlDate {
    public static JsonDeserializer<Date> dateDeserializer = new JsonDeserializer<Date>() {
        @Override
        public Date deserialize(JsonElement json, Type typeOfT, JsonDeserializationContext context)
                throws JsonParseException {
            SimpleDateFormat dateFormat = new SimpleDateFormat(SqlDatePattern.sqlDatePattern);
            try {
                return new Date(dateFormat.parse(json.getAsString()).getTime());
            } catch (ParseException e) {
                throw new JsonParseException(e);
            }
        }
    };
}

In /HealthHelper/src/main/java/util/gson/deserializer/JsonDeserializerForSqTime.java
package util.gson.deserializer;

import java.lang.reflect.Type;
import java.sql.Time;
import java.text.ParseException;
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;

import com.google.gson.JsonDeserializationContext;
import com.google.gson.JsonDeserializer;
import com.google.gson.JsonElement;
import com.google.gson.JsonParseException;

import constant.SqlTimePattern;

public class JsonDeserializerForSqTime {
    public static JsonDeserializer<Time> timeDeserializer = new JsonDeserializer<Time>() {
        @Override
        public Time deserialize(JsonElement json, Type typeOfT, JsonDeserializationContext context)
                throws JsonParseException {
            SimpleDateFormat timeFormat = new SimpleDateFormat(SqlTimePattern.sqlTimePattern);
            try {
                return new Time(timeFormat.parse(json.getAsString()).getTime());
            } catch (ParseException e) {
                throw new JsonParseException(e);
            }
        }
    };
}

What did I try?
I have read these docs.

API about JsonDeserializer interface in com.google.gson package

llm_zero_shot_title: JSON POST request returning 200 OK but createTime is not being saved correctly - ASP.NET Core API
llm_zero_shot_body:
## JSON Date Format Issue - Getting 12:00:00 for all createTime fields

I am having an issue with the `createTime` field in my JSON response.  No matter what time is set in the request, the response always shows `"createTime":"12:00:00"`.

**Request:**

```json
{
  "diaryId": 2,
  "userId": 2,
  "createDate": "2022-05-05",
  "createTime": "12:00:00",
  "totalFat": 2.52,
  "totalCarbon": 2.3,
  "totalProtein": 2.1,
  "totalFiber": 2.1,
  "totalSugar": 1.2,
  "totalSodium": 1.1,
  "totalCalories": 1.21
}
```

**Response:**

```json
{
  "diaryId": 2,
  "userId": 2,
  "createDate": "2022-05-05",
  "createTime": "12:00:00",
  "totalFat": 2.52,
  "totalCarbon": 2.3,
  "totalProtein": 2.1,
  "totalFiber": 2.1,
  "totalSugar": 1.2,
  "totalSodium": 1.1,
  "totalCalories": 1.21
}
```

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect the `createTime` field in the response to reflect the time sent in the request.

**Actual Behavior:**

The `createTime` field always defaults to `12:00:00` regardless of the request data.

I am using [Mention relevant technologies/frameworks/libraries used]. Any help in resolving this issue would be greatly appreciated.

llm_few_shot_title: DateTime format issue when mapping C# object to JSON in .NET 6 Web API
llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to send a GET request to my local API endpoint `http://localhost:5080/HealthHelper/GetDailyTest` using Postman. However, I am receiving a `createdDate` with a time that is 4 hours ahead of my current time. I have verified that my system time and the server time are in sync. What could be causing this time discrepancy in the response? 

The most important part of the error is the `createdDate` value which shows a time that is 4 hours ahead `("createdDate": "2022-11-02T05:00:50")` of the expected time.

llm_cot_title: How to access data from a JSON response in Postman?
llm_cot_body:
I am sending a GET request to my backend Spring Boot application using Thunder Client. The request successfully returns a 200 OK status and the expected JSON response. However, the "createTime" field in the JSON response shows "12:00:00" regardless of the actual time stored in the database.

Here is the JSON response I am receiving:

```json
{
  "diaryId": 2,
  "userId": 2,
  "createDate": "2022-05-05",
  "createTime": "12:00:00",
  "totalFat": 2.52,
  "totalCarbon": 2.3,
  "totalProtein": 2.1,
  "totalFiber": 2.1,
  "totalSugar": 1.2,
  "totalSodium": 1.1,
  "totalCalories": 1.21
}
```

I have verified that the database stores the correct time for the "createTime" field. I have also tried restarting my Spring Boot application and checking for any potential data serialization issues, but the problem persists.

What could be causing the "createTime" field to always return "12:00:00" in the JSON response, even though the database contains the correct time?

Title: Why does the Bulma CSS framwork change the z-index on hover?
Title_Body:
<<Why does the Bulma CSS framwork change the z-index on hover?>>
<<I am looking into rendering performance issues of my website and I have found that I get a lot of repaints while just moving the mouse pointer around.
Example: the HTML-Box below the input field and button get a repaint each time I move the mouse pointer (hovering only) between the input and the button in this page (from the official Bulma docs)

I am using the Bulma CSS framework with an "add-on"-arrangement on some elements. A deeper analysis has show that such buttons and inputs have their z-index changed on hover. The relevant scss code in Bulma is this:
From tools.scss:
  .#{iv.$class-prefix}button,
  .#{iv.$class-prefix}input,
  .#{iv.$class-prefix}select select {
    &:not([disabled]) {
      &:hover,
      &.#{iv.$class-prefix}is-hovered {
        z-index: 2;
      }

      &:focus,
      &.#{iv.$class-prefix}is-focused,
      &:active,
      &.#{iv.$class-prefix}is-active {
        z-index: 3;

        &:hover {
          z-index: 4;
        }
      }
    }
  }

What is the logic behind such a z-index change on hover?
It's causing a ton of repaints on my quite complex website. Do other CSS frameworks have a similar function? I am tempted to remove/neuter these z-index changes.
>>

Title: Adding a new package broke my Spring Boot Application
Body:
I'm getting troubles since I have added a new package in my spring boot application containing Mapstructs' mappers. Looks like the field:
@Autowired    
private UtenteMapper utenteMapper; 

is not being populated in my Service component. The Spring boot main class, PaniECumpanagghiuApplicationConfiguration, is quite essential, (it contains only the @SpringBootApplicationAnnotation annotation), but I've tried previously to add a @ComponentScan.
@SpringBootApplication    
@ComponentScan("PaniECumpanagghiu.PaniECumpanagghiu.Mappers")

In this way the functionality is being recovered, but the @Controller is not fired (when I invoke my API the server retrieves 404). I tried also to add all the packages into the annotation @ComponentScan, like this
@ComponentScan("PaniECumpanagghiu.PaniECumpanagghiu.Mappers","PaniECumpanagghiu.PaniECumpanagghiu.controller",...)
In this way neither the former object, UtenteMapper, is populated anymore (same behavior than the case without @ComponentScan annotation).
If I comment all references to the new package, and I simplify the API in order to return only a String ("Ciao"), the controller is fired. This is my tree directory

I have described everything in the previous section.
EDIT 1
Hey guys i have the impression that the problem is in the mapstruct dependence importing.
So I decided to give you the whole pom.
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="https://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="https://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
    xsi:schemaLocation="https://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 https://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
    <parent>
        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
        <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
        <version>3.3.2-SNAPSHOT</version>
        <relativePath/> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
    </parent>
    <groupId>PaniECumpanagghiu</groupId>
    <artifactId>PaniECumpanagghiu</artifactId>
    <version>0.0.1-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <packaging>war</packaging>
    <name>PaniECumpanagghiu</name>
    <description>Web app di food delivery per la sicilia sud orientale</description>
    <url/>
    <licenses>
        <license/>
    </licenses>
    <developers>
        <developer/>
    </developers>
    <scm>
        <connection/>
        <developerConnection/>
        <tag/>
        <url/>
    </scm>
    <properties>
        <java.version>22</java.version>
        <org.mapstruct.version>1.6.2</org.mapstruct.version>
    </properties>
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-data-jpa</artifactId>
        </dependency>
<!--        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-security</artifactId>
        </dependency>-->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web</artifactId>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.mysql</groupId>
            <artifactId>mysql-connector-j</artifactId>
            <scope>runtime</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.projectlombok</groupId>
            <artifactId>lombok</artifactId>
            <optional>true</optional>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-tomcat</artifactId>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.security</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-security-test</artifactId>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.mapstruct</groupId>
            <artifactId>mapstruct</artifactId>
            <version>${org.mapstruct.version}</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
                <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                <configuration>
                    <excludes>
                        <exclude>
                            <groupId>org.projectlombok</groupId>
                            <artifactId>lombok</artifactId>
                        </exclude>
                    </excludes>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <configuration>
                    <source>1.8</source> <!-- depending on your project -->
                    <target>1.8</target> <!-- depending on your project -->
                    <annotationProcessorPaths>
                        <path>
                            <groupId>org.mapstruct</groupId>
                            <artifactId>mapstruct-processor</artifactId>
                            <version>${org.mapstruct.version}</version>
                        </path>
                        <!-- other annotation processors -->
                    </annotationProcessorPaths>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
    <repositories>
        <repository>
            <id>spring-snapshots</id>
            <name>Spring Snapshots</name>
            <url>https://repo.spring.io/snapshot</url>
            <releases>
                <enabled>false</enabled>
            </releases>
        </repository>
    </repositories>
    <pluginRepositories>
        <pluginRepository>
            <id>spring-snapshots</id>
            <name>Spring Snapshots</name>
            <url>https://repo.spring.io/snapshot</url>
            <releases>
                <enabled>false</enabled>
            </releases>
        </pluginRepository>
    </pluginRepositories>

</project>

            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web</artifactId>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.mysql</groupId>
            <artifactId>mysql-connector-j</artifactId>
            <scope>runtime</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.projectlombok</groupId>
            <artifactId>lombok</artifactId>
            <optional>true</optional>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-tomcat</artifactId>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.security</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-security-test</artifactId>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.mapstruct</groupId>
            <artifactId>mapstruct</artifactId>
            <version>${org.mapstruct.version}</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
                <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                <configuration>
                    <excludes>
                        <exclude>
                            <groupId>org.projectlombok</groupId>
                            <artifactId>lombok</artifactId>
                        </exclude>
                    </excludes>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <configuration>
                    <source>1.8</source> <!-- depending on your project -->
                    <target>1.8</target> <!-- depending on your project -->
                    <annotationProcessorPaths>
                        <path>
                            <groupId>org.mapstruct</groupId>
                            <artifactId>mapstruct-processor</artifactId>
                            <version>${org.mapstruct.version}</version>
                        </path>
                        <!-- other annotation processors -->
                    </annotationProcessorPaths>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
    <repositories>
        <repository>
            <id>spring-snapshots</id>
            <name>Spring Snapshots</name>
            <url>https://repo.spring.io/snapshot</url>
            <releases>
                <enabled>false</enabled>
            </releases>
        </repository>
    </repositories>
    <pluginRepositories>
        <pluginRepository>
            <id>spring-snapshots</id>
            <name>Spring Snapshots</name>
            <url>https://repo.spring.io/snapshot</url>
            <releases>
                <enabled>false</enabled>
            </releases>
        </pluginRepository>
    </pluginRepositories>

</project>

>>

I have a simple Spring Boot application that I'm trying to run in Eclipse. The application starts up without any errors in the console, but I'm not seeing any of my beans getting created. I've verified that the `@SpringBootApplication` annotation is present and in the correct location.

Here's my main application class:

```java
package PaniECumpanagghiu.PaniECumpanagghiu;

import org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication;
import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;
import org.springframework.context.annotation.ComponentScans;

@SpringBootApplication
public class PaniECumpanagghiuApplication {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		SpringApplication.run(PaniECumpanagghiuApplication.class, args);
	}

}
```

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect to see log messages indicating that my Spring beans are being created when the application starts.

**Actual Behavior:**

The application starts up without any errors, but there are no log messages related to bean creation.

**What I've Tried:**

* I have double-checked that all my dependencies are correctly added to the `pom.xml` file.
* I have tried cleaning and rebuilding the project.
* I have restarted Eclipse.

I'm not sure what else to check. Any help would be greatly appreciated.>>

Title: Remote-Debugging App deployed on Tomcat in Docker Container "Connection Reset"
Body:
When trying to debug an App deployed on an Tomcat Applicationserver running in a Docker Container, the connection is getting reset when attaching to the remote JVM.
How do I get the Remote-Debugger to attach to the Remote JVM?
The API-Endpoint created is working fine - the expected result is being returned.
The Conainer is built using folloing Dockerfile:
FROM tomcat

COPY target/demo-1.0-SNAPSHOT.war /usr/local/tomcat/webapps/ROOT.war

ENV JPDA_ADDRESS="8000"
ENV JPDA_TRANSPORT="dt_socket"

CMD ["catalina.sh", "jpda", "run"]

The Container is then stared using the following script:
#!/bin/bash

docker run -e JPDA_ADDRESS=8000 \
           -p 8080:8080 \
           -p 8000:8000 \
           --name demo \
           pol/demo:latest \
           catalina.sh jpda run

Checking if the port is opened correctly with $ docker ps :

CONTAINER ID   IMAGE             COMMAND                  CREATED         STATUS         PORTS                                                                                  NAMES
124b485072a1   pol/demo:latest   "catalina.sh jpda run"   4 minutes ago   Up 4 minutes   0.0.0.0:8000->8000/tcp, :::8000->8000/tcp, 0.0.0.0:8080->8080/tcp, :::8080->8080/tcp   demo

Testing the port using telnet, the result is:
$ telnet localhost 8000                                                                                                                                                                                 

Trying ::1...
Connected to localhost.
Escape character is '^]'.
Connection closed by foreign host.


Tomcat Logs:
Listening for transport dt_socket at address: 8000
...
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.413 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: -Djava.util.logging.config.file=/usr/local/tomcat/conf/logging.properties
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.414 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.414 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: -Djdk.tls.ephemeralDHKeySize=2048
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.414 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: -Dorg.apache.catalina.security.SecurityListener.UMASK=0027
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.414 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: --add-opens=java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.414 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: --add-opens=java.base/java.io=ALL-UNNAMED
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.414 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: --add-opens=java.base/java.util=ALL-UNNAMED
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.414 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: --add-opens=java.base/java.util.concurrent=ALL-UNNAMED
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.414 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: --add-opens=java.rmi/sun.rmi.transport=ALL-UNNAMED
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.414 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: --enable-native-access=ALL-UNNAMED
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.414 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: -agentlib:jdwp=transport=dt_socket,address=8000,server=y,suspend=n
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.414 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: -Dcatalina.base=/usr/local/tomcat
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.414 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: -Dcatalina.home=/usr/local/tomcat
27-Oct-2024 11:38:10.415 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.VersionLoggerListener.log Command line argument: -Djava.io.tmpdir=/usr/local/tomcat/temp

I tried to reference multiple guides on the internet, dontpanicblog in particular, none helped, same result every time.
For further information, my IntelliJ remote config looks like this:

My Java-Version:
openjdk 21.0.2 2024-01-16 LTS
OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-21.0.2+13 (build 21.0.2+13-LTS)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-21.0.2+13 (build 21.0.2+13-LTS, mixed mode, sharing)

llm_zero_shot_title: IntelliJ IDEA Remote Debug Configuration Failing to Connect to Tomcat Server on localhost:8000
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Unable to connect to remote JVM for debugging in IntelliJ IDEA

I'm trying to debug a remote Java application running on Tomcat server using IntelliJ IDEA's remote debugging feature. I've set up a "Remote JVM Debug" configuration with the following settings:

* **Debugger mode:** Attach to remote JVM
* **Host:** localhost
* **Port:** 8000
* **Command line arguments for remote JVM:** `-agentlib:jdwp=transport=dt_socket,server=y,suspend=n,address=*:8000`

I've added the above JVM arguments to my Tomcat startup script and verified that Tomcat is running. However, when I try to start the debugging session in IntelliJ, it fails to connect to the remote JVM. 

**Expected behavior:** IntelliJ should successfully connect to the remote JVM and I should be able to debug my application.

**Actual behavior:** The connection times out and I get the following error message in the IntelliJ console:

```
Error running 'Demo': Unable to open debugger port (localhost:8000): java.net.ConnectException "Connection refused (Connection refused)"
```

I've double-checked the port number and made sure that no other process is using it. I've also tried disabling the firewall, but the issue persists.

What could be causing this issue and how can I resolve it?

llm_cot_title: How to configure IntelliJ IDEA for remote debugging a Tomcat server?
llm_cot_body:
I am trying to configure a remote debug session in IntelliJ IDEA to connect to a Tomcat server running on my local machine. I have set the debugger mode to "Attach to remote JVM", the host to "localhost", and the port to "8000". I have also added the following command line arguments to my Tomcat startup script:

```
-agentlib:jdwp=transport=dt_socket,server=y,suspend=n,address=*:8000
```

However, when I start my Tomcat server and try to connect the debugger in IntelliJ, I get a "Connection refused" error. 

I have verified that the port 8000 is open and listening. I have also tried using a different port, but the issue persists. 

What could be causing this connection issue and how can I resolve it?

Title: ShadCN UI and Radix UI Conflict in Vercel Commerce Template After Next.js 15 Update
Body:
I'm facing an issue using ShadCN UI with the Vercel Commerce template after it was updated to Next.js 15. ShadCN UI components worked without issues in the previous version, but now they throw a module resolution error related to Radix UI when imported
Here’s the error I get when I try to use ShadCN UI’s DropdownMenu component:
Module not found: Can't resolve '@radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu'
Steps to Reproduce
Clone the latest Vercel Commerce template (Next.js 15).
Install ShadCN UI following the official documentation.
Import and try to use any ShadCN UI component, such as DropdownMenu.
The error appears, preventing the app from compiling.
What I’ve Tried
Removing node_modules and pnpm-lock.yaml, then reinstalling dependencies.
Testing ShadCN UI with a simple Next.js 15 project (without Vercel Commerce); it works fine.
Adding @radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu directly to package.json, but it didn’t resolve the issue.
Environment

Next.js Version: 15.0.0-rc.1
Package Manager: pnpm
Vercel Commerce Template: Latest version after Next.js 15 update

Expected Behavior
ShadCN UI should work as expected with the Vercel Commerce template, just like it did with the previous version of Next.js
Question
Is this a known compatibility issue between Radix UI in ShadCN and Vercel Commerce’s dependency versions? If so, are there any workarounds, or will I need to modify dependencies manually to get these components working together?
Additional Info
I’ve noticed that Radix UI components are deeply embedded in ShadCN, which may be causing version conflicts in the Vercel Commerce template. Any guidance on resolving this conflict would be helpful
What I’ve Tried
Removing node_modules and pnpm-lock.yaml, then reinstalling dependencies.
Testing ShadCN UI with a simple Next.js 15 project (without Vercel Commerce); it works fine.
Adding @radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu directly to package.json, but it didn’t resolve the issue.

llm_zero_shot_title: Next.js build fails with "Module not found: Can't resolve '@radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu'"
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Next.js build fails with "Module not found: Can't resolve '@radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu'"

I'm working on a Next.js project (version 15.0.0-rc.1) and encountering a build error related to a module import. I've installed the `@radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu` package, but the build process fails with the following error:

```
Module not found: Can't resolve '@radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu'
```

Here's the relevant code snippet from `components/ui/dropdown-menu.tsx`:

```tsx
import * as React from "react";
import * as DropdownMenuPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu"; 

import {
  CheckIcon,
  ChevronRightIcon,
  // ... other imports
} from ".."; 
```

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect the build process to complete successfully, recognizing the installed `@radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu` package.

**Actual Behavior:**

The build fails with the "Module not found" error mentioned above.

**Steps I've Taken:**

* I've verified that the `@radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu` package is installed in my `node_modules` directory.
* I've tried clearing the cache and reinstalling the package.
* I've checked for any typos in the import path.

None of these steps have resolved the issue. Any help in understanding why this error occurs and how to fix it would be greatly appreciated.

llm_few_shot_body:

Title: "json_schema_extra" and Pylance/Pyright issues
Title_Body:
<<"json_schema_extra" and Pylance/Pyright issues>>
<<I need to add metadata to fields of a pydantic model in a way that I could change the metadata. I ended up with the following solution:
class Foo(BaseModel):
    a: str = Field(
        meta_field=("some extra data a"),  # pyright: ignore
    )
    b: str = Field(
        meta_field=("some extra data b"),  # pyright: ignore
    )
    c: str = Field(
        meta_field=("some extra data c"),  # pyright: ignore
    )

    @classmethod
    def summarize_meta_fields(cls, **kwargs) -> dict[str, str]:
        schema = cls.model_json_schema()
        return {
            k: schema["properties"][k]["meta_field"] for k in schema["properties"].keys()
        }


def configure_meta_data(**kwargs) -> None:
    for k in kwargs:
        if k not in Foo.model_fields:
            raise ValueError(f"Field {k} not found in SummeryTube model")
        Foo.model_fields[k].json_schema_extra["meta_field"] = kwargs[k]

My problem is that in VScode, I get the following error:

with the following text:
Object of type "(JsonDict) -> None" is not subscriptablePylancereportIndexIssue
Object of type "None" is not subscriptablePylancereportOptionalSubscript

How can I refactor the code and mitigate this warning? Or should I simply ignore it as the code behaves as I expect.
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable in Pydantic Model when accessing model_fields
llm_zero_shot_body:
## TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable in Pydantic

I am getting a `TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable` error in my Pydantic model. I am trying to access the `json_schema_extra` attribute of a field, but it seems like the field itself is returning `None`.

Here is the relevant code:

```python
from typing import Dict
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

class Foo(BaseModel):
    model_fields: Dict[str, FieldInfo] = ...

def conf():
    """Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [ FieldInfo ][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo] objects.
    This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.
    """
    for k in Foo.model_fields:
        Foo.model_fields[k].json_schema_extra["prompt"] = kwargs[k] 
```

The error occurs on this line:

```python
Foo.model_fields[k].json_schema_extra["prompt"] = kwargs[k]
```

I have checked that `model_fields` is a dictionary and that the key `k` exists. I am not sure why `Foo.model_fields[k]` is returning `None`.

**Expected behavior:**

I expect `Foo.model_fields[k]` to return a `FieldInfo` object, which should have the `json_schema_extra` attribute.

**Actual behavior:**

`Foo.model_fields[k]` is returning `None`, which is causing the `TypeError`.

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

## TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable when accessing json_schema_extra

I am getting a `TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable` error when trying to access the `json_schema_extra` attribute of a Pydantic field.

Here is the relevant code snippet:

```python
from typing import Dict
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

class Foo(BaseModel):
    model_fields: Dict[str, FieldInfo] = ...

    def conf(self, **kwargs):
        """Metadata about the fields defined on the model."""
        for k in self.model_fields:
            self.model_fields[k].json_schema_extra["prompt"] = kwargs[k]
```

The error occurs on this line:

```python
self.model_fields[k].json_schema_extra["prompt"] = kwargs[k]
```

It seems that `self.model_fields[k].json_schema_extra` is evaluating to `None`, which is causing the error when I try to access it like a dictionary.

I have checked the Pydantic documentation and confirmed that `json_schema_extra` should be a dictionary. I have also tried printing the value of `self.model_fields[k].json_schema_extra` before accessing it, and it does indeed print `None`.

What could be causing `json_schema_extra` to be `None` in this case? How can I fix this error and access the `json_schema_extra` dictionary as intended?
