Title: JUnit4 code coverage issue with Exception expected
Title_Body:
<<JUnit4 code coverage issue with Exception expected>>
<<I have the following sample class in Java:
package main;

public class SampleClass {
    private String id;

    public SampleClass(String id) throws IllegalArgumentException {
        validation(id);
        this.id = id;
    }

    public void validation(String inputId) throws IllegalArgumentException {
        if (inputId.length() != 6) {
            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid length");
        }
    }
}


And now, I'm trying to test the code with JUnit4 tests like the following:
package main;

import org.junit.rules.ExpectedException;

public class Test {

    @org.junit.Rule
    public ExpectedException thrown = ExpectedException.none();

    @org.junit.Test
    public void normalTest() {
        SampleClass sample = new SampleClass("123456");
    }

    @org.junit.Test(expected = IllegalArgumentException.class)
    public void lengthTestOriginal() {
        SampleClass sample = new SampleClass("1234567");
    }

    @org.junit.Test
    public void lengthTestVersion1() {
        thrown.expect(IllegalArgumentException.class);
        thrown.expectMessage("Invalid length");
        SampleClass sample = new SampleClass("12345");
    }

    @org.junit.Test
    public void lengthTestVersion2() {
        try {
            SampleClass puerto2 = new SampleClass("1234567");
        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
            org.junit.Assert.assertEquals("Invalid length", e.getMessage());
        }
    }
}

However, when I run the JUnit tests with coverage, the SampleClass() instantiations that must throw an exception seem to not being covered, as shown in the image:

I know the tool may not be able to detect such code as covered, as discussed here, however, is the any way to write the tests so that they show as covered? As you can see I tried several alternative ways to perform the same test, all of them failing to be covered in the same instantiation line.
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: How to assert that an IllegalArgumentException is thrown in JUnit 5?
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<How to assert that an IllegalArgumentException is thrown in JUnit 5?>>
<<## JUnit ExpectedException Not Catching IllegalArgumentException

I'm trying to write a JUnit test to verify that an `IllegalArgumentException` is thrown when I create a `SampleClass` object with an invalid input. However, my test is failing even though the exception is being thrown.

Here's my test class:

```java
package main;

import org.junit.rules.ExpectedException;
import org.junit.Test;

public class Test {

    @org.junit.Rule
    public ExpectedException thrown = ExpectedException.none();

    @org.junit.Test
    public void normalTest() {
        SampleClass sample = new SampleClass("123456");
    }

    @org.junit.Test(expected = IllegalArgumentException.class)
    public void lengthTestOriginal() {
        SampleClass sample = new SampleClass("1234567");
    }

    @org.junit.Test
    public void lengthTestVersion1() {
        thrown.expect(IllegalArgumentException.class);
        thrown.expectMessage("Invalid length");
        SampleClass sample = new SampleClass("12345");
    }

    @org.junit.Test
    public void lengthTestVersion2() {
        try {
            SampleClass puerto2 = new SampleClass("1234567");
        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
            org.junit.Assert.assertEquals("Invalid length", e.getMessage());
        }
    }
}
```

I've tried three different approaches:

1. **`@Test(expected = IllegalArgumentException.class)`:** This approach doesn't seem to catch the exception at all.
2. **`thrown.expect()`:** This approach also fails to catch the exception.
3. **`try-catch` block:** This approach successfully catches the exception and verifies the error message.

**Expected behavior:**

I expect the tests using `@Test(expected = ...)` and `thrown.expect()` to pass, as the `SampleClass` constructor should throw an `IllegalArgumentException` for the invalid input.

**Actual behavior:**

The tests using JUnit's exception handling mechanisms are failing, while the `try-catch` block works as expected.

What am I doing wrong with the JUnit exception handling? Why aren't the first two approaches catching the exception?>>
llm_few_shot_title: How to Throw and Assert Exceptions in JUnit 5
llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to write some JUnit tests for my Java code, and I'm having trouble understanding how to use the `@Rule` annotation with `ExpectedException`.

In my test class, I have declared a rule `@Rule public ExpectedException thrown = ExpectedException.none();`. I want to use this rule to verify that an `IllegalArgumentException` is thrown when I create a `SampleClass` object with an invalid length. However, when I run my test, it fails with a message indicating that no exception was thrown.

I have tried both annotating the test method with `@Test(expected = IllegalArgumentException.class)` and using `thrown.expect(IllegalArgumentException.class)` within the test method, but neither approach seems to work.

What is the correct way to use the `@Rule` annotation with `ExpectedException` to test for exceptions in JUnit?

llm_cot_title: How to assert that an IllegalArgumentException is thrown in JUnit 5?
llm_cot_combined:
<<How to assert that an IllegalArgumentException is thrown in JUnit 5?>>
<<I'm having trouble understanding the different ways to test for exceptions in JUnit. I have a simple `SampleClass` that throws an `IllegalArgumentException` if the input string is too long.

```java
public class SampleClass {
    public SampleClass(String input) {
        if (input.length() > 6) {
            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid length");
        }
        // ... other logic ...
    }
}
```

I've written a few test methods using different approaches:

```java
import org.junit.Rule;
import org.junit.Test;
import org.junit.rules.ExpectedException;

import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;

public class Test {

    @Rule
    public ExpectedException thrown = ExpectedException.none();

    @Test
    public void normalTest() {
        SampleClass sample = new SampleClass("123456");
    }

    @Test(expected = IllegalArgumentException.class)
    public void lengthTestOriginal() {
        SampleClass sample = new SampleClass("1234567");
    }

    @Test
    public void lengthTestVersion1() {
        thrown.expect(IllegalArgumentException.class);
        thrown.expectMessage("Invalid length");
        SampleClass sample = new SampleClass("12345");
    }

    @Test
    public void lengthTestVersion2() {
        try {
            SampleClass puerto2 = new SampleClass("1234567");
        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
            assertEquals("Invalid length", e.getMessage());
        }
    }
}
```

- `lengthTestOriginal` uses the `expected` attribute of the `@Test` annotation.
- `lengthTestVersion1` uses the `ExpectedException` rule.
- `lengthTestVersion2` uses a traditional `try-catch` block.

All of these tests seem to work, but I'm not sure which approach is considered best practice in JUnit. What are the advantages and disadvantages of each method, and which one should I be using for this scenario?>>

llm_zero_shot_title: Angular Material: How to prevent "The same density/typography styles are generated multiple times" warning?
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Angular Material: How to avoid "The same density/typography styles are generated multiple times" warning?

I'm working on an Angular project using Angular Material and I'm getting the following warning message in my console after compiling:

> WARNING The same density/typography styles are generated multiple times. Read more about how style duplication can be avoided in a dedicated guide. https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/guides/duplicate-theming-styles.md [plugin angular-sass]

The warning message also points to these files:

```
angular:styles/global:styles:1:8:
1| @import './src/styles.scss';

node_modules\@angular\material\core\theming\_theming.scss 
node_modules\@angular\material\core\theming\_all-theme.scss 
node_modules\@ruf\material\styles\all-mat-theme.scss 
node_modules\@ruf\material\styles\all-theme.scss 
src\styles.scss 
```

I understand that this warning means I have some duplicated styles related to Angular Material theming, but I'm not sure how to identify the root cause and fix it. 

**Expected behavior:** I want to compile my Angular application without this warning message and avoid any potential style conflicts.

**Actual behavior:** I'm getting the "The same density/typography styles are generated multiple times" warning message.

How can I resolve this issue and ensure my Angular Material styles are applied correctly without duplication?

Title: TypeScript Interface Method Not Recognized in Vue Component
Title_Body:
<<TypeScript Interface Method Not Recognized in Vue Component>>
<<I’m working with TypeScript and Vue.js. I’ve created a TypeScript class that implements an interface, and I’ve defined a public method in the abstract class what is my class extending. However, when I try to call this method from within a Vue component, TypeScript throws this error :
Property 'validateFormAttributeValues' does not exist on type '{ getId: () => string | null; getFirstName: () => string | null; setFirstName: (name: string) => void; getLastName: () => string | null; setLastName: (name: string) => void; getEmail: () => string | null; ... 10 more ...; setContactDateTime: (contactDateTime: ProbandContactDateTime | null) => void; }'.ts(2339)
Even though it’s declared as public. What could be causing this issue?
Here’s a simplified version of my code:

export default abstract class FormModel 
implements FormComponentInterface
{
    constructor()
    {
        this.setValidationSchema();
    }

    setValidationSchema(): void
    {
        throw new Error("setValidationSchema not implemented")
    }
   
    validateFormAttributeValues()
    {
        // call service for validation
        ValidationService.validateFormComponent(this);
        
        return true;
    }   
}

export default class BaseProband 
extends AbstractFormModel
implements BaseProbandInterface


//draftModel is declared like this
draftModel: BaseProbandInterface | null //| FormModel

I also tried to declare it directly as FormModel.
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: TypeScript error: Property 'validateFormAttributeValues' does not exist on type
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<TypeScript error: Property 'validateFormAttributeValues' does not exist on type>>
<<## TypeScript error: Property 'validateFormAttributeValues' does not exist on type 

I'm encountering a TypeScript error in my code where it says:

> Property 'validateFormAttributeValues' does not exist on type 

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```typescript
try {
  const baseProband = this.draftModel //as FormModel
  baseProband.validateFormAttributeValues(); 

  const contactDateTime = this.draftModel?.getContactDateTime() //as FormModel
} catch (error) {
  // Handle error
}
```

Title: why boost asio tcp resolver creates threads for async resolve
Title_Body:
<<why boost asio tcp resolver creates threads for async resolve>>
<<When I use the following code, it spawns a new thread.
resolver_.async_resolve(
      host_, port_,
      beast::bind_front_handler(&session::on_resolve, shared_from_this()));

But when I change it with non-async version, it does not create a new thread.
  boost::system::error_code err;
  auto const& results = resolver_.resolve(host_, port_, err);
  on_resolve(err, results);

Resolver definition:
boost::asio::ip::tcp::resolver resolver_;

This behaviour is not documented anywhere and I have been trying to understand for a hour where this thread is spawned because it basically empty thread and does not destructed anytime. Here is the screenshot of the thread details.

Boost version: boost/1.82.0
What is the purpose of this thread, and how is it related to the boost tcp async resolve?
>>

llm_zero_shot_body:

**Screenshot:**

[Insert Screenshot Here]

**Context:**

- The program is paused at the `_futex_abstimed_wait_common64` function.
- Thread 6 (LWP 13592) is the currently selected thread.
- The `futex_word` variable points to memory address `0x5555561de1cc`.

llm_zero_shot_body:
## System.NullReferenceException when setting Form.TopLevel to False

I'm getting a `System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.'` error when trying to set the `TopLevel` property of a new form to `False`. 

Here's the relevant code:

```vb.net
Public Class Form1
    Dim Form2 As Form2

    Private Sub Form1_Load(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load 
        ' ... other code ...

        With Me.Form2
            Me.Form2 = New Form2("Some name")
            .TopLevel = False 
        End With

        ' ... other code ...
    End Sub
End Class
```

The exception is thrown on the line `.TopLevel = False`. I've verified that `Form2` is declared as a class-level variable and that a new instance of `Form2` is created before this line. 

**Expected behavior:** The `TopLevel` property of `Form2` should be set to `False`.

**Actual behavior:** A `System.NullReferenceException` is thrown.

What am I doing wrong?

```C#
// jsonContent contains a valid JSON string
string jsonContent = "{ \"items\": [ { \"q\": { \"id\": null, \"weight\": 0, \"name\": \"Original Search\", \"originalSearch\": true, \"value\": \"murder\" }, \"dWim\": true, \"qLang\": \"NaturalAnd\", \"parseAlgori... }";

```

llm_cot_title: C# - How to access specific item in nested JSON object after deserialization using Newtonsoft.Json?
llm_cot_combined:
<<C# - How to access specific item in nested JSON object after deserialization using Newtonsoft.Json?>>
<<I'm trying to deserialize a complex JSON object in C# using Newtonsoft.Json, but I'm having trouble accessing the nested objects and properties.

Here's the JSON structure:

```json
{
  "recallQueryToken": null,
  "anyAttr": [],
  "items": [
    {
      "q": {
        "id": null,
        "weight": 0,
        "name": "Original Search",
        "originalSearch": true,
        "value": "murder",
        "dWim": true,
        "qLang": "NaturalAnd",
        "parseAlgorithm": "..."
      }
    }
  ]
}
```

I have defined the following classes to represent the JSON structure:

```csharp
public class Conditions
{
    public List<Item> Items { get; set; }
}

public class Item
{
    public Q q { get; set; }
}

public class Q
{
    public int Id { get; set; }
    public int Weight { get; set; }
    // ... other properties
}
```

I'm using the following code to deserialize the JSON:

```csharp
string jsonContent = "{...}"; // JSON content from file
Conditions conditions = JsonConvert.DeserializeObject<Conditions>(jsonContent);
```

When I try to access `conditions.Items[0].q.value`, I get a `NullReferenceException`. The debugger shows that `conditions.Items` has one element, but `conditions.Items[0].q` is null.

I've tried different ways to deserialize the JSON, including using `JsonConvert.PopulateObject` and creating a custom `JsonConverter`, but I haven't been able to access the nested `q` object.

What am I doing wrong? How can I deserialize this JSON and access the nested properties correctly?>>

Title: GraphQL schema not recognized in WebStorm
Title_Body:
<<GraphQL schema not recognized in WebStorm>>
<<I am working in a repo for Shopify Admin UI extensions (and I think the repo was generated by some Shopify CLI) and using gql to write GraphQL formatted queries inside template strings. But WebStorm does not seem to recognize the schema.
We do have a .graphqlrc.ts file at our root
import fs from "fs";
import { LATEST_API_VERSION } from "@shopify/shopify-api";
import { shopifyApiProject, ApiType } from "@shopify/api-codegen-preset";
import type { IGraphQLConfig } from "graphql-config";

function getConfig() {
  const config: IGraphQLConfig = {
    projects: {
      default: shopifyApiProject({
        apiType: ApiType.Admin,
        apiVersion: LATEST_API_VERSION,
        documents: ["./app/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}"],
        outputDir: "./app/types",
      }),
    },
  };

  let extensions: string[] = [];
  try {
    extensions = fs.readdirSync("./extensions");
  } catch {
    // ignore if no extensions
  }

  for (const entry of extensions) {
    const extensionPath = `./extensions/${entry}`;
    const schema = `${extensionPath}/schema.graphql`;
    if (!fs.existsSync(schema)) {
      continue;
    }
    config.projects[entry] = {
      schema,
      documents: [`${extensionPath}/**/*.graphql`],
    };
  }

  return config;
}

module.exports = getConfig();

The GraphQL pane in WebStorm finds something:

But searching the "Schema discovery summary" only finds basic things like Boolean, and not any of the Shopify stuff like CollectionInput or anything like that.
Is the graphqlrc.ts set up correctly to get all the Shopify API info? (when I run dev ("shopify app dev -c shopify.app.dev.toml") and go to the GraphQL portal, all the APIs are there, FWIW.
>>

<> <<## React useLayoutEffect firing multiple times I have a simple React component that uses `useLayoutEffect` to log a message to the console. However, I'm noticing that the `useLayoutEffect` callback is being called twice on every render. Here's my code: ```javascript export default function CompA() { const [count, setCount] = useState(0); useLayoutEffect(() => { console.log('CompA layoutEffectCallback'); }); useEffect(() => { console.log('CompA updateEffectCallback'); }, [count]); // ... rest of the component code return (
CompA

{count}

); } ``` **Expected behavior:** I expect the `CompA layoutEffectCallback` message to be logged to the console only **once** per render. **Actual behavior:** The `CompA layoutEffectCallback` message is being logged **twice** per render. I've tried adding a dependency array to the `useLayoutEffect` hook, but that didn't change anything. I'm not sure why this is happening or how to fix it. Any help would be greatly appreciated.>>

Title: Override (reintroduce) property with typescript declaration merging
Title_Body:
<<Override (reintroduce) property with typescript declaration merging>>
<<The base/built-in declaration of Event and GlobalEventHandlersEventMap looks like so:
// lib.dom.d.ts

interface Event {
    /**
     * Returns the type of event, e.g. "click", "hashchange", or "submit".
     */
    readonly type: string;   // <-- note this part
}

interface GlobalEventHandlersEventMap {
    click: MouseEvent;
    //... all sorts of other built in events...
}

Let's say I define an EventTriggered whose constructor has a parameter containing one of the properties named in GlobalEventHandlersEventMap:
class EventTriggered {
    constructor(
        readonly eventName: keyof GlobalEventHandlersEventMap
    ) {}
}

This means that the following works because there is a property named 'click':
new EventTriggered('click');

But the following will not work (this is ok and intended):
new EventTriggered('some-random-string');

Now I want to use this class inside an event listener, like so:
function onClick(event: Event): void {
    new EventTriggered(event.type);
}

This will fail because as in the first example, event.type contains "any string". Type casting could be one way of solving this:
function onClick(event: Event): void {
    new EventTriggered(event.type as keyof GlobalEventHandlersEventMap);
}

BUT in my opinion, the original declaration of type is wrong - it should not be string, but keyof GlobalEventHandlersEventMap.
I tried doing that with declaration merging:
// global.d.ts
interface Event {
    readonly type: keyof GlobalEventHandlersEventMap;
}

What happens then is that the previous error still shows up, but now my IDE shows that type has two declarations:


I also saw this question, but it feels different - for one thing, I'm not getting the same error as that one: TypeScript declaration merging - changing a property type
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Typescript error: Cannot infer type of 'e.type' - Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'keyof GlobalEventHandlersEventMap'
llm_zero_shot_body:
## TypeScript Type Conflict: keyof GlobalEventHandlersEventMap vs. string

I'm encountering a type conflict in my TypeScript project and I'm not sure how to resolve it. When I try to access `e.type` inside an event handler, I get a type error.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```typescript
someElement.addEventListener('click', (e) => {
  console.log(e.type); 
});
```

The IDE suggests two possible types for `e.type`:

1. `keyof GlobalEventHandlersEventMap`
2. `string`

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect `e.type` to be recognized as a `string` representing the event type (e.g., 'click', 'mouseover').

**Actual Behavior:**

I'm getting a type error related to the conflicting types. It seems like TypeScript is unsure whether to infer the type as a specific event type from `GlobalEventHandlersEventMap` or a general `string`.

**Question:**

How can I resolve this type conflict and ensure that `e.type` is correctly inferred as a `string`?

<<I'm having trouble understanding why TypeScript is giving me two type options for `e.type` in an event listener. Here's the situation:

```typescript
element.addEventListener('click', (e) => {
  // ...
  const eventType = e.type; 
});
```

When I hover over `e.type`, my IDE (VS Code) shows a "Choose Declaration" popup with these options:

1. `type: keyof GlobalEventHandlersEventMap... (Event, /src/global.d.ts)`
2. `type: string (Event, typescript, dom)`

I understand that `e.type` should return the type of the event (e.g., 'click', 'mouseover'). The second option (`string`) seems to align with this. However, I'm unsure what the first option (`keyof GlobalEventHandlersEventMap`) means and why it's being suggested. 

I've tried looking into `GlobalEventHandlersEventMap`, but I haven't found a clear explanation that helps me understand this situation. 

Could someone please explain:

* What `keyof GlobalEventHandlersEventMap` represents in this context?
* Why are both options being presented, and how do they differ?
* Which option is more appropriate to use in general, and why?>>

Title: How to fix the Type Error ,,TransitionSpec throw type error in React Native Custom Animation of StackNavigator from @react-navigation/Stack
Title_Body:
<<How to fix the Type Error ,,TransitionSpec throw type error in React Native Custom Animation of StackNavigator from @react-navigation/Stack>>
<<
As i am implementing the Custom animation while user navigate through screen i got a type error. in the  Stack Navigator section while using available property for custom animation i.e transitionSpec


import { Easing, StyleSheet, Text, View } from "react-native";

import Home from "./screens/Home";
import Details from "./screens/Details";

import {
  createStackNavigator,
  CardStyleInterpolators,
} from "@react-navigation/stack";
import { NavigationContainer } from "@react-navigation/native";
export type RootStackParamList = {
  Home: undefined; // No parameters expected for Home screen
  Details: undefined;
};

const Config = {
  animation: "spring",
  config: {
    stiffness: 1000,
    damping: 50,
    mass: 3,
    overshootClamping: false,
    restDisplacementThreshold: 0.01,
    restSpeedThreshold: 0.01,
  },
};
const closeConfig = {
  animation: "timing",
  config: {
    duration: 200,
    easing: Easing.linear,
  },
};

const Stack = createStackNavigator<RootStackParamList>();
export default function App() {
  return (
    <NavigationContainer>
      <Stack.Navigator
        screenOptions={{
          gestureDirection: "horizontal",
          transitionSpec: {
            open: Config,
            close: closeConfig,
          },
          cardStyleInterpolator: CardStyleInterpolators.forHorizontalIOS,
        }}
      >
        <Stack.Screen name="Home" component={Home} />
        <Stack.Screen name="Details" component={Details} />
      </Stack.Navigator>
    </NavigationContainer>
  );
}

const styles = StyleSheet.create({
  container: {
    flex: 1,
    backgroundColor: "#fff",
    alignItems: "center",
    justifyContent: "center",
  },
});


The type error i got is in the transitionSpec on open and close property. below is the error i have post
[![

>>

llm_cot_title: React Navigation: Type '{ animation: string; config: { ... } }' is not assignable to type 'TransitionSpec'
llm_cot_combined:
<<React Navigation: Type '{ animation: string; config: { ... } }' is not assignable to type 'TransitionSpec'>>
<<I am having trouble setting up custom transitions for my React Native app using `react-navigation/native` (version 6). I am trying to use different animations for opening and closing transitions, but I am getting a type error.

Here is my code:

```typescript
import { NavigationContainer } from "@react-navigation/native";
import { createStackNavigator } from "@react-navigation/stack";
import { Easing } from "react-native";
import { CardStyleInterpolators } from "@react-navigation/stack";

export type RootStackParamList = {};

const Config = {
  animation: "spring",
  config: {
    stiffness: 1000,
    damping: 50,
    mass: 3,
    overshootClamping: false,
    restDisplacementThreshold: 0.01,
    restSpeedThreshold: 0.01,
  },
};

const closeConfig = {
  animation: "timing",
  config: {
    duration: 200,
    easing: Easing.linear,
  },
};

const Stack = createStackNavigator<RootStackParamList>();

export default function App() {
  return (
    <NavigationContainer>
      <Stack.Navigator
        screenOptions={{
          gestureDirection: "horizontal",
          transitionSpec: {
            open: Config,
            close: closeConfig,
          },
          cardStyleInterpolator: CardStyleInterpolators.forHorizontalIOS,
        }}
      ></Stack.Navigator>
    </NavigationContainer>
  );
}
```

And here is the error message:

```
Type '{ animation: string; config: { stiffness: number; damping: number; mass: number; overshootClamping: boolean; restDisplacementThreshold: number; restSpeedThreshold: number; }; }' is not assignable to type 'TransitionSpec'.  Type '{ animation: string; config: { duration: number; easing: EasingFunction; }; }' is not assignable to type 'TransitionSpec'.
```

It seems like the `open` and `close` properties of `transitionSpec` are expecting a different type than what I am providing. I have tried looking at the documentation for `TransitionSpec`, but I am not sure what I am doing wrong.

Can anyone help me understand what I am doing wrong and how to fix this type error?>>

llm_zero_shot_title: Angular 14 - Error: export 'ANIMATION_MODULE_TYPE' (imported as 'ANIMATION_MODULE_TYPE') was not found in '@angular/common'
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Angular 15: Error: export 'ANIMATION_MODULE_TYPE' (imported as 'ANIMATION_MODULE_TYPE') was not found in '@angular/common'

I am getting the following error when trying to run my Angular 15 application:

`../node_modules/@angular/common/fesm2020/common.mjs:3049:12-32 - Error: export 'ANIMATION_MODULE_TYPE' (imported as 'ANIMATION_MODULE_TYPE') was not found in '@angular/common'`

This error seems to be coming from the `@angular/common` package, specifically the `fesm2020/common.mjs` file. I have tried reinstalling the `@angular/common` package, but the error persists.

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect my Angular application to compile and run without errors.

**Actual Behavior:**

I am getting the error mentioned above, and my application fails to compile.

**What I have tried:**

* Reinstalling the `@angular/common` package.
* Clearing the npm cache.
* Deleting the `node_modules` folder and running `npm install` again.

**My Environment:**

* Angular: 15.x.x
* Node: x.x.x
* npm: x.x.x

Any help in resolving this issue would be greatly appreciated.

Title: GitHub doesn't list latest release as "latest"
Body:
I've set of organizational private repos with quite long lists of releases. Releases have names N-Y.M.D-X where N is sequential number, Y.M.D is date of the release and X could be commit hashcode or combination of branch name and hashcode.

The problem is the release 9-2024.10.13-607d6fd (from two weeks ago) is still marked as "latest" even if there are other recent releases (the actual last one - 17-2024.10.15-rename-models-1533982 - is from last week).
It looks like GitHub changed the way of latest evaluation from different day timestamps or consider the version number (9-2024 > 17-2024 lexicographically) prior the release timestamp.
Is there a way to fix that? Is it a problem of GitHub or the format of the first part of version number N-Y?
BTW: If list releases by tag then they are ordered right way.
Title_Body:
<<GitHub doesn't list latest release as "latest">>
<<I've set of organizational private repos with quite long lists of releases. Releases have names N-Y.M.D-X where N is sequential number, Y.M.D is date of the release and X could be commit hashcode or combination of branch name and hashcode.

The problem is the release 9-2024.10.13-607d6fd (from two weeks ago) is still marked as "latest" even if there are other recent releases (the actual last one - 17-2024.10.15-rename-models-1533982 - is from last week).
It looks like GitHub changed the way of latest evaluation from different day timestamps or consider the version number (9-2024 > 17-2024 lexicographically) prior the release timestamp.
Is there a way to fix that? Is it a problem of GitHub or the format of the first part of version number N-Y?
BTW: If list releases by tag then they are ordered right way.
>>

Multiple releases are being created for the same tag/commit, with slight variations in the release name.

**Questions:**

* How can I configure my workflow to ensure only one release is created per tag/commit? 

Any help in resolving this issue would be greatly appreciated.

llm_cot_title: Github Actions - How to prevent duplicate releases with same commit hash but different tags?
llm_cot_body:
I am trying to understand the release history of a project on GitHub and I'm a bit confused about the version numbering scheme. It seems like there are two different sequences of releases:

* **9-2024.10.13-607d6fd** (2 weeks ago)
* **17-2024.10.15-rename-models-1533982** (last week)
* **16-2024.10.15-rename-models-8c3ceb3** (last week)
* **14-2024.10.15-rename-models-87f2e2d** (last week)
* **13-2024.10.15-rename-models-b549945** (last week)

and

* **8-2024.9.13-4c723fb** (Sep 13)
* **7-2024.9.13-2a57a14** (Sep 13)
* **6-2024.9.13-bc8e7b6** (Sep 13)
* **6-2024.8.31-bc8e7b6** (Aug 31)
* **5-2024.8.30-6ea8bdc** (Aug 31)

The first sequence seems to be using a different date format (YYYY.MM.DD) compared to the second sequence (YYYY.MM.DD). Additionally, the first sequence has an extra number at the beginning (9, 17, 16, 14, 13).

Can someone explain why there are two different versioning schemes being used in the same repository? Is this a common practice? How can I determine which release is the most recent one?

Title: Dynamic Configuration of Facebook Login with react-native-fbsdk-next in Expo
Body:
I am using react-native-fbsdk-next with Expo to implement Facebook login. In order to configure this, I need to include certain settings in app.config.ts, as shown in the image below:

However, I want to avoid hardcoding these values directly in the configuration file. Instead of using environment variables, I would like to fetch these configurations dynamically from an API, allowing me to update them whenever necessary. Since app.config.ts is generated only at build time, is there a way to pass these configurations dynamically?
I came across a potential solution
  const setFBSDKSecrets = async () => {
      const res: SSOType = await API('/auth/get-credentials', {
        method: 'GET',
      })

      Settings.setAppID(res.facebook.clientId)
      Settings.setClientToken(res.facebook.clientToken)
      Settings.setAppName('myApp')
      Settings.setAdvertiserIDCollectionEnabled(false)
      Settings.setAutoLogAppEventsEnabled(false)
    }

    setFBSDKSecrets()

I implemented this by adding the settings there and removing them from app.config.ts. However, when I ran yarn start, I encountered an error stating that the appID is missing:
Error: missing appID in the plugin properties

Can anyone provide solution on how to resolve this issue or suggest a better approach for dynamically configuring Facebook login settings in Expo?
Title_Body:
<<Dynamic Configuration of Facebook Login with react-native-fbsdk-next in Expo>>
<<I am using react-native-fbsdk-next with Expo to implement Facebook login. In order to configure this, I need to include certain settings in app.config.ts, as shown in the image below:

However, I want to avoid hardcoding these values directly in the configuration file. Instead of using environment variables, I would like to fetch these configurations dynamically from an API, allowing me to update them whenever necessary. Since app.config.ts is generated only at build time, is there a way to pass these configurations dynamically?
I came across a potential solution
  const setFBSDKSecrets = async () => {
      const res: SSOType = await API('/auth/get-credentials', {
        method: 'GET',
      })

      Settings.setAppID(res.facebook.clientId)
      Settings.setClientToken(res.facebook.clientToken)
      Settings.setAppName('myApp')
      Settings.setAdvertiserIDCollectionEnabled(false)
      Settings.setAutoLogAppEventsEnabled(false)
    }

    setFBSDKSecrets()

I implemented this by adding the settings there and removing them from app.config.ts. However, when I ran yarn start, I encountered an error stating that the appID is missing:
Error: missing appID in the plugin properties

Can anyone provide solution on how to resolve this issue or suggest a better approach for dynamically configuring Facebook login settings in Expo?
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: React Native FBSDK: How to Configure `iosUserTrackingPermission` for Personalized Ads?
llm_zero_shot_body:
## React Native FBSDK: iosUserTrackingPermission string instead of boolean

I'm trying to configure `react-native-fbsdk-next` in my React Native project and I'm facing an issue with the `iosUserTrackingPermission` setting. 

Here's my `expo.plugins` configuration in `app.json`:

```json
{
  "expo": {
    "plugins": [
      [
        "react-native-fbsdk-next",
        {
          "appID": "48127127xxxxxxxx",
          "clientToken": "c5078631e4065b60d7544a95xxxxxxxx",
          "displayName": "RN SDK Demo",
          "scheme": "fb48127127xxxxxxxx",
          "advertiserIDCollectionEnabled": false,
          "autoLogAppEventsEnabled": false,
          "isAutoInitEnabled": true,
          "iosUserTrackingPermission": "This identifier will be used to deliver personalized ads to you"
        }
      ]
    ]
  }
}
```

The problem is that the `iosUserTrackingPermission`  is expecting a boolean value (true/false) but I'm getting a string value instead. 

**Expected behavior:** 
The `iosUserTrackingPermission` should accept a boolean value to indicate whether to request user tracking permission.

**Actual behavior:**
The configuration seems to be interpreting the `iosUserTrackingPermission` as a string, and I'm not sure where this string value is even coming from.

How can I fix this configuration and provide the correct boolean value for `iosUserTrackingPermission`?

llm_few_shot_title: How to Mask Sensitive Data in JSON File
llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to use the React Native SDK in my Expo project. I have installed the `expo-firebase-sdk` package and added my app's credentials to my `app.json` file. However, when I try to run my app, I get an error message saying that the `appId` is not defined. I have double checked that the `appId` is correct in my `app.json` file. What could be causing this issue?

**Error Message:**
```
Error: [Firebase] Cannot initialize app '[appID]': appId is not configured
```

The most important part of the error is the message "appId is not configured". This indicates that the SDK is not able to find the `appId` for my app.

Title: VIM snippet (UltiSnips): pad line until column 80 reached with a character
Body:
The code I often work at has a comment style like
#---------------------------------------------
# this is a comment
#---------------------------------------------
this.is_code()

I wanted to write a VIM snippet (using UltiSnips) that pads the comment box up until column number 80 (or better until vims colorcolumn). It should take the indentation level into account and always fill the dashes up until column 80.
I have a working snippet present that looks like this
snippet #
#`!p snip.rv = '-' * (80 - vim.current.window.cursor[1])`
# $1
#`!p snip.rv = '-' * (80 - vim.current.window.cursor[1])`
$0
endsnippet

Problem here is that when I start typing the number of dashes moves back. Because while I enter a comment the cursor I use in the snipept moves.
I think I need a pyhton or VIM variable that holdes the lines column from which I can subtract 80. But I can't find anything that works for this case.
Edit:
I've found one possible solution to avoid the moving dashes in the template by checking snip.c By checking for emptyness I can make sure that interpolation is done only once.
snippet #
#`!p if snip.c == "": snip.rv = '-' * (80 - vim.current.window.cursor[1])`
# $1
#`!p if snip.c == "": snip.rv = '-' * (80 - vim.current.window.cursor[1])`
$0
endsnippet

Unfortunately since I still have not found a replacement for using the current cursor position vim.current.window.cursor I get wrong lengths for snippets that have comments in indented blocks. For example:
snippet if
#`!p if snip.c == "": snip.rv = '-' * (80 - vim.current.window.cursor[1])`
# if comment
#`!p if snip.c == "": snip.rv = '-' * (80 - vim.current.window.cursor[1])`
IF( $1 )
   #`!p if snip.c == "": snip.rv = '-' * (80 - vim.current.window.cursor[1])`
   # inside if
   #`!p if snip.c == "": snip.rv = '-' * (80 - vim.current.window.cursor[1])`
   $0
   #`!p if snip.c == "": snip.rv = '-' * (80 - vim.current.window.cursor[1])`
END IF
endsnippet

llm_zero_shot_title: How to specify type for fetched JSON data in TypeScript?
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<How to specify type for fetched JSON data in TypeScript?>>
<<I'm having trouble getting the correct type for my fetched JSON data in a React component. My IDE is showing the type of the `json` parameter in the second `.then()` callback as `any`.

Here's the code:

```typescript
useEffect(() => {
  fetch('https://api.example.com/people/1/')
    .then((response) => response.json())
    .then((json: any) => setData(json));
}, []);
```

**Expected Behavior:**

I want the `json` parameter to have a specific type that reflects the structure of the data returned from the API. For example, if the API returns an object with a `name` property (string) and an `age` property (number), I would like the type of `json` to be:

```typescript
interface Person {
  name: string;
  age: number;
}
```

**Actual Behavior:**

Currently, the IDE infers the type of `json` as `any`, which means I don't get any type checking or autocompletion for the data.

How can I correctly type the `json` parameter in my `fetch` call?>>
llm_few_shot_title: How to Pass a Parameter in a Fetch Request

<<I am trying to fetch data from an API endpoint using the `fetch` API in a React component. I am passing a parameter to the API endpoint, but the API is not returning any data. The `json` parameter in the `then` callback is always empty.

The most important part of the error is that the `json` parameter is empty, which indicates that the API is not returning any data.

Here is the relevant code:
```
useEffect(() => {
  fetch(`http://api.example.com/data/${parameter}`)
    .then((response) => response.json())
    .then((json) => setData(json));
}, []);
```

I have verified that the API endpoint is correct and that the parameter is being passed correctly. I have also tried using a different API endpoint, but the result is the same. What could be causing this issue?>>

Title: cannot use method fileTypeFromStream in aws lambda typescript handler
Title_Body:
<<cannot use method fileTypeFromStream in aws lambda typescript handler>>
<<Node version : node -v v20.17.0
packages versions :
"@types/aws-lambda": "^8.10.145",
"@aws-sdk/client-s3": "^3.678.0",
"file-type": "^19.6.0"
When getting an object from s3 bucket, the stream returned is not compatible with the stream accepted by the fileTypeFromStream method :
import { GetObjectCommand, S3Client, type GetObjectCommandInput } from '@aws-sdk/client-s3';
import type { Handler, S3Event } from 'aws-lambda';
import { fileTypeFromStream } from 'file-type';

export const handler: Handler = async (event: S3Event) => {
  const record = event.Records[0];

  const input: GetObjectCommandInput = {
    Bucket: record.s3.bucket.name,
    Key: record.s3.object.key,
  };

  const command = new GetObjectCommand(input);

  const s3Client = new S3Client();

  const body = (await s3Client.send(command)).Body;

  if (body) {
    await fileTypeFromStream(body);
  }
};

I'm getting the following error :

Do you know have an idea of whats is the issue?
EDIT :
I've called the method transformToWebStream on the Body, to bypass the compilation error, but this time I'm getting an issue at runtime :
{
    "errorType": "TypeError",
    "errorMessage": "The argument 'stream' must be a byte stream. Received ReadableStream { locked: false, state: 'readable', supportsBYOB: false }",
    "code": "ERR_INVALID_ARG_VALUE",
    "stack": [
        "TypeError [ERR_INVALID_ARG_VALUE]: The argument 'stream' must be a byte stream. Received ReadableStream { locked: false, state: 'readable', supportsBYOB: false }",

        "    at new ReadableStreamBYOBReader (node:internal/webstreams/readablestream:918:5)",
        "    at ReadableStream.getReader (node:internal/webstreams/readablestream:355:12)",
        "    at new kl (/var/task/index.js:56:259360)",
        "    at Ap (/var/task/index.js:56:262891)",
        "    at SS.fromStream (/var/task/index.js:57:7228)",
        "    at sG (/var/task/index.js:57:7930)",
        "    at Runtime.lbe [as handler] (/var/task/index.js:57:8141)",
        "    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5)"
    ]
} 

>>
llm_zero_shot_title: TypeScript Error: 'StreamingBlobPayloadOutputTypes' is not assignable to type 'AnyWebByteStream' in AWS Lambda with S3 GetObjectCommand
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<TypeScript Error: 'StreamingBlobPayloadOutputTypes' is not assignable to type 'AnyWebByteStream' in AWS Lambda with S3 GetObjectCommand>>
<<I am trying to get the file type of an object stored in S3 from an AWS Lambda function using Typescript. I am using the `@aws-sdk/client-s3` and `file-type` libraries.

Here is my code:

```typescript
import { GetObjectCommand, S3Client, type GetObjectCommandInput } from '@aws-sdk/client-s3';
import type { Handler, S3Event } from 'aws-lambda';
import { fileTypeFromStream } from 'file-type';

export const handler: Handler = async (event: S3Event) => {
  const record = event.Records[0];

  const input: GetObjectCommandInput = {
    Bucket: record.s3.bucket.name,
    Key: record.s3.object.key,
  };

  const command = new GetObjectCommand(input);
  const s3Client = new S3Client({});
  const body = (await s3Client.send(command)).Body;

  if (body) {
    await fileTypeFromStream(body);
  }
};
```

However, I am getting the following TypeScript error:

```
Argument of type 'StreamingBlobPayloadOutputTypes' is not assignable to parameter of type 'AnyWebByteStream'.
Type 'Readable & SdkStreamMixin' is not assignable to type 'AnyWebByteStream'.
Type 'Readable & SdkStreamMixin' is missing the following properties from type 'ReadableStream<Uint8Array>': locked, cancel, getReader, pipeThrough, and 3 more. ts(2345)
```

It seems like the `Body` property of the `GetObjectCommandOutput` is not compatible with the `fileTypeFromStream` function. How can I fix this type mismatch and get the file type of the S3 object?>>

The error message states: "Argument of type 'StreamingBlobPayloadOutputTypes' is not assignable to parameter of type 'AnyReadable | SdkStreamMixin'..." and suggests that the 'StreamingBody' type is missing properties like 'cancel', 'getReader', 'pipeThrough', and more.

llm_cot_title: Type 'StreamingBlobPayloadOutputTypes' is not assignable to type 'AnyWebByteStream' in AWS Lambda with S3 client
llm_cot_combined:
<<Type 'StreamingBlobPayloadOutputTypes' is not assignable to type 'AnyWebByteStream' in AWS Lambda with S3 client>>
<<I am getting a TypeScript error in my AWS Lambda function that reads:

`Argument of type 'StreamingBlobPayloadOutputTypes' is not assignable to parameter of type 'AnyWebByteStream'.`

It further says:

`Type 'Readable & SdkStreamMixin' is not assignable to type 'AnyWebByteStream'. Type 'Readable & SdkStreamMixin' is missing the following properties from type 'ReadableStream<Uint8Array>': locked, cancel, getReader, pipeThrough, and 3 more. ts (2345)`

Here is the relevant code snippet:

```typescript
import { GetObjectCommand, S3Client, type GetObjectCommandInput } from '@aws-sdk/client-s3';
import type { Handler, S3Event } from 'aws-lambda';
import { fileTypeFromStream } from 'file-type';

export const handler: Handler = async (event: S3Event) => {
  const record = event.Records[0];

  const input: GetObjectCommandInput = {
    Bucket: record.s3.bucket.name,
    Key: record.s3.object.key,
  };

  const command = new GetObjectCommand(input);
  const s3Client = new S3Client({});
  const body = (await s3Client.send(command)).Body;

  if (body) {
    await fileTypeFromStream(body);
  }
};
```

I am trying to get the object from S3 and then determine its file type using `fileTypeFromStream`. I am unsure how to resolve this type mismatch. I have tried casting `body` to `AnyWebByteStream` but that didn't work. 

How can I fix this type error and correctly pass the S3 object body to `fileTypeFromStream`?>>

Title: How to to expose elements for automation but not for accessibility in swift UIKit?
Title_Body:
<<How to to expose elements for automation but not for accessibility in swift UIKit?>>
<<I have two views in a container view as below
@IBOutlet weak var dataDisclosureView: UIStackView! // Main ContainerView

@IBOutlet private weak var titleLabel: UILabel! {
        didSet {
            titleLabel.text = "Hello"
        }
    }
        
    @IBOutlet private weak var descriptionLabel: UILabel! {
        didSet {
            descriptionLabel.text = "World"
        }
    }
    
    @IBOutlet weak var descriptionView: UIStackView! { // sub container view containing titleLabel and descriptionLabel
        didSet {
            descriptionView.isAccessibilityElement = true
            descriptionView.accessibilityLabel = "Hello"
            descriptionView.accessibilityIdentifier = "test_hello"

        }
    }
    
    @IBOutlet private weak var requestButton: UIButton! {
        didSet {
            requestButton.isAccessibilityElement = true
            requestButton.accessibilityLabel = "Request Button"
            requestButton.accessibilityIdentifier = "test_button"
        }
    }

override func viewDidLoad() {
        super.viewDidLoad()
        dataDisclosureView.isAccessibilityElement = false
        dataDisclosureView.accessibilityElements = [ descriptionView ?? "" ]
        if #available(iOS 17.0, *) {
            dataDisclosureView.automationElements = [ descriptionView ?? "",
                                                      requestButton ?? ""]
        } else {
            // Fallback on earlier versions
        }
       let requestButtonAction = UIAccessibilityCustomAction(name: "start",
                                                          target: self,
                                                          selector: #selector( request))
    dataDisclosureView.accessibilityCustomActions = [ requestButtonAction ]
    }

Mx issue is I want  AccessibilityIdentifers for descriptionLabel,titleLabel,requestButton and hintLabel(For Automation) and accessibility labels for descriptionView and requestButton(VoiceOver Accessibility).
But I am unable to see accessibilityIdentifier for Button, TitleLabel and descriptionLabel in AccessibilityInspector. what am I doing wrong here?
PS: I also followed below video :
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IAqzXI3kFCk
This is a working solution
 dataDisclosureView.accessibilityElements = [dataDisclosureView as Any,
                                           titleLabel as Any,
                                           descriptionLabel as Any,
                                           requestButton as Any,
                                           hintLabel as Any]
        if #available(iOS 17.0, *) {
            dataDisclosureView.automationElements =  [titleLabel as Any,
                                             descriptionLabel as Any,
                                             requestButton as Any,
                                             hintLabel as Any]
        } else {
            // Fallback on earlier versions
        }

but I am not satisfied with that because in one of Apple WWDC video it was mentioned that if we want exempt item from voice over accessibility don't add it in accessibilityItems and if we want in automation elements just add it. They haven't provided deeper details . Reference is https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IAqzXI3kFCk also adding screenshot about what I am saying
According to this it should be
dataDisclosureView.accessibilityElements = [dataDisclosureView as Any,
                                           titleLabel as Any,
                                           descriptionLabel as Any,
                                           requestButton as Any]
        if #available(iOS 17.0, *) {
            dataDisclosureView.automationElements =  [titleLabel as Any,
                                             descriptionLabel as Any,
                                             requestButton as Any,
                                             hintLabel as Any]
        } else {
            // Fallback on earlier versions
        }

>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Swift/iOS - Difference between view.accessibilityElements and view.automationElements?
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Xcode Warning: "Value of type 'UIView' has no member 'automationElements'"

I'm working on a Swift project in Xcode and I'm trying to set up UI testing using the `automationElements` property of my view. However, Xcode is giving me an error saying **"Value of type 'UIView' has no member 'automationElements'"**.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```swift
import UIKit

class QuoteViewController: UIViewController {

    override func viewDidLoad() {
        super.viewDidLoad()
        setupViews()
        view.accessibilityElements = [quoteTextView, newQuoteButton]
        view.automationElements = [imageView, quoteTextView, newQuoteButton] 
    }
}
```

I've checked the Apple documentation and I can't seem to find any information about this property being deprecated or renamed. I'm using the latest version of Xcode.

**What could be causing this error and how can I fix it?**
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<Swift/iOS - Difference between view.accessibilityElements and view.automationElements?>>
<<## Xcode Warning: "Value of type 'UIView' has no member 'automationElements'"

I'm working on a Swift project in Xcode and I'm trying to set up UI testing using the `automationElements` property of my view. However, Xcode is giving me an error saying **"Value of type 'UIView' has no member 'automationElements'"**.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```swift
import UIKit

class QuoteViewController: UIViewController {

    override func viewDidLoad() {
        super.viewDidLoad()
        setupViews()
        view.accessibilityElements = [quoteTextView, newQuoteButton]
        view.automationElements = [imageView, quoteTextView, newQuoteButton] 
    }
}
```

I've checked the Apple documentation and I can't seem to find any information about this property being deprecated or renamed. I'm using the latest version of Xcode.

**What could be causing this error and how can I fix it?**>>

Title: Complex object not showing inner classes in shema
Body:
I'm consuming an external wsdl using wsdltophp. This is generating me a large class structure which I would like to make consumable by my API via SwaggerUI.
This is how I'm annotating my API entry point:
     /**
     * @OA\Post(
     *     path="/vf/alta/{registroFacturacionType}/{datosControlType}",
     *     operationId="vfAlta",
     *     description="",
     *     tags={"vf"},
     *     security={{"bearerAuth":{}}},
     *     @OA\Parameter(
     *          name="registroFacturacionType",
     *          in="path",
     *          required=true,
     *          description="",
     *          @OA\Schema(ref="#/components/schemas/RegistroFacturacionType")
     *     ),
     *     @OA\Parameter(
     *          name="datosControlType",
     *          in="path",
     *          required=true,
     *          description="",
     *          @OA\Schema(ref="#/components/schemas/DatosControlType")
     *     ),
     *     @OA\Response(
     *         response=200,
     *         description="",
     *         @OA\Schema(ref="RespuestaAltaFactuSistemaFacturacionType")
     *     )
     * )
     */

The generated swagger entry point looks like this now:

Where all the inner classes of my main class are represented by strings. If we just take a look at the first Property (IDFactura), this is the code generated by wsdltophp
     /**
     * The IDFactura
     * @var \App\Application\ServiceReferences\Verifactu\StructType\IDFacturaExpedidaType|null
     * @OA\Property()
     */
    protected ?\App\Application\ServiceReferences\Verifactu\StructType\IDFacturaExpedidaType $IDFactura = null;

(The @OA\Schema is also generated by wsdltophp) But it's clear that my SwaggerUI is representing this inner class like a simple string.
Since this WSDL is external and I have no control over it, nor the wsdltophp generated code, I'm looking for a solution which would avoid updating/modifying those external classes
Title_Body:
<<Complex object not showing inner classes in shema>>

     *     security={{"bearerAuth":{}}},
     *     @OA\Parameter(
     *          name="registroFacturacionType",
     *          in="path",
     *          required=true,
     *          description="",
     *          @OA\Schema(ref="#/components/schemas/RegistroFacturacionType")
     *     ),

llm_zero_shot_title: How to handle complex nested JSON object with many string fields in API response?

## How to handle special characters and underscores in API definition?

I'm defining an API endpoint that accepts a JSON object with a complex structure. Some of the field names in this object contain special characters like underscores ("_"), periods ("."), and numbers. 

Here's a snippet of my API definition:

```json
{
  "IDFactura": "string",
  "NombreRazonEmisor": "string",
  "TipoRegistroSIF": "string",
  // ... other fields
  "FacturaSimplificadaArticulos7_2_7_3": "string",
  "FacturaSinIdentifDestinatarioArticulo6_1_d": "string",
  // ... other fields
}
```

**Expected Behavior:**

I want to be able to define and use these field names without encountering errors or having to rename them to remove the special characters. 

**Actual Behavior:**

I'm not sure what the best practice is for handling these types of field names. Should I be escaping the special characters in some way? Or is there a specific naming convention I should be following?

I'm using [Specify the framework/library you're using for the API definition (e.g., Swagger, OpenAPI 3.0)] and [Specify the programming language you're using (e.g., Python, JavaScript)]. Any guidance on how to handle this situation would be greatly appreciated.

llm_zero_shot_title: C# - Should I use "Color" or "Colour" in my C# code?
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<C# - Should I use "Color" or "Colour" in my C# code?>>
<<## DateTime property without nullable operator (?) causing build errors

I have a `QualificationModel` class with a `Completed` property of type `DateTime`. I want this property to be optional and accept null values. However, when I try to build my project, I get an error message saying "Cannot convert null to 'System.DateTime' because it is a non-nullable value type".

Here is my code:

```csharp
namespace Site.Models
{
    public class QualificationModel
    {
        public string Name { get; set; }
        public DateTime? Started { get; set; }
        public DateTime Completed { get; set; } // This line throws the error
        public string Colour { get; set; }
    }
}
```

I expect the `Completed` property to allow null values just like the `Started` property which is defined as `DateTime?`. 

What am I doing wrong? How can I make the `Completed` property nullable?>>

<<I'm working on a C# project and I'm trying to understand the best way to handle potential issues with the `DateTime` data type in my model. Specifically, I have a `QualificationModel` class:

```csharp
namespace Site.Models
{
    public class QualificationModel
    {
        public string Name { get; set; }
        public DateTime? Started { get; set; }
        public DateTime Completed { get; set; }
        public string Colour { get; set; }
    }
}
```

As you can see, the `Started` property is nullable (`DateTime?`), while the `Completed` property is not. 

My concern is that if the `Completed` property is not provided or is not parsed correctly, it could lead to unexpected behavior in my application. 

Should I make the `Completed` property nullable as well? Or is there a better way to handle situations where the `Completed` date might not be available? 

I'm looking for best practices and potential pitfalls to consider when working with `DateTime` properties in C# models.>>

Title: Linux on Windows
Body:
I'm trying to familiarize myself with linux without actually running a virtual machine or installing it directly so I did use WSL (Ubuntu) and I'm confused to why some of the script that should be running in linux won't run.
For example:
"script": {
  "start": "NODE_ENV=development eleventy --serve"
  "postinstall": "rm -rf node_modules/@types/glob"
}

instead what I did was modify the start to SET NODE_ENV=development && eleventy --serve and remove the postinstall to actually run the program.
Also I'm using nvm-windows to manage my node versions. node -v and nvm -v won't run on linux but npm -v does. See image below: (It runs normally on cmd)

Can anyone help to explain. To my knowledge both windows and linux should run inside wsl.
Title_Body:
<<Linux on Windows>>
<<I'm trying to familiarize myself with linux without actually running a virtual machine or installing it directly so I did use WSL (Ubuntu) and I'm confused to why some of the script that should be running in linux won't run.
For example:
"script": {
  "start": "NODE_ENV=development eleventy --serve"
  "postinstall": "rm -rf node_modules/@types/glob"
}

instead what I did was modify the start to SET NODE_ENV=development && eleventy --serve and remove the postinstall to actually run the program.
Also I'm using nvm-windows to manage my node versions. node -v and nvm -v won't run on linux but npm -v does. See image below: (It runs normally on cmd)

Can anyone help to explain. To my knowledge both windows and linux should run inside wsl.
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: 'nvm' and 'node' commands not found, but 'npm -v' returns version. Potential PATH issue or broken installation?
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Node.js and npm not recognized after installing nvm

I'm trying to install nvm (Node Version Manager) on my Ubuntu system. I followed the instructions on the official GitHub repository, but after installing, I'm unable to run `nvm`, `node`, or `npm`.

Here's what I did:

1. I ran the curl command from the nvm GitHub page.
2. I closed and reopened my terminal.
3. I tried running `nvm -v`, `node -v`, and `npm -v`.

**Expected behavior:**

I expect to see the installed versions of nvm, Node.js, and npm.

**Actual behavior:**

```
@LAPTOP-LQIPNGM7:/mnt/c/Users/asus$ nvm -v
Command 'nvm' not found, did you mean:
command 'nvim' from snap nvim (v0.10.2)
command 'nsm' from snap nift (3.0.3)
command 'gvm' from snap gvm (1.1.0)
command 'nvme' from deb nvme-cli (2.8-1ubuntu0.1)
command 'nm' from deb binutils (2.41.50.20231214-1ubuntu1)
command 'lvm' from deb lvm2 (2.03.16-3ubuntu3.1)
command 'kvm' from deb qemu-system-x86 (1:8.2.2+ds-0ubuntu1.2)
See 'snap info <snapname>' for additional versions.
@LAPTOP-LQIPNGM7:/mnt/c/Users/asus$ node -v
Command 'node' not found, did you mean:
command 'nodo' from snap nodo (master)
command 'code' from snap code (384ff738)
See 'snap info <snapname>' for additional versions.
@LAPTOP-LQIPNGM7:/mnt/c/Users/asus$ npm -v
10.9.0
```

As you can see, the system doesn't recognize the `nvm` and `node` commands, but it does recognize `npm`. However, I suspect this is a system-wide installation of npm, not one managed by nvm.

**My system:**

* Ubuntu (not sure which version)
* Bash shell

How can I fix this and get nvm, Node.js, and npm working correctly?

<<'nvm' and 'node' commands not found, but 'npm -v' returns version. Potential PATH issue or broken installation?>>

Title: Facebook Graph API: Unable to find the created A/B Test Campaign in console UI Facebook
Body:
I am trying to create A/B test using facebook graph API. The documentation I follow: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/guides/split-testing
The documentation mentions following curl command:
curl \
-F 'name="new study"' \
-F 'description="test creative"' \ 
-F 'start_time=1478387569' \
-F 'end_time=1479597169' \
-F 'type=SPLIT_TEST' \
-F 'cells=[{name:"Group A",treatment_percentage:50,adsets:[<AD_SET_ID>]},{name:"Group B",treatment_percentage:50,adsets:[<AD_SET_ID>]}]' \
-F 'access_token=<ACCESS_TOKEN>' \ https://graph.facebook.com/<API_VERSION>/<BUSINESS_ID>/ad_studies

I am able to run this command successfully and get the split test ID which has been created, but I am unable to find the created split test:https://www.facebook.com/test-and-learn
The created test is fetch-able through API GET endpoint, but it does not exist on facebook console. Here is the place where I am trying to find it:
My goal is to create facebook ads A/B test through graph API. Is there any other documentation for this? or am I understanding something wrong there?
Title_Body:
<<Facebook Graph API: Unable to find the created A/B Test Campaign in console UI Facebook>>
<<I am trying to create A/B test using facebook graph API. The documentation I follow: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/guides/split-testing
The documentation mentions following curl command:
curl \
-F 'name="new study"' \
-F 'description="test creative"' \ 
-F 'start_time=1478387569' \
-F 'end_time=1479597169' \
-F 'type=SPLIT_TEST' \
-F 'cells=[{name:"Group A",treatment_percentage:50,adsets:[<AD_SET_ID>]},{name:"Group B",treatment_percentage:50,adsets:[<AD_SET_ID>]}]' \
-F 'access_token=<ACCESS_TOKEN>' \ https://graph.facebook.com/<API_VERSION>/<BUSINESS_ID>/ad_studies

I am able to run this command successfully and get the split test ID which has been created, but I am unable to find the created split test:https://www.facebook.com/test-and-learn
The created test is fetch-able through API GET endpoint, but it does not exist on facebook console. Here is the place where I am trying to find it:
My goal is to create facebook ads A/B test through graph API. Is there any other documentation for this? or am I understanding something wrong there?
>>

llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<How to Access Nested JSON Data in Python: Extracting 'id' from a Deeply Nested Structure>>
<<## Pagination cursor returning the same value for "before" and "after"

I'm working with an API that returns paginated data and I'm having trouble understanding the pagination cursors. The "before" and "after" cursors returned in the response are identical, which prevents me from fetching the next or previous page.

Here's a snippet of the JSON response I'm getting:

```json
{
"id": "1592692254711809",
"name": "Test Campagin A/B Test",
"type": "SPLIT_TEST",
"start_time": "2024-10-30T09:37:48+0000",
"end_time": "2024-11-28T09:37:48+0000",
"cells": {
    "data": [
        {
            "id": "857802299841265",
            "treatment_percentage": 50,
            "campaigns": {
                "data": [
                    {
                        "id": "120212259846550726"
                    }
                ],
                "paging": {
                    "cursors": {
                        "before": "QVFIUmo3anQyM2VYa3BnbzdpQVpuQTJxellfWmo2VGpjVFZAwMWxibFNnSHRqMmY1VVE5bWZAMMnJfdVhuQmgzMTFHLXAwOHhwMTh1d2pFQjM4dVZAIbn1USHR3",
                        "after": "QVFIUmo3anQyM2VYa3BnbzdpQVpuQTJxellfWmo2VGpjVFZAwMWxibFNnSHRqMmY1VVE5bWZAMMnJfdVhuQmgzMTFHLXAwOHhwMTh1d2pFQjM4dVZAIbn1USHR3"
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    ]
}
}
```

As you can see, the values for "before" and "after" are the same. 

**Expected behavior:** I expect the "before" and "after" cursors to be different, allowing me to navigate to the previous or next page of results.

**Actual behavior:** The API returns identical values for both cursors, making it impossible to paginate through the data.

Am I misinterpreting the response, or is there an issue with the API? Any help in understanding why this is happening and how to correctly implement pagination would be greatly appreciated.>>

Title: Chrome Extension: Refused to load script due to Content Security Policy (CSP) after no recent changes
Body:
I've been working on a Chrome extension using Vite and React, and everything was working fine until recently. I haven't made any changes, but now I’m getting a Content Security Policy (CSP) error preventing a script from loading.
Here is the error message I'm getting in the console:
Refused to load the script 'chrome-extension://5216f022-cd78-49fc-abf9-9e362fc1640f/assets/content-script-preamble.js.js' 
because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: 
"script-src 'self' 'wasm-unsafe-eval' 'inline-speculation-rules' http://localhost:* http://127.0.0.1:*". 
Note that 'script-src-elem' was not explicitly set, so 'script-src' is used as a fallback.


Here is my manifest.json:
{
  "manifest_version": 3,
  "name": "CRXJS React Vite Example",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "action": { "default_title": "Tags New", "default_popup": "index.html" },
  "permissions": ["storage", "webNavigation", "tabs", "scripting", "cookies", "activeTab"],
  "background": {
    "service_worker": "src/background.js"
  },
  "content_security_policy": {
    "extension_pages": "script-src 'self' 'wasm-unsafe-eval'; object-src 'self'"
  },
  "content_scripts": [
    {
      "js": ["src/content.jsx"],
      "matches": ["<all_urls>"],
      "run_at": "document_idle"
    }
  ],
  "host_permissions": [
    "http://localhost:3001/*",
    "https://tagdots.vercel.app/*"
  ],
  "web_accessible_resources": [
    {
      "resources": ["images/cursor-custom.png", "images/icon32.png"],
      "matches": ["<all_urls>"]
    }
  ],
  "icons": {
    "16": "images/icon32.png",
    "32": "images/icon32.png",
    "48": "images/icon64.png",
    "128": "images/icon64.png"
  }
}

The error message seems to indicate that the script chrome-extension://5216f022-cd78-49fc-abf9-9e362fc1640f/assets/content-script-preamble.js.js is being blocked due to a violation of the CSP. However, I haven’t made any changes to the manifest or the code recently.
Some additional context:

The extension uses Vite and React.
The error started appearing suddenly, and the extension was working fine previously.
I am not explicitly loading any external scripts apart from the ones within the extension.
My CSP currently allows 'self' and 'wasm-unsafe-eval' under script-src.
I've tried to debug this but can’t seem to pinpoint what might be causing this issue.

My questions:

What might be the cause of this error if nothing has changed in my extension?
How can I resolve the CSP issue to allow the script to load properly?
Any help or pointers would be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

llm_zero_shot_title: Chrome Extension: Refused to load script - Content Security Policy directive: "script-src" violation
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<Chrome Extension: Refused to load script - Content Security Policy directive: "script-src" violation>>
<<## Chrome Extension: Refused to load script due to Content Security Policy

I'm developing a Chrome extension and am running into a "Content Security Policy directive" error when trying to load a script. The error message is:

```
Refused to load the script 'chrome-extension://8f7f4b16-3e48-4800-8463-f31d5b30ee64/assets/content-script-preamble.js.js' because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "script-src 'self' 'wasm-unsafe-eval' 'inline-speculation-rules' http://localhost:* http://127.0.0.1:*". Note that 'script-src-elem' was not explicitly set, so 'script-src' is used as a fallback.
```

Here's the relevant code snippet where I'm attempting to load the script:

```javascript
(async () => {
  if ("assets/content-script-preamble.js.js")
    await import(
      /* @vite-ignore */
      chrome.runtime.getURL("assets/content-script-preamble.js.js")
    );

  await import(
    /* @vite-ignore */
    chrome.runtime.getURL("node_modules/vite/dist/client/client.mjs.js")
  );
})();
```

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect the script to load successfully without any CSP errors.

**Actual Behavior:**

The browser throws the CSP error mentioned above, preventing the script from loading.

I'm using Vite as my build tool. I've tried adding `http://localhost:*` and `http://127.0.0.1:*` to the `script-src` directive in my `manifest.json`, but the error persists.

**What could be causing this issue and how can I resolve it?**>>
llm_few_shot_title: Chrome Extension - Content Security Policy directive: 'script-src' violation on localhost
llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to load a script in my Chrome extension, but I am getting a "Content Security Policy directive" error. The error message says that "'wasm-unsafe-eval'" is not allowed in the "'script-src'" directive. I have tried setting "script-src-elem" to "http://localhost" in my manifest.json file, but that didn't work. How can I fix this error and load my script?

The most important part of the error is **"'wasm-unsafe-eval'" is not allowed in the "'script-src'" directive.** which tells us the root cause of the problem.
