llm_cot_title: Chrome Extension Content Security Policy Directive Error: "script-src" blocks loading script from chrome-extension://...
llm_cot_combined:
<<Chrome Extension Content Security Policy Directive Error: "script-src" blocks loading script from chrome-extension://...>>
<<I'm developing a Chrome extension and encountering a "Content Security Policy directive" error when trying to load scripts dynamically using `chrome.runtime.getURL()`.

**Error Message:**

```
Refused to load the script 'chrome-extension://8f7f4b16-3e48-4800-8463-f31d5b30ee64/assets/content-script-preamble.js.js' because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "script-src 'self' 'wasm-unsafe-eval' 'inline-speculation-rules' http://localhost:* http://127.0.0.1:*". Note that 'script-src-elem' was not explicitly set, so 'script-src' is used as a fallback.
```

**Context:**

- The extension is being loaded on `https://daisyui.com/`.
- I'm using Vite for bundling.

**Code Snippet:**

```javascript
(async () => {
  if ("assets/content-script-preamble.js.js")
    await import(
      /* @vite-ignore */
      chrome.runtime.getURL("assets/content-script-preamble.js.js")
    );

  await import(
    /* @vite-ignore */
    chrome.runtime.getURL("node_modules/vite/dist/client/client.mjs.js")
  );
})();
```

**Troubleshooting Attempts:**

- I've tried adding `http://daisyui.com/` to the `script-src` directive in my `manifest.json`, but the error persists.
- I've verified that the script files exist at the specified paths within the extension package.

**Question:**

How can I resolve this Content Security Policy error and successfully load these scripts in my Chrome extension? Is there a specific configuration I need to add to my `manifest.json` or a different approach for dynamically loading scripts in this context?>>

Title: Second photo is not displaying
Title_Body:
<<Second photo is not displaying>>
<<I am doing a fitness app in flutter and I try to make an ui where the user adds their diet, the problem is when I upload first photo it worked of the breakfast but when I try lunch it didn't work out. Here is a video of the issue https://imgur.com/a/vYUj6b6 and here is a photo of the terminal:

This is the code
 class FoodDietContent extends StatefulWidget {
  final String programId;
  final String dietProgramId;

  FoodDietContent({required this.programId, required this.dietProgramId});

  @override
  _FoodDietContentState createState() => _FoodDietContentState();
}

class _FoodDietContentState extends State<FoodDietContent> {
  File? _image;
  final picker = ImagePicker();

  Future<String> _loadDietProgramTitle() async {
    try {
      final doc = await FirebaseFirestore.instance
          .collection('programs')
          .doc(widget.programId)
          .collection('diet_programs')
          .doc(widget.dietProgramId)
          .get();

      if (doc.exists) {
        return '${doc['week']} ${doc['day']}';
      }
    } catch (e) {
      print('Error loading diet program title: $e');
    }
    return 'Unknown';
  }

  Stream<QuerySnapshot> _getMeals() {
    print('Getting meals for program: ${widget.programId}, diet program: ${widget.dietProgramId}');
    return FirebaseFirestore.instance
        .collection('programs')
        .doc(widget.programId)
        .collection('diet_programs')
        .doc(widget.dietProgramId)
        .collection('meals')
        .snapshots()
        .map((snapshot) {
          print('Received ${snapshot.docs.length} meals');
          snapshot.docs.forEach((doc) {
            print('Meal: ${doc.data()}');
          });
          return snapshot;
        });
  }

  void _addDietContent() {
    String? selectedTime;
    final mealNameController = TextEditingController();
    final mealDescriptionController = TextEditingController();
    final caloriesController = TextEditingController();
    File? tempImage;

    showModalBottomSheet(
      context: context,
      isScrollControlled: true,
      backgroundColor: Colors.white,
      shape: RoundedRectangleBorder(
        borderRadius: BorderRadius.vertical(top: Radius.circular(20)),
      ),
      builder: (BuildContext context) {
        return StatefulBuilder(
          builder: (BuildContext context, StateSetter setState) {
            return SingleChildScrollView(
              child: Container(
                padding: EdgeInsets.all(20),
                color: Colors.white,
                child: Column(
                  mainAxisSize: MainAxisSize.min,
                  crossAxisAlignment: CrossAxisAlignment.center,
                  children: [
                    Text(
                      'Add New Meal',
                      style: TextStyle(
                        fontSize: 24,
                        fontWeight: FontWeight.bold,
                        color: Colors.black,
                      ),
                    ),
                    SizedBox(height: 20),
                    Text(
                      'Choose the time of the day',
                      style: TextStyle(
                        fontSize: 18,
                        fontWeight: FontWeight.w500,
                        color: Colors.black87,
                      ),
                    ),
                    SizedBox(height: 15),
                    Row(
                      mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.spaceEvenly,
                      children: [
                        _buildMealTimeButton('Breakfast', Icons.free_breakfast, selectedTime, (value) {
                          setState(() => selectedTime = value);
                        }),
                        _buildMealTimeButton('Lunch', Icons.lunch_dining, selectedTime, (value) {
                          setState(() => selectedTime = value);
                        }),
                        _buildMealTimeButton('Dinner', Icons.dinner_dining, selectedTime, (value) {
                          setState(() => selectedTime = value);
                        }),
                      ],
                    ),
                    SizedBox(height: 20),
                    TextField(
                      controller: mealNameController,
                      decoration: InputDecoration(
                        hintText: 'Enter meal\'s name',
                        border: OutlineInputBorder(
                          borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(10),
                          borderSide: BorderSide(color: Colors.grey[300]!),
                        ),
                        focusedBorder: OutlineInputBorder(
                          borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(10),
                          borderSide: BorderSide(color: Colors.black, width: 2),
                        ),
                        filled: true,
                        fillColor: Colors.grey[50],
                      ),
                    ),
                    SizedBox(height: 15),
                    TextField(
                      controller: mealDescriptionController,
                      decoration: InputDecoration(
                        hintText: 'Meal description',
                        border: OutlineInputBorder(
                          borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(10),
                          borderSide: BorderSide(color: Colors.grey[300]!),
                        ),
                        focusedBorder: OutlineInputBorder(
                          borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(10),
                          borderSide: BorderSide(color: Colors.black, width: 2),
                        ),
                        filled: true,
                        fillColor: Colors.grey[50],
                      ),
                      maxLines: 3,
                    ),
                    SizedBox(height: 15),
                    TextField(
                      controller: caloriesController,
                      decoration: InputDecoration(
                        hintText: 'Total number of calories',
                        border: OutlineInputBorder(
                          borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(10),
                          borderSide: BorderSide(color: Colors.grey[300]!),
                        ),
                        focusedBorder: OutlineInputBorder(
                          borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(10),
                          borderSide: BorderSide(color: Colors.black, width: 2),
                        ),
                        filled: true,
                        fillColor: Colors.grey[50],
                      ),
                      keyboardType: TextInputType.number,
                    ),
                    SizedBox(height: 20),
                    ElevatedButton(
                      onPressed: () async {
                        final pickedFile = await picker.pickImage(source: ImageSource.gallery);
                        if (pickedFile != null) {
                          setState(() {
                            tempImage = File(pickedFile.path);
                          });
                          print('Image selected: ${pickedFile.path}');
                        } else {
                          print('No image selected');
                        }
                      },
                      child: Text('Add photo of the meal'),
                      style: ElevatedButton.styleFrom(
                        backgroundColor: Colors.white,
                        foregroundColor: Colors.black,
                        elevation: 5,
                        shadowColor: Colors.grey.withOpacity(0.5),
                        shape: RoundedRectangleBorder(
                          borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(20),
                        ),
                        padding: EdgeInsets.symmetric(vertical: 15, horizontal: 40),
                      ),
                    ),
                    SizedBox(height: 20),
                    if (tempImage != null)
                      Container(
                        width: 100,
                        height: 100,
                        decoration: BoxDecoration(
                          image: DecorationImage(
                            image: FileImage(tempImage!),
                            fit: BoxFit.cover,
                          ),
                          borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(10),
                        ),
                      ),
                    SizedBox(height: 20),
                    ElevatedButton(
                      onPressed: () async {
                        if (selectedTime != null && 
                            mealNameController.text.isNotEmpty &&
                            caloriesController.text.isNotEmpty) {
                          String? imageUrl;
                          if (tempImage != null) {
                            print('Attempting to upload image...');
                            imageUrl = await _uploadImage(tempImage!);
                            print('Image upload result: $imageUrl');
                          } else {
                            print('No image selected');
                          }
                          await _saveMeal(
                            selectedTime!,
                            mealNameController.text,
                            mealDescriptionController.text,
                            int.parse(caloriesController.text),
                            imageUrl,
                          );
                          Navigator.pop(context);
                        } else {
                          print('Invalid input: Time: $selectedTime, Name: ${mealNameController.text}, Calories: ${caloriesController.text}');
                          ScaffoldMessenger.of(context).showSnackBar(
                            SnackBar(content: Text('Please fill all required fields')),
                          );
                        }
                      },
                      child: Text('Add Meal'),
                      style: ElevatedButton.styleFrom(
                        backgroundColor: Colors.black,
                        foregroundColor: Colors.white,
                        minimumSize: Size(double.infinity, 50),
                        shape: RoundedRectangleBorder(
                          borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(10),
                        ),
                      ),
                    ),
                    SizedBox(height: MediaQuery.of(context).viewInsets.bottom),
                  ],
                ),
              ),
            );
          },
        );
      },
    );
  }

  Widget _buildMealTimeButton(String title, IconData icon, String? selectedTime, Function(String) onSelect) {
    bool isSelected = selectedTime == title;
    return GestureDetector(
      onTap: () => onSelect(title),
      child: Container(
        padding: EdgeInsets.symmetric(vertical: 10, horizontal: 15),
        decoration: BoxDecoration(
          color: isSelected ? Colors.black : Colors.grey[200],
          borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(10),
        ),
        child: Column(
          children: [
            Icon(
              icon,
              color: isSelected ? Colors.white : Colors.black,
              size: 30,
            ),
            SizedBox(height: 5),
            Text(
              title,
              style: TextStyle(
                color: isSelected ? Colors.white : Colors.black,
                fontWeight: FontWeight.bold,
              ),
            ),
          ],
        ),
      ),
    );
  }

  Future<String?> _uploadImage(File image) async {
    try {
      print('Starting image upload...');
      final ref = FirebaseStorage.instance.ref().child('meal_images/${DateTime.now().toIso8601String()}.jpg');
      print('Created storage reference');
      
      final metadata = SettableMetadata(contentType: 'image/jpeg');
      print('Created metadata');
      
      final uploadTask = ref.putFile(image, metadata);
      print('Started upload task');
      
      uploadTask.snapshotEvents.listen((TaskSnapshot snapshot) {
        print('Upload progress: ${snapshot.bytesTransferred}/${snapshot.totalBytes}');
      });

      final snapshot = await uploadTask.whenComplete(() => print('Upload completed'));
      print('Upload task completed');
      
      final downloadUrl = await snapshot.ref.getDownloadURL();
      print('Got download URL: $downloadUrl');
      
      return downloadUrl;
    } catch (e) {
      print('Error uploading image: $e');
      return null;
    }
  }

  Future<void> _saveMeal(String time, String name, String description, int calories, String? imageUrl) async {
    try {
      final mealData = {
        'time': time,
        'name': name,
        'description': description,
        'calories': calories,
        'imageUrl': imageUrl,
      };
      print('Attempting to save meal data: $mealData');
      await FirebaseFirestore.instance
          .collection('programs')
          .doc(widget.programId)
          .collection('diet_programs')
          .doc(widget.dietProgramId)
          .collection('meals')
          .add(mealData);
      print('Meal saved successfully');
      ScaffoldMessenger.of(context).showSnackBar(
        SnackBar(content: Text('Meal added successfully')),
      );
    } catch (e) {
      print('Error saving meal: $e');
      ScaffoldMessenger.of(context).showSnackBar(
        SnackBar(content: Text('Failed to add meal: $e')),
      );
    }
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      backgroundColor: Colors.white,
      body: SafeArea(
        child: Column(
          crossAxisAlignment: CrossAxisAlignment.start,
          children: [
            // Add this new row for the back button
            Padding(
              padding: EdgeInsets.only(left: 20, top: 20),
              child: IconButton(
                icon: Icon(Icons.arrow_back, color: Colors.black),
                onPressed: () => Navigator.of(context).pop(),
              ),
            ),
            FutureBuilder<String>(
              future: _loadDietProgramTitle(),
              builder: (context, snapshot) {
                if (snapshot.connectionState == ConnectionState.waiting) {
                  return Center(child: CircularProgressIndicator());
                } else if (snapshot.hasError) {
                  return Center(child: Text('Error: ${snapshot.error}'));
                } else {
                  return Padding(
                    padding: EdgeInsets.all(20),
                    child: Text(
                      snapshot.data ?? 'Unknown',
                      style: TextStyle(
                        fontSize: 24,
                        fontWeight: FontWeight.bold,
                        color: Colors.black,
                      ),
                    ),
                  );
                }
              },
            ),
            Expanded(
              child: StreamBuilder<QuerySnapshot>(
                stream: _getMeals(),
                builder: (context, snapshot) {
                  if (snapshot.connectionState == ConnectionState.waiting) {
                    return Center(child: CircularProgressIndicator());
                  } else if (snapshot.hasError) {
                    return Center(child: Text('Error: ${snapshot.error}'));
                  } else if (!snapshot.hasData || snapshot.data!.docs.isEmpty) {
                    return Center(child: Text('No meals added yet.'));
                  } else {
                    return ListView.builder(
                      itemCount: snapshot.data!.docs.length,
                      itemBuilder: (context, index) {
                        var meal = snapshot.data!.docs[index];
                        return _buildSwipeableMealCard(meal);
                      },
                    );
                  }
                },
              ),
            ),
          ],
        ),
      ),
      floatingActionButton: FloatingActionButton(
        onPressed: _addDietContent,
        child: Icon(Icons.add, color: Colors.white),
        backgroundColor: Colors.black,
      ),
      floatingActionButtonLocation: FloatingActionButtonLocation.centerFloat,
    );
  }

  Widget _buildSwipeableMealCard(DocumentSnapshot meal) {
    return Dismissible(
      key: Key(meal.id),
      direction: DismissDirection.endToStart,
      background: Container(
        alignment: Alignment.centerRight,
        padding: EdgeInsets.only(right: 20.0),
        color: Colors.red,
        child: Icon(Icons.delete, color: Colors.white),
      ),
      onDismissed: (direction) {
        _deleteMeal(meal.id);
      },
      child: _buildMealCard(meal),
    );
  }

  Widget _buildMealCard(DocumentSnapshot meal) {
    final mealData = meal.data() as Map<String, dynamic>;
    print('Building meal card for: ${mealData['name']}');
    print('Image URL: ${mealData['imageUrl']}');

    return Card(
      margin: EdgeInsets.symmetric(horizontal: 16, vertical: 8),
      color: Colors.white,
      elevation: 4,
      shape: RoundedRectangleBorder(
        borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(12),
      ),
      child: Container(
        color: Colors.white,
        child: Padding(
          padding: EdgeInsets.all(16),
          child: Row(
            crossAxisAlignment: CrossAxisAlignment.start,
            children: [
              _buildMealImage(mealData),
              SizedBox(width: 16),
              Expanded(
                child: Container(
                  color: Colors.white,
                  child: Column(
                    crossAxisAlignment: CrossAxisAlignment.start,
                    children: [
                      Text(
                        mealData['time'] ?? 'No time',
                        style: TextStyle(
                          fontWeight: FontWeight.bold,
                          fontSize: 18,
                          color: Colors.black87,
                        ),
                      ),
                      SizedBox(height: 4),
                      Text(
                        mealData['name'] ?? 'No name',
                        style: TextStyle(
                          fontWeight: FontWeight.bold,
                          fontSize: 16,
                          color: Colors.black,
                        ),
                      ),
                      SizedBox(height: 8),
                      Row(
                        children: [
                          Icon(Icons.local_fire_department, size: 16, color: Colors.orange),
                          SizedBox(width: 4),
                          Text(
                            '${mealData['calories'] ?? 'No'} calories',
                            style: TextStyle(fontSize: 14, color: Colors.grey[600]),
                          ),
                        ],
                      ),
                      SizedBox(height: 8),
                      Text(
                        mealData['description'] ?? 'No description',
                        style: TextStyle(fontSize: 14, color: Colors.grey[800]),
                        maxLines: 2,
                        overflow: TextOverflow.ellipsis,
                      ),
                    ],
                  ),
                ),
              ),
            ],
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }

  Widget _buildMealImage(Map<String, dynamic> mealData) {
    return Container(
      width: 80,
      height: 80,
      decoration: BoxDecoration(
        color: Colors.white,
        borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(8),
        boxShadow: [
          BoxShadow(
            color: Colors.grey.withOpacity(0.3),
            spreadRadius: 1,
            blurRadius: 3,
            offset: Offset(0, 1),
          ),
        ],
      ),
      child: ClipRRect(
        borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(8),
        child: mealData['imageUrl'] != null
            ? Image.network(
                mealData['imageUrl'],
                fit: BoxFit.cover,
                errorBuilder: (context, error, stackTrace) {
                  print('Error loading image: $error');
                  return Container(
                    color: Colors.white,
                    child: Icon(Icons.error, size: 40, color: Colors.red[300]),
                  );
                },
              )
            : Container(
                color: Colors.grey[100],
                child: Column(
                  mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
                  children: [
                    Icon(Icons.restaurant_menu, size: 40, color: Colors.grey[400]),
                    Text('No Image', style: TextStyle(color: Colors.grey[400], fontSize: 10)),
                  ],
                ),
              ),
      ),
    );
  }

  void _deleteMeal(String mealId) {
    FirebaseFirestore.instance
        .collection('programs')
        .doc(widget.programId)
        .collection('diet_programs')
        .doc(widget.dietProgramId)
        .collection('meals')
        .doc(mealId)
        .delete()
        .then((_) {
      ScaffoldMessenger.of(context).showSnackBar(
        SnackBar(content: Text('Meal deleted successfully')),
      );
    }).catchError((error) {
      ScaffoldMessenger.of(context).showSnackBar(
        SnackBar(content: Text('Failed to delete meal: $error')),
      );
    });
  }
}

>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Flutter Firebase Storage Image URL Returning Null for Some Images
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Flutter: Image URL is null when building a meal card

I am building a Flutter app that displays meal cards with images fetched from Firebase Storage. The meal data, including the image URLs, is stored in a list of maps.

**Problem:**

While iterating through the list and building the meal cards, the image URL for some meals is `null`, even though the URL exists in the original meal data.

**Console Output:**

```
flutter: Meal: {time: Breakfast, imageUrl: https://firebasestorag
e.googleapis.com/v0/b/influfit-619fa.appspot.com/o/meal_images%2F
2024-10-23T18:31:19.452993.jpg?alt=media&token=1c0d0d89-1cc6-441f
-814-fb5b7c875f03, description: Cereal honey, mik, name: Cerea
l, calories: 194}
flutter: Meal: {time: Lunch, imageUrl: null, description: salmonn
nn, name: Salmon, calories: 432}
flutter: Building meal card for: Cereal
flutter: Image URL: https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/i
nflufit-619fa.appspot.com/o/meal_images%2F2024-10-23T18:31:19.452
993.jpg?alt=media&token=1c0d0d89-1cc6-441f-81a4-fb5b7c875f03
flutter: Building meal card for: Salmon
flutter: Image URL: null
flutter: Meal saved successfully
```

As you can see, the first meal (Cereal) has the correct image URL, but the second meal (Salmon) shows `null` for the `imageUrl` when building the card, even though the initial meal data contains the URL.

**Expected Behavior:**

The image URL should be consistent throughout the process of building the meal cards.

**Actual Behavior:**

The image URL becomes `null` for some meals when building the cards.

**Question:**

What could be causing the image URL to become `null` during the card building process, and how can I fix this issue?

llm_few_shot_title: Flutter: Image URL is null when displaying data
llm_few_shot_body:

**Important:** The image URL is printed correctly in the logs, and the code builds without errors. The issue is that the image doesn't display in the app.

llm_cot_title: Flutter Firebase Image Upload - Image URL is null for some meals
llm_cot_body:
I am building a Flutter app that saves meal data, including images, to Firebase Storage. The app successfully saves the meal information to Firestore, but I'm encountering an issue where the image URL for some meals is being stored as "null."

Here's the console output:

```
flutter: Meal: {time: Breakfast, imageUrl: https://firebasestorag
e.googleapis.com/v0/b/influfit-619fa.appspot.com/o/meal_images%2F
2024-10-23T18:31:19.452993.jpg?alt=media&token=1c0d0d89-1cc6-441f
-814-fb5b7c875f03, description: Cereal honey, mik, name: Cerea
l, calories: 194}
flutter: Meal: {time: Lunch, imageUrl: null, description: salmonn
nn, name: Salmon, calories: 432}
flutter: Building meal card for: Cereal
flutter: Image URL: https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/i
nflufit-619fa.appspot.com/o/meal_images%2F2024-10-23T18:31:19.452
993.jpg?alt=media&token=1c0d0d89-1cc6-441f-81a4-fb5b7c875f03
flutter: Building meal card for: Salmon
flutter: Image URL: null
flutter: Meal saved successfully
```

As you can see, the "Breakfast" meal has a valid image URL, but the "Lunch" meal has "imageUrl: null." 

I have verified that:

- The image files exist locally and are being uploaded correctly to Firebase Storage.
- The file paths are correct.
- The Firebase Storage rules allow read and write access.

I have tried restarting the app and re-uploading the images, but the issue persists. 

What could be causing the image URL to be stored as "null" for some meals, and how can I resolve this issue?

Title: jitbit/CsvExport in Blazor inserts »¿ to the first row, first column of file
Title_Body:
<<jitbit/CsvExport in Blazor inserts »¿ to the first row, first column of file>>
<<I'm using Blazor Server in .net 8. I'm am trying to save a CSV file and am using jitbit/CsvExport to do it. The issue is that additional characters are being added to the first entry.

My razor.cs file looks like this:
private async Task ExportToCSV()
{
    var myExport = new CsvExport(includeColumnSeparatorDefinitionPreamble: false, includeHeaderRow: false);

    myExport.AddRow();
    myExport["Directions"] = "Directions";
    myExport["Leg"] = "Leg";
    myExport["LegTime"] = "Leg Time";
    myExport["Trip"] = "Trip";
    myExport["TripTime"] = "Trip Time";

    foreach (var direction in LoadedDrivingDirections)
    {
        var row = new object[5]
        {
                $"{direction.Maneuver} on {direction.Road}",
                direction.LegDistance.ToString("0.00"),
                TimeSpan.FromMinutes(direction.Time).ToString(@"hh\:mm"),
                direction.DistanceAtStart.ToString("0.00"),
                TimeSpan.FromMinutes(drivingDirectionViews.Where(w => w.Direction.Latitude == direction.Latitude).Select(s => s.TotalTime).FirstOrDefault()).ToString(@"hh\:mm")
        };

        myExport.AddRow();
        myExport["Directions"] = row[0];
        myExport["Leg"] = row[1];
        myExport["LegTime"] = row[2];
        myExport["Trip"] = row[3];
        myExport["TripTime"] = row[4];
    }

    await _js.SaveAs("ProMilesTrip.csv", myExport.ExportAsMemoryStream().ToArray());
}

And my js function is as follows:
function saveAsFile(filename, bytesBase64) {

if (navigator.msSaveBlob) {
    //Download document in Edge browser
    var data = window.atob(bytesBase64);
    var bytes = new Uint8Array(data.length);
    for (var i = 0; i < data.length; i++) {
        bytes[i] = data.charCodeAt(i);
    }
    var blob = new Blob([bytes.buffer], { type: "application/octet-stream" });
    navigator.msSaveBlob(blob, filename);
}
else {
    var link = document.createElement('a');
    link.download = filename;
    link.href = "data:application/octet-stream;base64," + bytesBase64;
    document.body.appendChild(link); // Needed for Firefox
    link.click();
    document.body.removeChild(link);
}
}

>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Parsing Directions Data - Unexpected Time Format at End of Line
llm_zero_shot_body:
I'm working with a dataset of driving directions, and I'm having trouble understanding the time format in one of the columns. 

Here's a sample of the data:

```
>>>¿Directions, Leg, Leg Time, Trip, Trip Time
Turn right onto NY-9A on W 27th ST, 0.45,00:03,0.00,00:03
Turn left onto W 29th ST on NY-9A,0.10,00:03,0.45,00:06
Turn left onto NY-9A on W 29th ST, 0.01,00:03,0.55,00:09
Turn left onto Canal ST on NY-9A,2.01,00:09,0.56,00:18 
```

The "Trip Time" column seems straightforward, formatted as minutes:seconds. However, I'm unsure how to interpret the "Leg Time" column. It appears to be a decimal value, but I'm not sure what unit it represents (seconds, minutes, etc.).

Could someone please clarify the meaning of the "Leg Time" column and its units? Any help in understanding how to interpret this data would be greatly appreciated.

The most important part of the error that can be present is the incorrect time value extracted. 

I have tried using string manipulation functions like `substring` and `split`, but I am not able to extract the correct time value. Can someone please help me with this?

llm_cot_title: Parsing Driving Directions String with Python
llm_cot_body:
I am working with a dataset of driving directions and their corresponding times. The format of each direction is:

```
Turn direction onto street name on street name, leg distance, leg time, trip distance, trip time
```

However, I've noticed an inconsistency in the time calculations for one of the directions:

```
Turn left onto W 29th ST on NY-9A,0.10,00:03,0.45,00:06
```

Here, the leg time is 3 seconds, but the trip time shows 6 seconds, even though the cumulative trip distance is only 0.45 miles. This seems inaccurate, as the previous direction shows a longer distance (0.45 miles) covered in just 3 seconds.

I've double-checked the data for any errors, but everything else seems to be in order. 

Could there be a miscalculation in the trip time for this specific direction? If so, how can I identify and correct such inconsistencies in my dataset?
llm_cot_combined:
<<Parsing Driving Directions String with Python>>
<<I am working with a dataset of driving directions and their corresponding times. The format of each direction is:

```
Turn direction onto street name on street name, leg distance, leg time, trip distance, trip time
```

However, I've noticed an inconsistency in the time calculations for one of the directions:

```
Turn left onto W 29th ST on NY-9A,0.10,00:03,0.45,00:06
```

Here, the leg time is 3 seconds, but the trip time shows 6 seconds, even though the cumulative trip distance is only 0.45 miles. This seems inaccurate, as the previous direction shows a longer distance (0.45 miles) covered in just 3 seconds.

I've double-checked the data for any errors, but everything else seems to be in order. 

Could there be a miscalculation in the trip time for this specific direction? If so, how can I identify and correct such inconsistencies in my dataset?>>

Title: Unable to format the kafka topic data via pyspark
Body:
I am trying to push the data to Kafka topic via KSQL with the below code:
CREATE STREAM TEST01 (KEY_COL VARCHAR KEY, COL1 INT, COL2 VARCHAR)
  WITH (KAFKA_TOPIC='test01', PARTITIONS=1, VALUE_FORMAT='AVRO');

INSERT INTO TEST01 (KEY_COL, COL1, COL2) VALUES ('X',1,'FOO');
INSERT INTO TEST01 (KEY_COL, COL1, COL2) VALUES ('Y',2,'BAR');

Now when I am trying to run the below Pyspark code and trying to fetch the data and print on the console, it is printing the value along with some junk values
from pyspark.sql.session import SparkSession
spark = SparkSession \
    .builder \
    .appName("Kafka_Test") \
    .config("spark.jars.packages", "org.apache.spark:spark-sql-kafka-0-10_2.12:3.3.0") \
    .getOrCreate()

df = spark \
    .readStream \
    .format("kafka") \
    .option("kafka.bootstrap.servers", "localhost:9092") \
    .option("subscribe", "test01") \
    .option("startingOffsets","earliest") \
    .load()

df.selectExpr("cast(value as string) as value").writeStream.outputMode("append").format("console").start()

Output:

How can I format this much better?
As per Nimi's suggestion, I tried the below code where I fetched the schema from the schema registry but it is giving me null records. It is not fetching the actual values.
jsonSchema={"type":"record","name":"KsqlDataSourceSchema","namespace":"io.confluent.ksql.avro_schemas","fields":[{"name":"COL1","type":["null","int"],"default":None},{"name":"COL2","type":["null","string"],"default":None}],"connect.name":"io.confluent.ksql.avro_schemas.KsqlDataSourceSchema"}
df.select(from_avro("value", json.dumps(jsonSchema)).alias("sample_a")) \
    .writeStream.format("console").start()

Output:
+------------+
|    sample_a|
+------------+
|{null, null}|
|{null, null}|
|{null, null}|
+------------+

df.select(from_avro("value", json.dumps(jsonSchema)).alias("sample_a")) \
    .writeStream.format("console").start()

Output:
+------------+

+------------+
|{null, null}|
|{null, null}|
|{null, null}|
+------------+

>>

llm_few_shot_title: How to Print Array Elements in Java?
llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to print the values of a dictionary in a specific format using Python. I am using the `pprint` module to achieve this. However, instead of printing the values, I am getting a series of `☐` characters.

The most important part of the error is the repeated `☐` characters, which suggests a problem with character encoding or data representation.

My code is as follows:

```python
from pprint import pprint

my_dict = {
    "A": ["FOO", "BAR", "SOO", "ZOO", "COO"],
}

pprint(my_dict)
```

I would appreciate any help in resolving this issue.

Title: VSCode throws error as if $props variable not accessible in HTML, in Svelte 5 component
Body: With this Component code: The reference to srcFile in the img tag throws an error as if the variable was never defined. Type 'unknown' is not assignable to type 'string | null | undefined'. However, this error just appears in VSCode, not the npm server running vite. Also, images load correctly in-browser. What should I fix about my VSCode config so that it's in touch with reality? My package.json: { "name": "viewer", "version": "0.0.1", "private": true, "scripts": { "dev": "vite dev --host", "build": "vite build", "preview": "vite preview", "check": "svelte-kit sync && svelte-check --tsconfig ./tsconfig.json", "check:watch": "svelte-kit sync && svelte-check --tsconfig ./tsconfig.json --watch", "lint": "prettier --check . && eslint .", "format": "prettier --write ." }, "devDependencies": { "@sveltejs/adapter-auto": "^3.0.0", "@sveltejs/adapter-static": "^3.0.5", "@sveltejs/kit": "^2.0.0", "@sveltejs/vite-plugin-svelte": "^4.0.0", "@types/eslint": "^9.6.0", "eslint": "^9.0.0", "eslint-config-prettier": "^9.1.0", "eslint-plugin-svelte": "^2.45.1", "prettier": "^3.1.1", "prettier-plugin-svelte": "^3.2.6", "svelte": "^5.0.5", "svelte-check": "^4.0.0", "typescript": "^5.5.0", "typescript-eslint": "^8.0.0", "vite": "^5.4.4" }, "type": "module" }

What should I fix about my VSCode config so that it's in touch with reality? My package.json: { "name": "viewer", "version": "0.0.1", "private": true, "scripts": { "dev": "vite dev --host", "build": "vite build", "preview": "vite preview", "check": "svelte-kit sync && svelte-check --tsconfig ./tsconfig.json", "check:watch": "svelte-kit sync && svelte-check --tsconfig ./tsconfig.json --watch", "lint": "prettier --check . && eslint .", "format": "prettier --write ." }, "devDependencies": { "@sveltejs/adapter-auto": "^3.0.0", "@sveltejs/adapter-static": "^3.0.5", "@sveltejs/kit": "^2.0.0", "@sveltejs/vite-plugin-svelte": "^4.0.0", "@types/eslint": "^9.6.0", "eslint": "^9.0.0", "eslint-config-prettier": "^9.1.0", "eslint-plugin-svelte": "^2.45.1", "prettier": "^3.1.1", "prettier-plugin-svelte": "^3.2.6", "svelte": "^5.0.5", "svelte-check": "^4.0.0", "typescript": "^5.5.0", "typescript-eslint": "^8.0.0", "vite": "^5.4.4" }, "type": "module" } >>
llm_zero_shot_title: Type 'unknown' is not assignable to type 'string | null | undefined' for img src in Svelte component
llm_zero_shot_body: ## TypeScript error: Type 'unknown' is not assignable to type 'string | null | undefined' for img src I'm getting a TypeScript error in my Svelte component where I'm trying to dynamically set the `src` attribute of an `` tag. The error message says: > Type 'unknown' is not assignable to type 'string | null | undefined'. js (2322) Here's the relevant code: ```html ``` I'm using `$props()` to access a prop called `srcFile` which should contain the image URL. I'm not sure why TypeScript is inferring the type of `srcFile` as `unknown`. **Expected behavior:** TypeScript should recognize that the `src` attribute of an `` tag can accept a string, null, or undefined value, and it should not throw an error. **Actual behavior:** TypeScript is throwing an error saying that `unknown` is not assignable to `string | null | undefined`. How can I resolve this type mismatch and correctly set the `src` attribute of my image?
llm_zero_shot_combined: <> <<## TypeScript error: Type 'unknown' is not assignable to type 'string | null | undefined' for img src I'm getting a TypeScript error in my Svelte component where I'm trying to dynamically set the `src` attribute of an `` tag. The error message says: > Type 'unknown' is not assignable to type 'string | null | undefined'. js (2322) Here's the relevant code: ```html ``` I'm using `$props()` to access a prop called `srcFile` which should contain the image URL. I'm not sure why TypeScript is inferring the type of `srcFile` as `unknown`. **Expected behavior:** TypeScript should recognize that the `src` attribute of an `` tag can accept a string, null, or undefined value, and it should not throw an error. **Actual behavior:** TypeScript is throwing an error saying that `unknown` is not assignable to `string | null | undefined`. How can I resolve this type mismatch and correctly set the `src` attribute of my image?>>

The error highlights the `src` attribute of an `` tag where I'm trying to use a variable received from props: ```html ``` I understand that the `src` attribute expects a string, null, or undefined value. However, it seems like TypeScript is inferring the type of `srcFile` as 'unknown'. I've tried explicitly typing the prop in my component definition: ```typescript export let srcFile: string | null | undefined; ``` But the error persists. Title: I can't connect ASP.NET Web API with .NET Maui
Title_Body:
<<I can't connect ASP.NET Web API with .NET Maui>>
<<
I want to connect my first maui test app with ASP.NET Web API that retrieves data from mongoDB. When the ASP.NET Web API is running, I can easily retrieve my data from Swagger UI, but when it comes to retrieving data in my MAUI app, I get an error

Connection Failure

Could you explain me why is this happening and what I should do about it?
Here is my code from MAUI app:
private async void OnSubmitClicked(object sender, EventArgs e)
{
    string pesel = peselEntry.Text;

    try
    {
        var response = await App.HttpClient.GetAsync($"https://localhost:7183/api/Patients/Test");
        if (response.IsSuccessStatusCode)
        {
            var patient = await response.Content.ReadFromJsonAsync<Patients>();
            await DisplayAlert("Oto dane", $"Imię: {patient.Name}, Nazwisko: {patient.Surname}", "OK");
        }
        else
        {
            await DisplayAlert("Błąd", "Pacjent nie znaleziony.", "OK");
        }
    }
    catch (Exception ex)
    {
        await DisplayAlert("Błąd", $"Wystąpił problem: {ex.Message}", "OK");
    }
}

I just added CORS to program.cs in ASP.NET, but it didn't help
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: API returning encoded PDF document instead of binary data in .NET application
llm_zero_shot_body:

Title: Terminal is taking hours to install Next.js what to do?
Body:
I have started learning coding few weeks ago. I had installed Next.js yesterday and it run smoothly then deleted the project. Today when I again tried to install, its been more then four hours and still its loading.

I uninstalled Visual Studio and again created different project but still nothing is working.
Title_Body:
<<Terminal is taking hours to install Next.js what to do?>>
<<I have started learning coding few weeks ago. I had installed Next.js yesterday and it run smoothly then deleted the project. Today when I again tried to install, its been more then four hours and still its loading.

I uninstalled Visual Studio and again created different project but still nothing is working.
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: `npx shadcn@latest init` creates new Next.js project even though directory exists?
llm_zero_shot_body:
## npx shadcn@latest init tries to create new Next.js project even though one already exists

I'm trying to run `npx shadcn@latest init` in my existing Next.js project directory, but it's telling me there's no `package.json` file and wants to create a new project.

Here's the output I'm seeing:

```
PS C:\Users\Admin\Desktop\easyfin> npx shadcn@latest init
>>
✓ The path C:\Users\Admin\Desktop\easyfin does not contain a package.json file. Would you like to start a new Next.js project? ... yes
✓ What is your project named?... easyfin
✓ Creating a new Next.js project. This may take a few minutes.
```

I've double-checked, and there **is** a `package.json` file in the directory I'm running the command from. 

**Expected behavior:**

I expect the `shadcn` command to recognize my existing Next.js project and not try to create a new one.

**Actual behavior:**

The command fails to recognize the existing project and attempts to initialize a new one.

**What I've tried:**

* I've verified that the `package.json` file exists in the correct directory.
* I've tried running the command with `sudo` (although I don't think that should be necessary).

Am I missing something obvious here? Why isn't the command recognizing my existing project?

<<`npx shadcn@latest init` creates new Next.js project even though directory exists?>>

llm_few_shot_title: Next.js Project Initialization Failing - No package.json Found
llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to create a new Next.js project using `npx create-next-app`. However, when I run this command in Visual Studio Code's integrated terminal, it says: `The path 'C:\Users\Admin\Desktop\easyfin' does not contain a package.json file. Would you like to start a new Next.js project?` and proceeds to create a new project even though I am already in an existing directory where I want to set up the project. How can I make `npx create-next-app` recognize my existing directory and set up the project there?

The most important part of the error message is the incorrect path and the fact that it's prompting to create a new project when it should recognize the existing directory.

llm_cot_title: Next.js project creation asks to start a new project even though the directory already exists
llm_cot_body:
I'm trying to initialize a new project using `npx shadcn@latest init` in my desired directory. However, even though the directory is empty, it automatically detects a Next.js project and starts initializing it without letting me configure any options.

Here's the output I'm getting:

```
PS C:\Users\Admin\Desktop\easyfin> npx shadcn@latest init

> The path C:\Users\Admin\Desktop\easyfin does not contain a package.json file. Would you like to start a new Next.js project? ... yes
> What is your project named?... easyfin
> Creating a new Next.js project. This may take a few minutes. 
```

I want to be able to configure the project settings, such as TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, etc., but it seems to be skipping those steps. I've tried running the command in an empty directory, but the issue persists.

How can I properly initialize a Shadcn UI project with custom configurations?

Title: Parent :host styles affects to :host styles of child
Title_Body:
<<Parent :host styles affects to :host styles of child>>
<<
As you can see on picture the app-tracking-elements-table get styles from app-left-menu. I wrote styles in SCSS using :host for both components
I thought that :host is isolated and affects only to hosting element. Is there any way to separate them?
left-menu-component.scss
:host {
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    justify-content: space-between;
    gap: 8px;

    position: relative;

    height: 100%;
    width: var(--left-menu-width);
    padding: 12px 0 24px 0;

    background-color: var(--light-100);

    box-shadow: $box-shadow;

    /*Some more styles*/
}

tracking-elements-table.component.scss
:host {
    position: absolute;
    top: 0;
    left: 100%;

    width: 500px;
    height: 100vh;
    background-color: var(--light-100);

    box-shadow: inset $box-shadow;

    /*Some more styles*/
}

Additional info:



Package
Version




@angular-devkit/architect
0.1802.9


@angular-devkit/build-angular
18.2.9


@angular-devkit/core
18.2.9


@angular-devkit/schematics
18.2.9


@angular/cli
18.2.9


@schematics/angular
18.2.9


rxjs
7.8.1


typescript
5.5.4


zone.js
0.14.10



P.S. If you need more info please ask me and I will add it to question
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Angular Component's CSS Overridden by Another Component's Stylesheet
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<Angular Component's CSS Overridden by Another Component's Stylesheet>>
<<**Angular component CSS not applying correctly**

I have an Angular component that is supposed to have a width of 40px, but it is taking up the full width of the screen.

Here is the code for the component's CSS file:

```css
:host {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  justify-content: space-between;
  gap: 8px;
  position: relative;
  height: 100%;
  width: var(--left-menu-width);
  padding: 12px 0 24px 0;
  background-color: var(--light-100);
  box-shadow: 0px 0 10px 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.06);
}
```

I have defined the `--left-menu-width` variable in my global CSS file:

```css
html {
  --left-menu-width: 40px;
}
```

I have also tried setting the width directly in the component's CSS file, but that did not work either:

```css
:host {
  width: 40px;
}
```

The component is displayed correctly in the browser's developer tools, but the width is not being applied.

**Expected behavior:**

The component should have a width of 40px.

**Actual behavior:**

The component is taking up the full width of the screen.

Any ideas on what could be causing this issue?>>
llm_few_shot_title: Tailwind CSS - How to Change the Color of a Specific Component
llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to change the background color of a button in my React Native app when it is disabled. I am using `TouchableOpacity` for the button and have set the `disabled` prop to `true`. I have also set the `backgroundColor` style property for the button, but the background color does not change when the button is disabled.

The most important part of the error is that the `backgroundColor` style property is not being applied to the button when it is disabled.

I have tried setting the `backgroundColor` style property directly on the `TouchableOpacity` component, as well as on a nested `View` component, but neither approach has worked. I have also tried using a different component for the button, such as `Button`, but the issue persists.
llm_few_shot_combined:
<<Tailwind CSS - How to Change the Color of a Specific Component>>

I have also set the `backgroundColor` style property for the button, but the background color does not change when the button is disabled.

The most important part of the error is that the `backgroundColor` style property is not being applied to the button when it is disabled.

I have tried setting the `backgroundColor` style property directly on the `TouchableOpacity` component, as well as on a nested `View` component, but neither approach has worked. I have also tried using a different component for the button, such as `Button`, but the issue persists.>>
llm_cot_title: Angular component CSS overlapping with global CSS, causing layout issues.
llm_cot_combined:
<<Angular component CSS overlapping with global CSS, causing layout issues.>>
<<I'm trying to position a side menu ( `app-tracking-elements-table` ) to the right of the screen, but it's overlapping the main content instead of pushing it to the left.

Here's the relevant HTML structure:

```html
<body>
  <app-root>
    <main>
      <app-left-menu></app-left-menu>
      <app-tracking-elements-table></app-tracking-elements-table> 
      <app-status-bar></app-status-bar>
      <app-map></app-map>
    </main>
  </app-root>
</body>
```

And the CSS for `app-tracking-elements-table`:

```css
[_nghost-ng-c2749519363] {
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: 100%; 
  width: 500px;
  height: 100vh;
  background-color: var(--light-100);
  box-shadow: inset 6px 0 18px 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.06);
}
```

I've tried setting `left: 100%` to position it to the right, but it covers the content instead of pushing it. I've also experimented with `float: right`, but it didn't work as expected.

How can I position the side menu to the right and make the main content adjust accordingly?>>

Title: Android Studio : Fix all 'xxx' problems in file
Body:
Intellij has an option to fix multiple identical issues in one go. Look for example at the following simple issue of multiple variables not being final :

Using Fix all 'Local variable or parameter can be 'final'' problems in file I can fix all at once. Is there the same for Android Studio (Android Studio Jellyfish | 2023.3.1)?

llm_zero_shot_title: SonarLint suggests making local variable 'final' - Best practice?
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<SonarLint suggests making local variable 'final' - Best practice?>>
<<## SonarLint: "Local variable or parameter can be 'final'" - Why am I getting this and should I fix it?

SonarLint is giving me the suggestion "Local variable or parameter can be 'final'" for my array variables. I understand what `final` does in Java, but I'm not sure why this is considered a good practice in this case. 

Here's the code snippet:

```java
public class Example {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        int[] a = {1, 2, 3};
        int[] c = {4, 5, 6};
        System.// ... some code using a and c
    }
}
```

Should I always make local variables `final` if possible? What are the benefits and are there any drawbacks?>>
llm_few_shot_title: How to Fix "Local Variable can be 'final'" in SonarLint?
llm_few_shot_body: I am using SonarLint in my Java project and it is suggesting that I make a local variable `final`. However, this variable is modified later in the code, so making it `final` would result in a compilation error. How can I resolve this SonarLint suggestion without introducing errors into my code? Is there a way to configure SonarLint to recognize cases where a variable cannot be `final`?
llm_few_shot_combined:
<<How to Fix "Local Variable can be 'final'" in SonarLint?>>
<<I am using SonarLint in my Java project and it is suggesting that I make a local variable `final`. However, this variable is modified later in the code, so making it `final` would result in a compilation error. How can I resolve this SonarLint suggestion without introducing errors into my code? Is there a way to configure SonarLint to recognize cases where a variable cannot be `final`?>>
llm_cot_title: How to fix SonarLint "Local variable or parameter can be 'final'" in IntelliJ IDEA?
llm_cot_body:
I'm using SonarLint in my IDE and it's suggesting that I make my local variables `final`. I understand why this is generally good practice, but in this specific case, I don't plan on changing the values of these variables. 

Is it necessary to follow this suggestion every time? Are there any downsides to not making these variables `final` if I'm certain they won't be modified? 

I'm hesitant to simply suppress the warning as I want to understand the potential implications and best practices in this scenario.
llm_cot_combined:
<<How to fix SonarLint "Local variable or parameter can be 'final'" in IntelliJ IDEA?>>

I'm hesitant to simply suppress the warning as I want to understand the potential implications and best practices in this scenario.>>

Title: C# Azure Functions Project cannot load/find any assemblies
Body:
I have a Visual Studio project (.NET Core 8, Azure Functions v4) which "works on any machine except mine".
The error message is:

The '---' function is in error: Could not load file or assembly 'X.X.X, Version=8.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=...'. The system cannot find the file specified.

And it really makes no difference which package I import System.Net.Http, System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates - it can't find anything at all.
Depending on which code I comment out and remove imports the message is slightly different:

Error configuring services in an external startup class.
XXX.Consumer: Could not load file or assembly 'System.Net.Http, Version=8.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a'. The system cannot find the file specified.
A host error has occurred during startup operation '106f06bc-2885-4839-abfe-c23ed98b7b26'.
Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Script: Error configuring services in an external startup class. XXX.Consumer: Could not load file or assembly 'System.Net.Http, Version=8.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a'. The system cannot find the file specified.

Other Azure Function projects work fine, but this one is "stuck".
Same issue in Visual Studio 2022 - Community or Professional.
I have read dozens of similar questions here and tried:

Clean and rebuild solution/project
Restart vs
Running Release vs Debug
Deleting entire Debug/Release Directories
Updating al NuGet packages
Opening my bin/Debug/net8.0/Project.dll in DependencyWalker (see below)

DependencyWalker is showing a gazillion "Error opening file." messages as well as:

Error: At least one required implicit or forwarded dependency was not found.
Error: Modules with different CPU types were found.
Warning: At least one delay-load dependency module was not found.
Warning: At least one module has an unresolved import due to a missing export function in a delay-load dependent module.


UPDATE:
C# Project file
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>net8.0</TargetFramework>
    <AzureFunctionsVersion>v4</AzureFunctionsVersion>
    <AutoGenerateBindingRedirects>true</AutoGenerateBindingRedirects>
    <GenerateBindingRedirectsOutputType>true</GenerateBindingRedirectsOutputType>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="AutoMapper" Version="13.0.1" />
    <PackageReference Include="Azure.Data.SchemaRegistry" Version="1.4.0" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.EventHubs" Version="6.3.5" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.Azure.Functions.Extensions" Version="1.1.0" />

    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.Extensions.Http" Version="8.0.0" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.Extensions.Options.DataAnnotations" Version="8.0.0" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.NET.Sdk.Functions" Version="4.4.1" />
    <PackageReference Include="Newtonsoft.Json.Schema" Version="4.0.1" />

  </ItemGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <None Update="host.json">
      <CopyToOutputDirectory>Always</CopyToOutputDirectory>
    </None>
    <None Update="local.settings.json">
      <CopyToOutputDirectory>Always</CopyToOutputDirectory>
      <CopyToPublishDirectory>Never</CopyToPublishDirectory>
    </None>
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>

dotnet --list-sdks
8.0.204 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

FYI: I installed .NET v6 later to see if it helped (since CoreToolsHost was logging "Loading .NET 6 host") but this did not help.

llm_zero_shot_title: "Implicit or forwarded dependency not found error when loading DLLs"
llm_zero_shot_body:
## "Error opening file. The system cannot find the file specified (2)."  while debugging

## Next.js Hydration Failed - Server Rendered HTML Mismatch I'm encountering a "Hydration failed" error in my Next.js (v15.0.0) application. The error message states: > Hydration failed because the server rendered HTML didn't match the client. As a result this tree will be regenerated on the client. This can happen if a SSR-ed Client Component used I've reviewed the common causes listed in the error message and the Next.js documentation, but I'm unable to pinpoint the issue in my code. Here's the relevant code snippet: ```html
{/* ... other content ... */}
``` **Expected Behavior:** The application should hydrate successfully without any errors. **Actual Behavior:** The hydration process fails with the error message shown in the screenshot. **Things I've checked:** - I don't have any explicit server/client branching logic using `typeof window !== 'undefined'`. - I'm not using `Date.now()` or `Math.random()` directly in my component rendering logic. - I've reviewed my date formatting and locale settings to ensure consistency between the server and client. - I'm not manipulating the DOM directly outside of React's lifecycle methods. - I've disabled browser extensions to rule out any interference. I'm unsure what's causing the mismatch between the server-rendered HTML and the client-side rendering. Any help in identifying the root cause of this issue would be greatly appreciated.

llm_zero_shot_title: Why is using `setTimeout()` with string argument considered a security risk?
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<Why is using `setTimeout()` with string argument considered a security risk?>>
<<## setTimeout() inside a Promise not resolving as expected

I'm trying to create a simple `timeout` function using Promises and `setTimeout`. I want the Promise to resolve after a specified delay. However, the `then` block of my Promise is never executed.

Here's my code:

```javascript
function timeout(ms) {
  return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, ms, 'done'))
}

timeout(100).then((value) => {
  console.log(value) 
})
```

I expect the console to log `"done"` after 100 milliseconds. However, nothing is logged to the console, and the Promise seems to hang indefinitely.

What am I doing wrong? Why isn't the Promise resolving after the `setTimeout` completes?>>
llm_few_shot_title: setTimeout() Considered Harmful/Security Risk in Javascript?
llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to use the `setTimeout` function in my JavaScript code, but the Visual Studio Code IntelliSense is showing a warning that says "Avoid using 'setTimeout(...)', 'setInterval(...)' - security risk."

I understand that there might be security concerns with using these functions, but I'm not sure what they are or how to avoid them. 

**What are the specific security risks associated with `setTimeout` and `setInterval`, and what are the recommended alternatives for achieving similar functionality without compromising security?**

llm_cot_title: Why is using `setTimeout` with string code (second argument) a security risk in JavaScript?
llm_cot_combined:
<<Why is using `setTimeout` with string code (second argument) a security risk in JavaScript?>>
<<## setTimeout inside a Promise resolves immediately

I'm trying to create a simple `timeout` function using Promises and `setTimeout`. I want the Promise to resolve after a specified delay. However, it seems like the Promise is resolving immediately without waiting for the timeout.

Here's my code:

```javascript
function timeout(ms) {
  return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, ms, 'done'))
}

timeout(100).then((value) => {
  console.log(value) 
})
```

I expect this code to log "done" after 100 milliseconds. Instead, it logs immediately. 

I've checked the syntax and documentation for `setTimeout` and `Promise`, but I can't figure out why the timeout isn't working as expected. 

Any help would be appreciated!>>

llm_zero_shot_body:
## BraintreeError: INCOMPATIBLE_VERSIONS - e.getVersion is not a function

I'm integrating Braintree Drop-in UI into my React application and encountering an error message: "BraintreeError: INCOMPATIBLE_VERSIONS". The error states that the Client and Data Collector versions are incompatible (3.103.0 and 3.109.0 respectively). 

However, I'm also getting a "TypeError: e.getVersion is not a function" error in the callback function, originating from the `data-collector.min.js` file.

Here's the error stack trace:

```
TypeError: e.getVersion is not a function
    at Object.verify (data-collector.min.js:1:27637)
    at Object.<anonymous> (data-collector.min.js:1:11122)
    at Object.create (data-collector.min.js:1:2625)
    at X (usePaymentHook.js:613:38)
    at DropIn.jsx:37:9
    at dropin.min.js:1:11179
```

I've ensured that I'm using the same version of the Braintree SDK across my project. I've tried clearing my browser cache and reinstalling the Braintree packages, but the issue persists.

Has anyone encountered this issue before or have any suggestions on how to resolve this incompatibility error and the `e.getVersion` function error?

llm_zero_shot_title: C++ Win32: How to prevent DefWindowProc from handling events after processing them in WndProc?
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<C++ Win32: How to prevent DefWindowProc from handling events after processing them in WndProc?>>
<<**C++ Win32: Spacebar Key Press Not Registering**

I'm working on a simple Win32 application in C++, and I'm trying to detect when the spacebar is pressed. However, my current code doesn't seem to be registering the key press.

Here's the relevant code snippet from my window procedure:

```c++
LRESULT CALLBACK dev_window_events(HWND hwnd, UINT msg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam) {
    switch (msg) {
        case WM_CLOSE:
            (*ref)->window.isOpen = 0;
            break;
        case WM_KEYDOWN:
            if (wParam == VK_SPACE) { 
                (*ref)->util.log("SPACE WAS PRESSED"); 
            } 
            break;
        default:
            return DefWindowProc(hwnd, msg, wParam, lParam);
    }
    return 0;
}
```

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect the message "SPACE WAS PRESSED" to be logged to the console when I press the spacebar.

**Actual Behavior:**

Nothing happens when I press the spacebar. No message is logged, and there are no error messages.

I've verified that other keys are being detected correctly by the `WM_KEYDOWN` case. I've also tried using `GetKeyState(VK_SPACE)` to check the state of the spacebar, but it always returns 0.

What could be causing the spacebar key press to not be registered in my Win32 application?>>

llm_cot_combined:
<<How to Properly Handle WM_KEYDOWN Messages in a Win32 Application Using C?>>
<<I'm working on a simple windowed application in C using Win32 API. I'm trying to handle keyboard input, specifically the spacebar. I've set up a window procedure (`dev_window_events`) that uses a `switch` statement to handle different window messages.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```c
LRESULT CALLBACK dev_window_events(HWND hwnd, UINT msg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam) {
    switch (msg) {
        case WM_CLOSE:
            (*ref)->window.isOpen = 0;
            break;
        case WM_KEYDOWN:
            if (wParam == VK_SPACE) {
                (*ref)->util.log("SPACE WAS PRESSED");
            }
            break;
        default:
            DefWindowProc(hwnd, msg, wParam, lParam);
    }
}
```

The code compiles and runs without errors. However, when I press the spacebar, nothing happens. The message "SPACE WAS PRESSED" is not printed to the console or anywhere else.

I've tried:

- Verifying that `VK_SPACE` is the correct virtual key code for the spacebar.
- Checking if other keys trigger the `WM_KEYDOWN` message (they do).
- Debugging to see if the `if` statement within the `WM_KEYDOWN` case is ever reached (it is).

I'm not sure what else to check. Why isn't my code detecting the spacebar press?>>

Title: Electron store ES6 modular import, cannot initialise store object
Title_Body:
<<Electron store ES6 modular import, cannot initialise store object>>
<<I'm trying to use electron-store package to store values in a vue + electron application.
I've followed the examples given by the author here: https://www.npmjs.com/package/electron-store.
But im getting error when running the app, whenever. store seems to be undefined.
electron main.js
import Store from "electron-store";
const store = new Store();

ipcMain.on("electronStore", (event, args) => {
    if (args.commandStr === "getElectronStore") {
        console.log(store);
        console.log(new Store())
        console.log(store.get(args.key));
        mainWindow.webContents.send("electronStore", store.get(args.key));
    }
    else if (args.commandStr === "setElectronStore") {
        store.set(args.key, args.value);
    }
});


my app is modular, so ive made sure all my packages are imported using ESM format:
package.json:
  "type": "module",

any idea whats wrong with this? how do i initialize electron store properly ?
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: `"Unresolved function or method get()"` error when using electron-store in Electron app
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<`"Unresolved function or method get()"` error when using electron-store in Electron app>>
<<## Electron Store - Unresolved function or method 'get()'

I'm working on an Electron application and using `electron-store` to manage persistent data. I'm trying to retrieve a value from the store using `store.get()`, but I'm getting an "Unresolved function or method 'get()'" error in my IDE.

Here's the relevant code:

```typescript
import Store from "electron-store";

const store: ElectronStore<Record<string, any>> = new Store();

ipcMain.on(
  "electronStore",
  (event: IpcMainEvent, args: { commandStr: string; key: string; value: any }): void => {
    if (args.commandStr === "getElectronStore") {
      console.log(store);
      console.log(new Store());
      console.log(store.get(args.key)); // Error here
      // ...
    } else if (args.commandStr === "setElectronStore") {
      store.set(args.key, args.value);
      // ...
    }
  }
);
```

I've already imported `Store` from `electron-store`, and I'm able to create a new instance of `Store` without any issues. I've also checked the `electron-store` documentation, and the `get()` method seems to be used correctly.

**Expected behavior:**

The `store.get(args.key)` method should retrieve the value associated with the given key from the store.

**Actual behavior:**

Title: Correctly tear down process when using pytest with multiprocessing
Body:
I am working on a package that includes a server with the corresponding client.
I was thinking that I could save a lot of effort mocking all the interactions and just write some test cases that test both sides at the same time.
So I wrote a fixture that would yield a multiprocessing.Process instance inside which the server is running.
When the tests are done I tear down the process using process.terminate(). Unfortunately there is another "orphaned" process that I can't seem to get a handle on.
How do I remove the other process or how do I avoid starting it in the first place?
If you know of a way of doing this with a different library than multiprocessing I am totally open to it.
To reproduce the problem I used the code from how-to-make-a-simple-python-rest-server-and-client to create a simple Rest Server/Client Pair.

import asyncio
import logging
import multiprocessing as mp

import pytest
import pytest_asyncio
import requests
from flask import Flask, jsonify


def server():
    app = Flask(__name__)

    tasks = [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "title": "Buy groceries",
            "description": "Milk, Cheese, Pizza, Fruit, Tylenol",
            "done": False,
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "title": "Learn Python",
            "description": "Need to find a good Python tutorial on the web",
            "done": False,
        },
    ]

    @app.route("/todo/api/v1.0/tasks", methods=["GET"])
    def get_tasks():
        return jsonify({"tasks": tasks})

    app.run()


class TestMultiprocessingTester:

    @pytest.fixture(scope="class")
    def server_process(self):
        server_process = mp.Process(target=server)
        server_process.start()
        yield server_process
        server_process.terminate()
        if server_process.is_alive():
            server_process.kill()
        logging.getLogger("Process").warning("shut down server process")

    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_client(self, server_process: mp.Process):
        await asyncio.sleep(10)
        url = "http://localhost:5000/todo/api/v1.0/tasks"
        response = requests.get(url)
        assert response.status_code == 200
        assert response.json()["tasks"][0]["done"] is False

llm_zero_shot_title: Python multiprocessing subprocess exits with SIGTERM during pytest unit test.
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Python multiprocessing: Subprocess killed with SIGTERM

I'm trying to write a unit test for a Flask API that runs in a separate process using `multiprocessing`. I start the server in a separate process and then send a request to it using `requests`. However, the subprocess is being killed with `SIGTERM` before the request can be sent.

Here's my code:

```python
import multiprocessing as mp
import logging
import requests
import pytest
import asyncio

class TestMultiprocessingTester:
    def server_process(self):
        server_process.terminate()
        if server_process.is_alive():
            server_process.kill()
        logging.getLogger("Process").warning("shut down server process")

    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_client(self, server_process: mp.Process):
        await asyncio.sleep(10)
        url = "http://localhost:5000/todo/api/v1.0/tasks"
        response = requests.get(url)
        assert response.status_code == 200
        assert response.json()["tasks"][0]["done"] is False
```

As you can see in the screenshot, the debugger is paused at the `logging.getLogger("Process").warning("shut down server process")` line. The `server_process` object in the "Locals" pane shows that the process has been stopped with `exitcode=-SIGTERM`.

I expect the subprocess to remain alive for the duration of the test so that the request can be sent and the response can be validated. 

What could be causing the subprocess to be killed prematurely, and how can I prevent this from happening?

llm_cot_title: Python multiprocessing - How to gracefully shut down a server process in pytest after testing?
llm_cot_body:
I am trying to write a unit test in Python that involves starting a server process using `multiprocessing.Process`, sending a request to it, and then shutting it down. However, I'm encountering an issue where the server process seems to be getting terminated prematurely with exit code `-SIGTERM`.

Here's a simplified version of my code:

```python
import multiprocessing as mp
import logging
import pytest
import requests
import asyncio

class TestMultiprocessingTester:
    def server_process(self):
        # Server code running in a separate process
        # ...

    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_client(self, server_process: mp.Process):
        server_process = mp.Process(target=self.server_process)
        server_process.start()

        await asyncio.sleep(10)  # Wait for the server to start

        url = "http://localhost:5000/todo/api/v1.0/tasks"
        response = requests.get(url)

        assert response.status_code == 200
        assert response.json()["tasks"][0]["done"] is False

        # Shut down the server
        if server_process.is_alive():
            server_process.terminate()
            logging.getLogger("Process").warning("shut down server process")
```

The code execution pauses at the breakpoint on the line `logging.getLogger("Process").warning("shut down server process")`, indicating that the server process has already been terminated before reaching this point. The `server_process` object in the debugger shows an `exitcode` of `-SIGTERM`.

I have tried adding a sleep before making the request to ensure the server has enough time to start, but the issue persists. I am unsure why the server process is being terminated prematurely. 

What could be causing this premature termination, and how can I prevent it to properly test my server process?
llm_cot_combined:
<<Python multiprocessing - How to gracefully shut down a server process in pytest after testing?>>

Title: Style Props of Button component doesn't apply in screen.debug
Title_Body:
<<Style Props of Button component doesn't apply in screen.debug>>
<<Im kinda new with the React Testing library. But I'm having a strange issue found during testing. Here's is my setup and code.
on  ../testUtils/rtl
import { ChakraProvider } from '@chakra-ui/react';
import { render, RenderOptions } from '@testing-library/react';
import '@testing-library/jest-dom';
import extendedTheme from '@/styles/themes';
import { ReactNode } from 'react';

const Providers: React.FC<{children: ReactNode}> = ({ children }) => (
  <ChakraProvider theme={extendedTheme}>{children}</ChakraProvider>
);

const customRender = (
  ui: React.ReactElement<any, string | React.JSXElementConstructor<any>>,
  options?: RenderOptions
) => {
  return render(ui, { wrapper: Providers, ...options });
};

export * from '@testing-library/react';
export { customRender as render };

on the test suites:
import { render } from '../../testUtils/rtl';
import {Button } from '@chakra-ui/react';

describe('Button', () => {
 
    it('sample test style props button', () => {
        
    
        const { container } = render(
            <Button backgroundColor={'red'}> sample red box</Button>
        );

        screen.logTestingPlaygroundURL();

        const containerDiv = window.getComputedStyle(container);

        expect(containerDiv.backgroundColor).toBe('red');
    });

Result in log testing playground:

The console output:
● Button › sample test style props button
expect(received).toBe(expected) // Object.is equality

Expected: "red"
Received: ""

  40 |         const containerDiv = window.getComputedStyle(container);
  41 |
> 42 |         expect(containerDiv.backgroundColor).toBe('red');
     |                                              ^
  43 |     });
  44 |

Do I miss something on my setup. I would appreciate any help or insight regarding this.
I'm expecting to see a red button on the screen.logTestingPlaygroundURL().
>>

The screenshot also shows the automatic kendo-popup tag in the Browser Developer tools, seen when a user clicks in Choose Document Type dropdown. llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to implement a carousel using *ngx-owl-carousel-o* in Angular. However, when I try to slide to the next slide, the carousel gets stuck and throws an error: "ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked."

The error message indicates that something is causing the carousel's state to change after Angular has finished its change detection cycle. This is often caused by asynchronous operations or changes happening outside of Angular's control.

How can I fix this error and make the carousel slide smoothly without encountering this error?

Here's the relevant HTML structure:

```html
<mat-sidenav-container>
  <mat-sidenav>...</mat-sidenav>
  <mat-sidenav-content>
    <!-- Other content -->
    <kendo-popup>...</kendo-popup>
```

How can I ensure that the `kendo-popup` is correctly positioned within the `mat-sidenav-content` area and doesn't overflow outside of it?>>

Title: 2^x and other test cases do not work for summation
Title_Body:
<<2^x and other test cases do not work for summation>>
<<In this code, I am supposed to find out the summation of an equation. x^2 does work, but 2^x, and so does for example, 3^y, doesn't work. How do I fix this without changing much?
For context, this one is used for a scientific calculator code in Java.
please note that I need a solution that doesn't use third party libraries.
    if (e.getSource() == summationButton) 
    { // summation
        try 
        {
            String startInput = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, "Enter start value");
            String endInput = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, "Enter end value");

                int end = Integer.parseInt(endInput);

                if (start > end)

                    textfield.setText("Error - start value must be equal to the end value.");
                    return;
                }

            else

                textfield.setText("Error - invalid range!");
            }
        } 
        catch (NumberFormatException ex)

        }
    }
