llm_zero_shot_title: Java Swing Calculator - How to Handle Invalid User Input (e.g., Non-Numeric, Empty) in JOptionPane?
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<Java Swing Calculator - How to Handle Invalid User Input (e.g., Non-Numeric, Empty) in JOptionPane?>>
<<## Java Swing Calculator - "Error - invalid input!" on Summation

I'm building a simple calculator application in Java Swing that includes a summation feature. The user is prompted to enter the start value, end value, and the expression to be evaluated. However, when I run the code and click the summation button, I consistently get an "Error - invalid input!" message displayed in the text field, regardless of the input values.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```java
public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
    if (e.getSource() == summationButton) { 
        try {
            String startInput = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(parentComponent: null, message: "Enter start value");
            String endInput = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(parentComponent: null, message: "Enter end value");

            if (startInput != null && !startInput.isEmpty() && endInput != null && !endInput.isEmpty()) {
                int start = Integer.parseInt(startInput);
                int end = Integer.parseInt(endInput);

                if (start > end) {
                    textfield.setText("Error - start value must be equal to the end value.");
                    return;
                }

                String expressionInput = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(parentComponent: null, message: "Enter expression:");

                if (expressionInput != null && !expressionInput.isEmpty()) {
                    double summationResult = 0;
                    for (int x = start; x <= end; x++) {
                        double value = evaluatePolynomial(expressionInput, x);
                        summationResult += value;
                    }
                    textfield.setText("Σ (" + expressionInput + ") from " + start + " to " + end + " = " + summationResult);
                } else {
                    textfield.setText("Error - invalid expression!"); 
                }
            } else {
                textfield.setText("Error - invalid range!");
            }
        } catch (NumberFormatException ex) {
            // Handle NumberFormatException
        }
    }
}
```

I've tested various inputs, including valid expressions and ranges, but the error persists. I suspect the issue might be related to how I'm handling user input or the `evaluatePolynomial` method (not shown here), but I haven't been able to pinpoint the exact cause.

**Expected Behavior:**

The calculator should correctly evaluate the summation of the given expression within the specified range and display the result in the text field.

**Actual Behavior:**

The calculator displays "Error - invalid input!" regardless of the input values.

Could someone please help me identify the source of this error and suggest a solution?>>

Title: Access Violation exception when calling DLL function loaded with boost import_alias
Title_Body:
<<Access Violation exception when calling DLL function loaded with boost import_alias>>
<<I am trying to call a function from a DLL. The API for the DLL looks like this:
#pragma once

#include <stdint.h>
#include <stdbool.h>

#if defined _MSC_VER || defined __MINGW32__
    #ifdef __cplusplus
        #define API extern "C" __declspec(dllexport)
    #else
        #define API __declspec(dllexport)
    #endif
#else
    #ifdef __cplusplus
        #define API extern "C" __attribute__((visibility("default")))
    #else
        #define API __attribute__((visibility("default")))
    #endif
#endif


API void* construct(const char* initString);

I am loading that function call using boost, and then trying to call it:
#include <boost/dll/import.hpp>
#include <boost/function.hpp>
#include <boost/filesystem.hpp>
#include <iostream>


typedef void* (ConstructT)(const char*);

int main() {
    boost::function<ConstructT> constructFunc = boost::dll::import_alias<ConstructT>(
        "TestPluginDll.dll",
        "construct",
        boost::dll::load_mode::append_decorations | boost::dll::load_mode::load_with_altered_search_path
    );
    
    std::string initArg = "hello";
    void* pluginInstance = constructFunc(initArg.c_str());
    std::cout << pluginInstance << std::endl;
}

However, it is failing on the call of the constructFunc, throwing an error at the following code in boost/dll/import.hpp:
        // Compilation error at this point means that imported function
        // was called with unmatching parameters.
        //
        // Example:
        // auto f = dll::import_symbol<void(int)>("function", "lib.so");
        // f("Hello");  // error: invalid conversion from 'const char*' to 'int'
        // f(1, 2);     // error: too many arguments to function
        // f();         // error: too few arguments to function
        template <class... Args>
        inline auto operator()(Args&&... args) const
            -> decltype( (*f_)(static_cast<Args&&>(args)...) )
        {
            return (*f_)(static_cast<Args&&>(args)...);
        }

Why is this failing? The type of std::string.c_str() is const char*, so it seems like it is the correct type.
For reference, my DLL code looks like this:
#include <plugin_interface.hpp>
#include <iostream>
#include <nlohmann/json.hpp>


class MyPlugin {
public:
    MyPlugin() {}
};


extern "C" API void* construct(const char* initString) {
    MyPlugin* plugin = new MyPlugin();
    return static_cast<void*>(plugin);
}

The exception:
Exception has occurred: W32/0xC0000005
Unhandled exception at 0x00007FF77B713633 in tmp.exe: 0xC0000005: Access violation reading location 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF.


>>
llm_zero_shot_title: C++ Boost::dll Access Violation Exception on Function Call - Unmatching Parameters?
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Access violation reading location 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF when calling imported function with Boost::dll

I'm trying to call a function from a shared library using `Boost::dll` but I'm getting an "Access violation reading location 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF" error. I've verified that the library is loaded correctly and the function signature matches.

Here's the relevant code:

```cpp
#include <boost/dll.hpp>

int main() {
  boost::dll::shared_library lib("mylib.so");
  auto func = lib.get<void*>(BOOST_DLL_SYMBOL("my_function"));

  func("hello"); // This line crashes

  return 0;
}
```

The debugger shows an exception at this line:

```cpp
return (*f_)(static_cast<Args&&>(args)...);
```

And the "Locals" window shows:

```
> this = 0x0000001802cff9e0 {f_={px=0xb7d7e9000020cce9 pn={pi_=0x0...
> <args_0> = 0x0000001802cffa40 "hello"
```

**Expected behavior:**

The function `my_function` in `mylib.so` should be called with the string "hello" as an argument.

**Actual behavior:**

An access violation exception is thrown when calling the function.

**What I've tried:**

* Double-checked the function signature in the library and my code.
* Verified that the library is loaded correctly.

I'm not sure what else to check. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

llm_cot_body:
I'm encountering an "Access violation reading location 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF" error while using Boost.DLL to call a function from a shared library. The error occurs within the `boost::dll::detail::library_function` class, specifically at the point where the function arguments are being cast.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```c++
#include <boost/dll.hpp>

int main() {
    auto f = boost::dll::import_symbol<void(int)>("function", "lib.so");
    f("Hello"); // error: invalid conversion from 'const char*' to 'int'
    // ... other error examples ...
    return 0;
}
```

The error message suggests that the issue might be related to mismatched function parameters. However, I've double-checked the function signature in both the calling code and the shared library, and they appear to match.

I've also tried explicitly casting the arguments to the correct types, but the error persists.

**What I've Tried:**

- Verified function signature matching.
- Explicitly cast arguments to the expected types.

**Environment:**

- Operating System: Windows
- Compiler: [Your Compiler]
- Boost Version: [Your Boost Version]

I'm unsure what else to check at this point. Any insights into why this error might be occurring and how to resolve it would be greatly appreciated.

Title: Laravel Broadcasting not firing on the Job Queue
Title_Body:
<<Laravel Broadcasting not firing on the Job Queue>>
<<I am creating a AI ChatBot. The message is entered on the frontend (Livewire) and then stored in the database. A model "created" listener then pushes a job onto the queue which asks the AI (LLM) the prompt and the answer is then updated on the model (on the queue). There is then an "updated" listener, which fires a broadcasting event.
On the front end the Livewire component is listening via Laravel Echo for the updated event, and the chat response is shown to the user.
The problem I have is that the broadcasting event works, but not on the queue. I have tested it via a Console Command and it updates the chat, but when the job is processed on the queue, no update occurs.
I have checked the Herd logs, and again, I can see the event broadcasting when I manually trigger with the Console Command, but no event is broadcasted when the job is processed on the queue.
So:

The job to get the llm response is always successfully processed on the queue when the model is created
The LlmMessage model is always updated successfully by this job, and the response is stored
The LlmMessageUpdated event is broadcasted and the Livewire Component updated when a manual update is triggered
The LlmMessageUpdated event is not broadcasted and the Livewire Component is not updated when the job updates the model

Where am I going wrong?
Code:
LlmMessage Model

<?php

namespace App\Models;

use App\Events\LlmMessageUpdated;
use App\Jobs\GetLlmMessageResponse;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Model;
use Pgvector\Laravel\Vector;

/**
 * @property int $user_id
 * @property string $prompt
 * @property string $response
 */
class LlmMessage extends Model
{
    protected $connection = 'llm';

    protected $fillable = [
        "user_id",
        "prompt",
        "response"
    ];

    protected $guarded = [];

    public function getFormattedPrompt()
    {
        $pd = new \Parsedown();
        $pd->setSafeMode(true);
        return $pd->text($this->prompt);
    }

    public function getFormattedResponse()
    {
        $pd = new \Parsedown();
        $pd->setSafeMode(true);
        return $pd->text($this->response);
    }

    protected static function boot()
    {
        parent::boot();

        static::created(function (LlmMessage $message) {
            GetLlmMessageResponse::dispatch($message);
        });

        static::updated(function (LlmMessage $message) {
            LlmMessageUpdated::dispatch($message->id, $message->user_id);
        });
    }
}


Event To Broadcast

<?php

namespace App\Events;

use Illuminate\Broadcasting\InteractsWithSockets;
use Illuminate\Contracts\Broadcasting\ShouldBroadcastNow;
use Illuminate\Foundation\Events\Dispatchable;
use Illuminate\Queue\SerializesModels;

class LlmMessageUpdated implements ShouldBroadcastNow
{
    use Dispatchable, InteractsWithSockets, SerializesModels;

    /**
     * Create a new event instance.
     */
    public function __construct(public int $id, public int $user_id)
    {
        //
    }

    /**
     * Get the channels the event should broadcast on.
     *
     * @return array<int, \Illuminate\Broadcasting\Channel>
     */
    public function broadcastOn(): array
    {
        return [
            'llm-thread-' . $this->user_id
        ];
    }
}

Frontend Livewire Component

<?php

namespace App\Livewire;

use App\Models\LlmMessage;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Collection;
use Livewire\Attributes\Validate;
use Livewire\Component;

class LlmChat extends Component
{
    #[Validate('required|max:1000')]
    public string $body = '';

    public Collection $chatMessages;

    public function getChatMessages()
    {
        return $this->chatMessages;
    }

    public function getListeners()
    {
        $user_id = auth()->user()->id;

        return [
            "echo:llm-thread-{$user_id},LlmMessageUpdated" => 'onMessageUpdated',
        ];
    }

    public function mount()
    {
        $this->chatMessages = LlmMessage::orderBy('created_at', 'asc')
            ->take(20)
            ->get();
    }

    public function send()
    {
        $this->validate();

        $this->chatMessages->push(LlmMessage::create([
            "user_id" => auth()->user()->id,
            "prompt" => $this->body
        ]));

        $this->body = '';
    }

    public function onMessageUpdated($data)
    {
        $index = $this->chatMessages->search(fn($chatMessage) => $chatMessage->id === $data['id']);
        $this->chatMessages[$index] = LlmMessage::findOrFail($data['id']);
    }

    public function render()
    {
        return view('livewire.llm-chat')
            ->layout('livewire.layout.chat-app');
    }
}

Laravel Herd Reverb Logs showing event firing when manually triggered:

>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Laravel Echo Server - Client is subscribed but not receiving broadcast events after "pusher: ping" event.
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Laravel Echo / Pusher - Client Disconnects Immediately After Subscribing

I'm trying to establish a real-time connection with my Laravel application using Laravel Echo and Pusher. While the client seems to connect and subscribe to the channel initially, the connection immediately closes afterward.

Here's what I see in my Reverb logs:

```
7 [1m
```

Title: iceberg 1.1.0 set write.distribution-mode to none but does not take effect
Body:
iceberg version: 1.1.0
spark version: 3.3.0
I created a new table like the one below.
CREATE TABLE prod.db.sample (
...
)
USING iceberg
PARTITIONED BY (day)
LOCATION '...'
TBLPROPERTIES (
  'write.format.default' = 'orc',
  'history.expire.max-snapshot-age-ms' = '432000000 ',
  'history.expire.min-snapshots-to-keep' = '24')

Then I noticed that an extra sort step was added when writing out the data into this table in spark job.
This increased the time it took to write out the data.
So I tried to set write.distribution-mode to none like the one below.
ALTER TABLE prod.db.sample SET TBLPROPERTIES (
    'write.distribution-mode'='none'
);

Moreover, it appears from the latest metadata file on hdfs that this setting was successful.

But when I re-ran the job, there was still an extra sort step.
How can I set write.distribution-mode to none in this situation without changing the version of spark&iceberg?
Title_Body:
<<iceberg 1.1.0 set write.distribution-mode to none but does not take effect>>
<<iceberg version: 1.1.0
spark version: 3.3.0
I created a new table like the one below.
CREATE TABLE prod.db.sample (
...
)
USING iceberg
PARTITIONED BY (day)
LOCATION '...'
TBLPROPERTIES (
  'write.format.default' = 'orc',
  'history.expire.max-snapshot-age-ms' = '432000000 ',
  'history.expire.min-snapshots-to-keep' = '24')

Then I noticed that an extra sort step was added when writing out the data into this table in spark job.
This increased the time it took to write out the data.
So I tried to set write.distribution-mode to none like the one below.
ALTER TABLE prod.db.sample SET TBLPROPERTIES (
    'write.distribution-mode'='none'
);

Moreover, it appears from the latest metadata file on hdfs that this setting was successful.

But when I re-ran the job, there was still an extra sort step.
How can I set write.distribution-mode to none in this situation without changing the version of spark&iceberg?
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: How to set "history.expire.max-snapshot-age-ms" to unlimited in [your technology/framework]?
llm_zero_shot_body:
I'm trying to configure the snapshot settings for my data lake, but I'm encountering an issue with the `history.expire.max-snapshot-age-ms` property.

Here's the relevant configuration snippet:

```json
"properties" : {
"owner" : "...",
"history.expire.max-snapshot-age-ms" : "4320000000",
"write.distribution-mode" : "none",
"write.format.default" : "orc",
"history.expire.min-snapshots-to-keep" : "24"
},
```

I've set `history.expire.max-snapshot-age-ms` to `4320000000` milliseconds (which is equivalent to 50 days), but the snapshots seem to be expiring much earlier than that. 

**Expected Behavior:** Snapshots should be retained for at least 50 days.

**Actual Behavior:** Snapshots are expiring prematurely.

I've double-checked the documentation and other configuration settings, but I can't seem to figure out why this is happening. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

llm_cot_title: What is the correct format for "history.expire.max-snapshot-age-ms" in configuration?
llm_cot_body:
I'm trying to configure the snapshot settings for my data lake, but I'm unsure about the correct value for `history.expire.max-snapshot-age-ms`. Currently, it's set to `432000000`, which seems excessively high.

```json
"properties" : {
"owner" : "",
"history.expire.max-snapshot-age-ms" : "432000000",
"write.distribution-mode" : "none",
"write.format.default" : "orc",
"history.expire.min-snapshots-to-keep" : "24"
},
```

What is the recommended value for `history.expire.max-snapshot-age-ms` in a data lake setting? Should I lower this value, and if so, what factors should I consider when determining the optimal setting? 

I'm concerned about potential performance impacts or storage bloat if the snapshot age is set too high. Any insights or best practices regarding this configuration parameter would be greatly appreciated.

Title: Error: SAP DBTech JDBC: [2048]: column store error: search table error: [34023] Instantiation of calculation model failed; exception 306108
Body:
In HANA, I built the calculation view, where it is the external view from the HANA DSO. In the DSO, the data preview is fine and does not throw error, but the same data preview done on Calculation view throws this error:

I tried deleting all the input parameters and also expression in filters, only - in("column_name" ='DSO_name$C') in aggregation before join  and "LANGU" = 'E' is there in default text projection.
I also tried to data preview in aggregation before join node (which is the first node ~staging node), but still the same error is thrown.
Can anyone help or suggest how to resolve this issue?
PS: I also tried this note, but it doesn't help
https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3440854

llm_zero_shot_title: SAP DBTech JDBC: [2048] Column Store Error - Syntax Error in Expression String When Using "DATETO" and "DATEFROM"
llm_zero_shot_body:
## SAP DBTech JDBC Column Store Error: Syntax Error in Expression String

I'm encountering a "column store error" while trying to execute a query in my SAP environment. The error message indicates a syntax issue with my expression, but I'm unable to pinpoint the exact problem.

**Error Message:**

```
Error: SAP DBTech JDBC: [2048]: column store error: search table error:
[34023] Instantiation of calculation model failed; exception 306108: Query
entries cannot be parsed. Failed to convert expression ""DATETO" >= AND
>= "DATEFROM" AND " to QueryEntries at node PROJ_Q1. Reason:
Evaluator: syntax error in expression string;expected TK_ID,'"DATETO" >=
[here]AND >= "DATEFROM" AND '
```

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect the query to execute successfully and return the relevant data.

**Actual Behavior:**

The query execution fails with the error message shown above.

**Question:**

What is the cause of this syntax error in my expression string, and how can I resolve it to successfully execute my query? 

**Additional Information:**

* I am using [Specify your IDE or tool].
* The relevant part of the query seems to involve the fields "DATETO" and "DATEFROM". 

Any help in understanding and resolving this error would be greatly appreciated.

I am trying to connect to Snowflake using the `snow` command-line tool, but I'm getting an "Invalid connection configuration" error.

Here is my `config.toml` file:

```toml
default_connection_name = "trial_oct2024"

[connections.trial_oct2024]
account = "DNULRGX-XA43872"
user = <redacted>
password = <redacted>
database = "LOAD_DATA"
schema = "PUBLIC"
warehouse = "COMPUTE_WH"
role = "ACCOUNTADMIN"
```

And here is the error message:

```
PS C:\Users\<redacted>\Desktop\snowflakeDataEngineering> snow connection test --connection trial_oct2024
Error
Invalid connection configuration. 250001: 250001: Could not connect to Snowflake backend after 2 attempt(s). Aborting
```

I have double-checked that all the credentials in my `config.toml` file are correct. I can also connect to Snowflake successfully using the same credentials in the Snowflake web UI.

I am running the `snow` command from PowerShell in Windows.

What could be causing this error and how can I fix it?

Title: Error Reading pubspec.yaml File in Flutter Project
Title_Body:
<<Error Reading pubspec.yaml File in Flutter Project>>
<<
I'm experiencing an issue while trying to read the pubspec.yaml file in my Flutter project. Here’s the situation:
I have the following Dart code to read the pubspec.yaml file:
import 'dart:io';
import 'package:yaml/yaml.dart'; // For reading YAML files

void main() async {
  // Specify the path to the pubspec.yaml file
  final filePath = '../pubspec.yaml'; // Update this according to your directory structure
  final file = File(filePath);

  // Check if the file exists
  if (await file.exists()) {
    // Read the file
    final String text = await file.readAsString();

    // Load the YAML content
    Map yaml = loadYaml(text);

    // Extract information from the YAML
    print('App Name: ${yaml['name']}');
    print('Description: ${yaml['description']}');
    print('Version: ${yaml['version']}');
    print('Author: ${yaml['author']}');
    print('Homepage: ${yaml['homepage']}');
    print('Dependencies: ${yaml['dependencies']}');
  } else {
    print('pubspec.yaml file not found: $filePath');
  }
}

When I run this code, I encounter the following error message:

Launching lib/main.dart on sdk gphone16k arm64 in debug mode... ✓
Built build/app/outputs/flutter-apk/app-debug.apk Connecting to VM
Service at ws://127.0.0.1:61423/kakyQdOAGF0=/ws Connected to the VM
Service. I/flutter ( 4529): Current directory: / I/flutter ( 4529):
pubspec.yaml file not found at: pubspec.yaml I/.example.reader( 4529):
Compiler allocated 5250KB to compile void
android.view.ViewRootImpl.performTraversals() D/ProfileInstaller(
4529): Installing profile for com.example.reader

Problem Description
The error indicates that the Dart code cannot find the pubspec.yaml file at the specified path. The current working directory is shown as the root directory (/), but the file is not located there.
Request for Help
I am struggling to resolve this issue and would appreciate any suggestions or guidance from anyone who has faced a similar problem. What steps can I take to fix the pubspec.yaml file not found error? Any insights would be greatly appreciated! Thank you!
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Flutter - pubspec.yaml file not found, even though it exists in the project root directory
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<Flutter - pubspec.yaml file not found, even though it exists in the project root directory>>
<<## Flutter can't find pubspec.yaml when running on iOS Simulator

I'm trying to read the contents of my `pubspec.yaml` file in a Flutter app. I'm using the `dart:io` package to access the file system.

Here's the relevant code:

```dart
import 'dart:io';
import 'package:yaml/yaml.dart'; // For reading YAML files

void main() async {
  // Get the current working directory
  final currentDir = Directory.current.path;
  print('Current directory: $currentDir');

  // Specify the path to the pubspec.yaml file
  final filePath = 'pubspec.yaml'; // Use the relative path
  // final filePath = '${currentDir}/pubspec.yaml'; // Use the absolute path
  final file = File(filePath);

  // Check if the file exists
  if (await file.exists()) {
    // Read the file
    final String text = await file.readAsString();

    // Load the YAML content
    Map yaml = loadYaml(text);
  }
}
```

When I run this code on the iOS simulator, I get the following error:

```
flutter: pubspec.yaml file not found at: pubspec.yaml
```

The `pubspec.yaml` file definitely exists in the root of my project. I've tried using both a relative and absolute path to the file, but I get the same error.

**Expected behavior:**

The code should successfully find and read the `pubspec.yaml` file.

**Actual behavior:**

The code throws an error saying that the file cannot be found.

What am I doing wrong?>>

Title: Use typealias defined inside generic class in method signature
Title_Body:
<<Use typealias defined inside generic class in method signature>>
<<Given a generic class, one might have multiple methods which use a deduced type in their signature. To avoid repetition I would like to define a typealias. What is the best way to access it in a method signature?
class Y[X]:
    type Z = list[X]

    # this one works
    def works_with_pyright_but_ugly(self) -> "Y[X].Z":
        return []

    # these do not work
    def what_is_Y(self) -> Y[X].Z:
        return []

    def self_has_no_member_z(self) -> Self.Z:
        return []

    def what_is_z(self) -> Z:
        return []

    def listify(self, value: X) -> Z:
        """Just to show a slighlty more meaningful funciton"""
        return [value]

Is there a better way to reference Z in the method signatures?
In my view, what_is_z and listify do not work, because my editor does not list the value of the variable in the following example as list[int] as I would expect. Half the reason of type annotations for me is convenience in the editor (the other half being error checking).

>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Python Type Hint Error When Returning a List with a Generic Type  from a Generic Class Method
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Python Type Hinting Issue with Generic Class Method

I'm having trouble getting mypy to correctly infer the return type of a method within a generic class. Here's a simplified example:

```python
from typing import Any, TypeVar, List

X = TypeVar('X')

class Y[X]:
    type Z = List[X]
    def a(self, x: X) -> Z:
        return [x]

b: AnyList[Any] = Y[int]().a(x=2)
```

**Expected behavior:**

mypy should infer that the type of `b` is `List[int]`.

**Actual behavior:**

mypy throws an error:

```
error: Incompatible types in assignment (expression has type "List[int]", variable has type "AnyList[Any]")
```

I'm not sure why mypy isn't able to correctly infer the type here. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

llm_cot_title: Python Type Hinting: Function Returning List of Type Parameter Not Accepted as Return Type
llm_cot_body:
I'm having trouble understanding how Python's type hinting works with generics in this specific scenario.

```python
class Y[X]:
    type Z = list[X]
    def a(self, x: X) -> Z:
        return [x]

b: Anylist[Any] = Y[int]().a(x=2)
```

In this code, I have a generic class `Y` that takes a type parameter `X`. Inside the class, I define a type alias `Z` as `list[X]`. The method `a` takes an argument `x` of type `X` and returns a `Z`, which should be a `list[X]`.

However, when I try to call the method `a` on an instance of `Y[int]` with an integer argument, I'm not sure what type annotation to use for the variable `b`. I've tried `Anylist[Any]`, but I'm not sure if this is correct or if there's a more specific type I could use.

Can someone explain how the type hinting works in this case and what the correct type annotation for `b` should be?
llm_cot_combined:
<<Python Type Hinting: Function Returning List of Type Parameter Not Accepted as Return Type>>
<<I'm having trouble understanding how Python's type hinting works with generics in this specific scenario.

```python
class Y[X]:
    type Z = list[X]
    def a(self, x: X) -> Z:
        return [x]

b: Anylist[Any] = Y[int]().a(x=2)
```

In this code, I have a generic class `Y` that takes a type parameter `X`. Inside the class, I define a type alias `Z` as `list[X]`. The method `a` takes an argument `x` of type `X` and returns a `Z`, which should be a `list[X]`.

However, when I try to call the method `a` on an instance of `Y[int]` with an integer argument, I'm not sure what type annotation to use for the variable `b`. I've tried `Anylist[Any]`, but I'm not sure if this is correct or if there's a more specific type I could use.

Can someone explain how the type hinting works in this case and what the correct type annotation for `b` should be?>>

llm_zero_shot_title: PostgreSQL Query Returning Empty Result Set Despite Existing Data in Table
llm_zero_shot_body:
I'm running a simple SQL query to fetch data from a table, but I'm not seeing any data in the results pane. The query executes without any errors, and the status bar indicates that 4 rows should be returned.

Here's the query:

```sql
SELECT * FROM public.normative_documents
ORDER BY id ASC
```

The table `public.normative_documents` definitely exists and contains data. I've verified this through other means.

**Expected Behavior:**
The data output pane should display the 4 rows present in the `public.normative_documents` table.

**Actual Behavior:**
The data output pane is empty, despite the query executing successfully and the status bar indicating 4 rows.

I've tried refreshing the connection and restarting the IDE, but the issue persists. Any ideas on what might be causing this and how to resolve it?

llm_cot_title: How to Select Specific Columns from a Table in SQL?
llm_cot_body:
I'm trying to query a PostgreSQL database using a SQL client, and while the query executes successfully and returns the expected number of rows (4 in this case), the "Data Output" section remains empty. I can see the column names and their data types, but no actual data is displayed.

Here's the query I'm using:

```sql
SELECT * FROM public.normative_documents ORDER BY id ASC;
```

The query completes in 144 milliseconds, and the message indicates "Total rows: 4 of 4," confirming that data should be present.

I've tried the following:

* Refreshing the data output view
* Executing other queries (which also return empty data output)
* Reconnecting to the database

None of these attempts have resolved the issue.

Is there a setting or configuration within my SQL client that might be preventing the data output from displaying? Could this be a database-side issue? Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Title: SquareSpace Section Auto-Expand to Footer

Title: pymysql use commit still can't insert
Body:
Even using the commit() with pymysql, insert statement has no effect.
Hi, this is my first time posting here, and I hope someone can solve my problem.
I am using VS2022 to compile the following code in a Python 3.12 environment:
import pymysql

conn_test = pymysql.connect(host='localhost', port=3306, user='root', passwd='****', charset='utf8', db='pythonTest', autocommit=True)

with conn_test.cursor() as cursor:
    1
    sql_insert = """
        INSERT INTO Members (Name, Height, Weight) VALUES
        ('Tony', 170, 56),
        ('Dawn', 167, 40),
        ('Jack', 185, 83);
    """
    cursor.execute(sql_insert)

    conn_test.commit()

conn_test.close()

I have already confirmed that the pymysql.connect command works correctly, and I have used it to create the 'members' table.
import pymysql

conn_test = pymysql.connect(host='localhost', port=3306, user='root', passwd='****', charset='utf8', db='pythonTest')

with  conn_test.cursor() as cursor:
    sql_create = """
    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS Members(
    ID int NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    Name varchar(20),
    Height int(6),
    Weight int(6)
    );
    """

    cursor.execute(sql_create)

    conn_test.commit()

conn_test.close()

I can see that the 'members' table was created using MySQL Workbench, but no matter how many times I refresh or rerun the code, the 'members' table doesn't contain data like Tony and others.
Since I'm not very familiar with pymysql, I'm not sure where the problem is. Could anyone help me solve this issue?
===2024/10/19 Update===
Hello everyone, I’ve been dealing with other matters during this time, so I apologize for not responding earlier. Here’s an update with the current Insert statement code, along with an image of the execution result.
import pymysql

conn_test = pymysql.connect(host='localhost', port=3306, user='root', passwd='exagger2024SQL', charset='utf8', db='pythonTest', autocommit=True)

with conn_test.cursor() as cursor:
    1
    sql_insert = """
        INSERT INTO pythonTest.Members (ID, Name, Height, Weight) VALUES
        (1, 'Tony', 170, 56),
        (2, 'Dawn', 167, 40),
        (3, 'Jack', 185, 83)
    """
    try:
        cursor.execute(sql_insert)

        conn_test.commit()
    except Exception as e:
        conn_test.rollback()

        print(e);

conn_test.close()


As you can see, this piece of code doesn’t seem to show any errors, because if there were compilation errors, the 'try' and 'except' should have caught them, but they didn’t.

llm_zero_shot_title: Python pymysql insert statement throws "Press any key to continue..." error message.
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Python MySQL Connector: "Press any key to continue..." after executing INSERT statement

I'm trying to insert data into a MySQL database using Python's `pymysql` connector, but I'm encountering a strange issue. After the `cursor.execute(sql_insert)` line is executed, a Windows console window pops up with the message "Press any key to continue...". 

Here's my code:

```python
import pymysql

conn_test = pymysql.connect(host='localhost', port=3306, user='root', passwd='[REDACTED]', 
                             charset='utf8', db='pythonTest', autocommit=True)

with conn_test.cursor() as cursor:
    sql_insert = """
    INSERT INTO pythonTest.Members (ID, Name, Height, Weight) VALUES
    (1, 'Tony', 170, 56),
    (2, 'Dawn', 167, 40),
    (3, 'Jack', 185, 83)
    """
    try:
        cursor.execute(sql_insert)
        conn_test.commit()
    except Exception as e:
        conn_test.rollback()
        print(e)

conn_test.close()
```

**Expected behavior:** The code should connect to the database, insert the data into the `Members` table, and exit gracefully.

**Actual behavior:** The code seems to execute the insert statement, but then it gets stuck on the "Press any key to continue..." prompt in a separate console window. 

I've checked the database, and the data seems to be inserted correctly. I'm not sure why this prompt is appearing or how to get rid of it. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Here's my code:

```python
import pymysql
```

llm_zero_shot_title: Python AssertionError: assert 'hello' == 'world' - Why is my string comparison failing in this test?
llm_zero_shot_body:
**Python Assertion Error - Strings Not Equal**

I'm running a simple Python test suite and encountering an `AssertionError` when comparing two strings. I'm certain the strings should be identical, but the test is failing.

Here's the relevant code:

```python
def test_string_equality():
    assert "hello" == "world" # This will fail
```

And here's the error message:

```
c:\local_code\repos\<redacted>\tests\test_temp.py:test_string_equality failed: def test_string_equality(): test_string_equality
tests\test_temp.py::test_string_equality failed: def test_string_equality():
c:\local_code\repos\<redacted>\tests\test_temp.py:9: AssertionError
AssertionError: assert 'hello' == 'world'
- world
+ hello
```

**Expected Behavior:**

The test should pass since both strings are "hello".

**Actual Behavior:**

The test fails with an `AssertionError`, indicating the strings are not equal.

I've double-checked for typos and hidden characters, but everything seems correct. What could be causing this issue?

llm_few_shot_title: Python Assertion Error When Comparing Strings
llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to write a unit test in Python to check if two strings are equal. However, the test is failing even when the strings appear to be the same. The error message I'm getting is "AssertionError: assert 'hello' == 'world'", but when I print the values of the strings, they both show as "hello". I'm not sure why the assertion is failing when the strings seem to match.

The most important part of the error is the values being compared in the AssertionError: "assert 'hello' == 'world'". Despite the error message, the actual values of the strings seem to be "hello" and "hello", which should be considered equal.

Could there be an issue with how I'm comparing the strings or some hidden characters causing the test to fail?

Title: Problem after updating to geoflutterfire_plus package
Title_Body:
<<Problem after updating to geoflutterfire_plus package>>
<<I use to have the package geoflutterfire2, I used this package to get the id of users that where in a certain distance from a specific location (latitude and longitude), my code was:
getSuppliersLocation(BuildContext context, int requestReach, String serviceCode,
    double lat, double long) async {
  final serviceRequest = Provider.of<CustomerRequest>(context, listen: false);
  final user = firebaseAuth.currentUser?.uid;
  final fcmToken = await firebaseMessaging.getToken();

  late Stream<List<DocumentSnapshot>> stream;
  late GeoFlutterFire geo;

  geo = GeoFlutterFire();
  final radius = requestReach / 1000;
  String field = 'location';

  String collectionRoute;
  productionStatus
      ? collectionRoute = 'supplier'
      : collectionRoute = 'Testsupplier';

  var collectionReference = firestore
      .collection(collectionRoute)
      .where(serviceCode, isEqualTo: true)
      .where('isActive', isEqualTo: true)
      .where('isVerified', isEqualTo: true);

  GeoFirePoint center = geo.point(latitude: lat, longitude: long);

  stream = geo
      .collection(collectionRef: collectionReference)
      .within(center: center, radius: radius, field: field, strictMode: true);

  controllerSuppliers = stream.listen((List<DocumentSnapshot> documentList) {
    List<String> ids = [];
    List<String> tokenIds = [];
    List<String> phoneNumbers = [];
    for (var item in documentList) {
      final data = item.data() as Map<String, dynamic>;
      if (data.containsKey('id') && data['id'] != user) {
        ids.add(data['id']);
      }
      if (data.containsKey('tokenId') && data['tokenId'] != fcmToken) {
        tokenIds.add(data['tokenId']);
      }
      if (data.containsKey('phoneNumber')) {
        phoneNumbers.add(data['phoneNumber']);
      }
    }

    if (ids.isNotEmpty) {
      serviceRequest.setAuthorizedSuppliersIds = ids;
    } else {}

    serviceRequest.setAuthorizedSuppliersIds = ids;
    serviceRequest.setAuthorizedSuppliersTokenIds = tokenIds;
    serviceRequest.setAuthorizedSuppliersPhoneNumbers = phoneNumbers;
  });
}

but I have to update to flutter 3.22, and with that my Google Sign In stop working, so I have to update the firebase_auth and firebase_core to avoid the Google Sign In problem, but when doing that, the geoflutterfire2 stop working, because it depends in an older firebase_auth and firebase_core package, geoflutterfire2 last update was 19 months ago, so I look for a new package and I found the Geoflutterfire_plus package, so I try to update my code but I'm blocked at this problem:
I need to make a query to get only the collection that meet this criteria:
  var collectionReference = firestore
      .collection(collectionRoute)
      .where(serviceCode, isEqualTo: true)
      .where('isActive', isEqualTo: true)
      .where('isVerified', isEqualTo: true);

but the problem is that in order to do the stream:
  Stream<List<DocumentSnapshot<Map<String, dynamic>>>> stream =
        GeoCollectionReference<Map<String, dynamic>>(collectionReference).subscribeWithin(
            center: center,
            radiusInKm: radius,
            field: field,
            geopointFrom: geopointFrom);

the collectionReference needs to be CollectionReference<Map<String, dynamic>>, so the error is at this:

please help!!!
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Flutter & Firebase Firestore: How to assign a Query to a CollectionReference? (invalid_assignment)
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Flutter/Firestore: Type mismatch error when using GeoCollectionReference.subscribeWithin()

I am trying to query documents within a certain radius using the `GeoCollectionReference.subscribeWithin()` method from the `geoflutterfire` package in my Flutter app. However, I am getting a type mismatch error on the `collectionReference` variable.

Here is the relevant code snippet:

```dart
CollectionReference<Map<String, dynamic>> collectionReference = firestore
    .collection(collectionRoute)
    .where('serviceCode', isEqualTo: serviceCode)
    .where('isActive', isEqualTo: true)
    .where('isVerified', isEqualTo: true);

// ... other code ...

Stream<List<DocumentSnapshot<Map<String, dynamic>>>> stream =
    GeoCollectionReference<Map<String, dynamic>>(collectionReference)
        .subscribeWithin(
      center: center,
      radiusInKm: radius,
      field: field,
      geopointFrom: geopointFrom,
    );
```

And here is the error message:

```
A value of type 'Query<Map<String, dynamic>>' can't be assigned to a variable of type 'CollectionReference<Map<String, dynamic>>'.
Try changing the type of the variable, or casting the right-hand type to 'CollectionReference<Map<String, dynamic>>'. dart(invalid_assignment)
```

I understand that the `where()` method returns a `Query` object, but I need to pass a `CollectionReference` object to the `GeoCollectionReference` constructor. 

How can I resolve this type mismatch and correctly use the `GeoCollectionReference.subscribeWithin()` method with my Firestore query?

Title: riverpod_generator does not recognize types generated by Drift as parameters
Title_Body:
<<riverpod_generator does not recognize types generated by Drift as parameters>>
<<pubspec.yaml
dependencies:
    ...
    drift: ^2.20.2
    drift_flutter: ^0.1.0
    flutter_riverpod: ^2.5.1

dev_dependencies:
    ...
    drift_dev: ^2.20.3
    riverpod_generator: ^2.3.3
    build_runner: ^2.4.12

database.dart
part 'database.g.dart';

class TodoItems extends Table {
  TextColumn get id => text()();

  TextColumn get title => text()();

  TextColumn get content => text().nullable()();

  @override
  Set<Column<Object>>? get primaryKey => {id};
}

@DriftDatabase(tables: [TodoItems])
class AppDatabase extends _$AppDatabase {
    ...
}

providers.dart
/// add todo item
/// [TodoItem] generated by drift
@riverpod
Future<void> addTodo(AddTodoRef ref, TodoItem todo) async {

}

Then run dart run build_runner watch -d will generate database.g.dart and providers.g.dart
The problem is
providers.g.dart will define the TodoItem type in database.g.dart as InvalidType, not TodoItem

How can providers.g.dart define TodoItem correctly?
Is there any way to make Drift's code generator execute before Riverpod's code generator?
>>

llm_zero_shot_title: Excel INDEX Function Returning #VALUE! Error When Used with IF and ROW Functions
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Excel INDEX formula returning #VALUE! error despite seemingly correct logic

I'm trying to use the `INDEX` function in Excel to dynamically retrieve values from a list in column R, based on whether corresponding cells in column P are empty. However, I'm getting a `#VALUE!` error for most of the results, and a `#SPILL!` error at the end.

Here's the formula I'm using in cell T2, which I'm dragging down:

```excel
=IF(P2<>"", P2, INDEX($R$2:$R$5000,ROW()-COUNTA($P$2:$P$5000)))
```

**Expected Behavior:**

The formula should check if cell P2 is empty. If it's not empty, it should return the value from P2. If P2 is empty, it should return a value from column R. The `INDEX` function should find the correct row by subtracting the count of non-empty cells in the range `P2:P5000` from the current row number.

For example:

* T2 should return "Net Sales Revenue" (from P2)
* T3 should return "Other Operating Proceeds" (from P3)
* T4 should return "General and Administrative Expenses" (from R2)
* T5 should return "Income Taxes" (from R3)
* and so on...

**Actual Behavior:**

Instead, I'm getting:

* T2 and T3 return the correct values from column P.
* T4 to T13 return `#VALUE!` errors.
* T14 returns a `#SPILL!` error.

I've double-checked the data types in columns P and R, and they seem consistent. I've also tried using different ranges for the `INDEX` function, but the error persists.

What am I doing wrong? How can I fix this formula to get the desired results?

Title: viewModel on Kotlin Multiplatform?

androidx-compose-runtime = "1.8.0-alpha03"
androidx-lifecycle-viewmodel = "2.9.0-alpha04"
lifecycleViewmodel = "2.9.0-dev1873"

llm_zero_shot_title: "Unresolved reference" error for viewModel in Android Compose project
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Unresolved reference: viewModel in Android Studio

I'm working on an Android project in Android Studio and I'm getting an "Unresolved reference" error for `viewModel` in my composable function. I've imported `androidx.lifecycle.viewmodel.compose.viewModel`, but the error persists.

Here's the relevant code:

```kotlin
import org.jetbrains.compose.resources.painterResource
import androidx.lifecycle.viewmodel.compose.viewModel
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.Arrangement
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.Column
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.Row
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.Spacer
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.defaultMinSize
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.fillMaxSize

// ... other code ...

@Composable
fun MyComposable() {
    val viewModel = viewModel<MyViewModel>() // Error: Unresolved reference: viewModel
    // ... rest of the composable function ...
}
```

**Expected behavior:**

The `viewModel()` function should be recognized and I should be able to access my `MyViewModel` instance.

**Actual behavior:**

Android Studio highlights `viewModel` with the error "Unresolved reference: viewModel".

I've tried cleaning and rebuilding the project, invalidating caches and restarting Android Studio, but the issue remains. What could be causing this issue and how can I resolve it?

Title: How can I change the text using the new ContentChild signal API?
Title_Body:
<<How can I change the text using the new ContentChild signal API?>>
<<I'm trying to migrate my Angular component to use the new ContentChild signal API, but I'm encountering some TypeScript issues.
Here's my existing code using the traditional @ContentChild decorator:
// child-component.ts
import { Component, ContentChild, ElementRef, AfterContentInit } from '@angular/core';

@Component({
  selector: 'app-child',
  templateUrl: './child-component.html',
})
export class ChildComponent implements AfterContentInit {
  @ContentChild('headerTitle', { static: true }) headerTitleContent!: ElementRef; // Access projected title
  @ContentChild('headerSubtitle', { static: true }) headerSubtitleContent!: ElementRef; // Access projected subtitle
  @ContentChild('navbar') navTitle!: ElementRef; // Access navbar

  constructor() {
    console.log(this.headerTitleContent); // Access title element
  }

  ngAfterContentInit() {
    this.headerSubtitleContent.nativeElement.textContent = 'Enjoy a customized experience!';
  }
}

I want to achieve the same functionality using the new ContentChild signal API as follows:
import { Component } from '@angular/core';
import { contentChild, effect } from '@angular/core';

@Component({
  selector: 'app-child',
  templateUrl: './child-component.html',
})
export class ChildComponent {
  private headerTitleContent = contentChild<ElementRef<HTMLAnchorElement>>('headerTitle');
  private headerSubtitleContent = contentChild<ElementRef<HTMLAnchorElement>>('headerSubtitle');
  private navTitle = contentChild<ElementRef<HTMLElement>>('navbar');

  constructor() {
    console.log(this.headerTitleContent); // Access title element
    effect(() => {
      if (this.headerSubtitleContent()) {
        this.headerSubtitleContent().nativeElement.textContent = 'HI this is my name'; // Issue occurs here
      }
    });
  }
}

ISSUE
The left-hand side of an assignment expression may not be an optional property access.

>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Angular - How to access and modify element text content after view initialization?
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<Angular - How to access and modify element text content after view initialization?>>
<<## Angular AfterContentInit not updating textContent

I'm trying to update the `textContent` of an element inside `ngAfterContentInit` but it's not working. The element is correctly retrieved, but the text doesn't change.

Here's the relevant code:

```typescript
export class ContentComponent implements AfterContentInit {
  // ...

  ngAfterContentInit() {
    if(this.headerSubtitleContent()){
      this.headerSubtitleContent()?.nativeElement.textContent = 'Enjoy a customized experience!';
    }
  }
}
```

**Expected behavior:** The `textContent` of the element should be updated to "Enjoy a customized experience!".

**Actual behavior:** The `textContent` remains unchanged.

I've verified that `this.headerSubtitleContent()` returns the correct element. I've also tried using `innerText` instead of `textContent`, but that didn't work either.

What am I doing wrong?>>

Here's the relevant code:

```typescript
export class ContentComponent implements AfterContentInit {
  @ContentChild('headerSubtitle') headerSubtitleContent: ElementRef;

  constructor() {
    console.log(this.headerSubtitleContent); // This logs the element correctly
  }

  ngAfterContentInit() {
    if (this.headerSubtitleContent) {
      this.headerSubtitleContent.nativeElement.textContent = 'Enjoy a customized experience!';
    }
  }
}
```

I've verified that `headerSubtitleContent` is correctly referencing the element, and I'm accessing `nativeElement` before updating `textContent`. I've also tried using `innerText` instead of `textContent`, but the result is the same.

What am I missing here? Why isn't the text content being updated?>>

Title: Private variables giving the warning not in use try removing the variable
Title_Body:
<<Private variables giving the warning not in use try removing the variable>>
<<I recently started learning Dart and come accross this warning in Dart pad. I don't why this warning is thrown. Can any body explain what is going on here.

I didn't expected the warning as the _name variable is in use in the constructer for setting tbe value.
Code:
void main() { 
  final ani = Animal('Tiger', 23);
 ani.setName = 'Tiggerr';
}

class Animal {
  String _name;
  final int age;

  Animal(this._name, this.age) {
    print('hello from constructer');
  }
  
  set setName(String newName){
    _name = newName;
  }
}


>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Dart: The value of the field '_name' isn't used. How to fix this warning?
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<Dart: The value of the field '_name' isn't used. How to fix this warning?>>
<<## Dart: Unused private field warning, but I am using it in the constructor

I'm getting a warning in DartPad about an unused private field `_name`, even though I'm using it in the constructor of my `Animal` class. I'm trying to understand why this warning appears and how to resolve it.

Here's my code:

```dart
void main() {
  final ani = Animal('Tiger', 23);
  ani.setName = 'Tiggerr';
}

class Animal {
  String _name;
  final int age;

  Animal(this._name, this.age) {
    print('hello from constructor');
  }

  set setName(String newName) {
    _name = newName;
  }
}
```

The warning message I see is:

> The value of the field '_name' isn't used.
> Try removing the field, or using it.

I am using `_name` in the constructor to initialize the object. Why am I getting this warning, and how can I fix it?>>

<<I'm working on a simple Dart class in DartPad and getting a warning about an unused field. Here's my code:

```dart
void main() {
  final ani = Animal('Tiger', 23);
  ani.setName = 'Tiggerr';
}

class Animal {
  String _name;
  final int age;

  Animal(this._name, this.age) {
    print('hello from constructer');
  }

  set setName(String newName) {
    _name = newName;
  }
}
```

DartPad gives me the following warning:

> The value of the field '_name' isn't used.
> Try removing the field, or using it.

I understand that the `_name` field is declared but never directly accessed after it's assigned in the constructor. However, I am using a setter method `setName` to modify it. 

Shouldn't the setter count as "using" the field? How can I resolve this warning without removing the `_name` field?>>

Title: Fullcalendar Angular. How is the eventContent Angular template actually rendered in FullCalendar?
Body:
Fullcalendar supports an eventContent and numerous other callbacks letting us to define custom templates for event UI and etc...
There is a wrapper library called @fullcalendar/angular, it provides a way to define custom event template in angular style and it renders into the correct spot the calendar.
<full-calendar [options]="calendarOptions()">
  <ng-template #eventContent let-arg>
    I am an event with {{ binding }} and {{ arg.event.title }}
  </ng-template>
</full-calendar>

My question: How actually this library makes it work? Fullcalendar in a nutshell is just a javascript library and I expect there is somewhere eventContent callback is called and this library does a trick by taking the template and creating a DOM element out of it. Can you tell me what technique is used for that? I can rephrase a question: how to dynamically generate a DOM Element, a template of which is managed by Angular. I even fine if change detection will not work automatically (it probably won't).
I pulled a source repo and it's content is very strange to me. I see how the eventContent is read from @contentChildren but nothing happens with it after.

<<Fullcalendar Angular. How is the eventContent Angular template actually rendered in FullCalendar?>>
<<Fullcalendar supports an eventContent and numerous other callbacks letting us to define custom templates for event UI and etc...
There is a wrapper library called @fullcalendar/angular, it provides a way to define custom event template in angular style and it renders into the correct spot the calendar.
<full-calendar [options]="calendarOptions()">
  <ng-template #eventContent let-arg>
    I am an event with {{ binding }} and {{ arg.event.title }}
  </ng-template>
</full-calendar>

My question: How actually this library makes it work? Fullcalendar in a nutshell is just a javascript library and I expect there is somewhere eventContent callback is called and this library does a trick by taking the template and creating a DOM element out of it. Can you tell me what technique is used for that? I can rephrase a question: how to dynamically generate a DOM Element, a template of which is managed by Angular. I even fine if change detection will not work automatically (it probably won't).
I pulled a source repo and it's content is very strange to me. I see how the eventContent is read from @contentChildren but nothing happens with it after.

>>

Title: electron-updater stops on checking for update
Body:
I'm using electron-updater 6.3.
It works fine for auto updates on Windows and Mac but I have this one Mac user who is sometimes have issues. Specifically when there are no updates available.
In that case I can see from logging out that electron-updater only get to this point (see attached screenshot).
It only gets to "Checking for update". It never reaches the "update-not-available" event.
I don't get any errors either.
I'm using Github releases. I know I'm not giving much information here but does anyone know common reasons why this would happen?

llm_zero_shot_title: Electron AppUpdater - How to prevent multiple concurrent update checks?
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<Electron AppUpdater - How to prevent multiple concurrent update checks?>>
<<## Electron AppUpdater - Subsequent Update Checks Fail Silently

I'm using `electron-updater` in my Electron app to handle automatic updates. The first time `checkForUpdates()` is called, it works as expected. However, if an update check is already in progress and `checkForUpdates()` is called again, subsequent calls seem to fail silently. 

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```typescript
 checkForUpdates(): Promise<UpdateCheckResult | null> {
    return Promise.resolve(null)
  }

  let checkForUpdatesPromise = this.checkForUpdatesPromise
  if (checkForUpdatesPromise != null) {
    this._logger.info("Checking for update (already in progress)")
    return checkForUpdatesPromise
  }

  const nullizePromise = () => (this.checkForUpdatesPromise = null)

  this._logger.info("Checking for update")
  checkForUpdatesPromise = this.doCheckForUpdates()
    .then(it => {
      nullizePromise()
      return it
    })
    .catch((e: any) => {
      nullizePromise()
      this.emit("error", e, `Cannot check for updates: ${(e.stack || e).toString()}`)
      throw e
    })
```

**Expected Behavior:**

If an update check is already in progress, subsequent calls to `checkForUpdates()` should either:

1. Return the existing `checkForUpdatesPromise` and resolve/reject with the result of the ongoing check.
2. Queue the update check and execute it after the current one completes.

**Actual Behavior:**

Subsequent calls to `checkForUpdates()` appear to fail silently. The `checkForUpdatesPromise` is not updated, and no errors are thrown.

**Question:**

How can I modify my code to ensure that subsequent calls to `checkForUpdates()` are handled correctly, either by returning the existing promise or queuing the update check?>>

This could indicate an issue with the initialization or scope of the object containing this property.>>
llm_cot_title: Electron-Updater: Cannot check for updates - TypeError: this.doCheckForUpdates is not a function
llm_cot_combined:
<<Electron-Updater: Cannot check for updates - TypeError: this.doCheckForUpdates is not a function>>
<<I'm experiencing an issue with `electron-builder`'s auto-update functionality where the `checkForUpdates()` method seems to be getting stuck. The relevant code snippet from `AppUpdater.ts` is shown below:

```typescript
checkForUpdates(): Promise<UpdateCheckResult | null> {
  return Promise.resolve(null)
}

let checkForUpdatesPromise = this.checkForUpdatesPromise
if (checkForUpdatesPromise != null) {
  this._logger.info("Checking for update (already in progress)")
  return checkForUpdatesPromise
}

const nullizePromise = () => (this.checkForUpdatesPromise = null)
this._logger.info("Checking for update")
checkForUpdatesPromise = this.doCheckForUpdates()
  .then(it => {
    nullizePromise()
    return it
  })
  .catch((e: any) => {
    nullizePromise()
    this.emit("error", e, `Cannot check for updates: ${(e.stack || e).toString()}`)
    throw e
  })
```

The `checkForUpdatesPromise` is set but never seems to resolve or reject, causing subsequent update checks to be skipped. I've verified that `doCheckForUpdates()` is being called, but it's unclear why the promise isn't being resolved.

I've tried searching through the `electron-builder` documentation and issues, but haven't found any solutions. Any help in understanding why this might be happening and how to resolve it would be greatly appreciated.>>

Title: OpenAPI generates AdditionalProperties field twice
Body:
I am generating Swagger client via the OpenAPI but getting an error for additionalProperties as it was defined twice.
The json schema was generated from FastEndpoints project, I tried to add schema filter configuration to disallow the AdditionalPropertiesAllowed - yet no luck.
I'm trying to understand how do we configure the additionalProperties to appear only once in the json schema:

UPDATE:
The issue that I encountered on the generated json schema with additionalProperties defined twice is when I try to generate a CSharpClient through json the client throws an error with
additionalProperties defined twice in the model.

llm_zero_shot_title: Infinite recursion in object schema with "additionalProperties" referencing itself
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<Infinite recursion in object schema with "additionalProperties" referencing itself>>
<<## Infinite Recursion in JSON Schema Definition

I'm trying to define a JSON schema for my data model, but I'm running into an issue with what seems like infinite recursion. Here's the relevant part of my schema:

```json
"MyModel": {
  "type": "object",
  "additionalProperties": {
    "nullable": true
  },
  "properties": {
    "cashFlows": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "$ref": "#/components/schemas/Model1"
      }
    },
    "additionalProperties": {
      "type": "object",
      "nullable": true,
      "additionalProperties": {}
    }
  }
}
```

As you can see, within the definition of `"additionalProperties"`, I'm again defining `"additionalProperties"`. This seems to be causing an issue, likely leading to infinite recursion. 

**Expected Behavior:** I want to allow any additional properties within the `"additionalProperties"` object.

**Actual Behavior:** I'm encountering errors (mention specific errors if any) related to the schema definition, and I suspect this recursive structure is the culprit.

How can I correctly define `"additionalProperties"` within my schema without running into this recursion problem?>>

Title: Get VSCode to recognize aliases
Title_Body:
<<Get VSCode to recognize aliases>>
<<Ok, so I built an app with Vite and React. I added some aliases to make things easier to read, it works, but VSC is dumb and doesn't pick up on the aliases, which also means it has trouble inferring types and so on.
It's especially dumb since, for instance, @store gets highlighted as being a problem, but @store/index works perfectly. What am I doing wrong here?!
/* vite.config.ts */

import { defineConfig } from "vite";
import react from "@vitejs/plugin-react";
import path from "path";

export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [react()],

  resolve: {
    alias: {
      "@": path.resolve(__dirname, "./src"),
      "@assets": path.resolve(__dirname, "./src/assets"),
      "@core": path.resolve(__dirname, "./src/core"),
      "@store": path.resolve(__dirname, "./src/core/store"),
      "@user": path.resolve(__dirname, "./src/user"),
    },
  },
});

/* tsconfig.app.json */ 

{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "ES2020",
    "useDefineForClassFields": true,
    "lib": ["ES2020", "DOM", "DOM.Iterable"],
    "module": "ESNext",
    "skipLibCheck": true,

    /* Bundler mode */
    "moduleResolution": "bundler",
    "allowImportingTsExtensions": true,
    "isolatedModules": true,
    "moduleDetection": "force",
    "noEmit": true,
    "jsx": "react-jsx",

    /* Linting */
    "strict": true,
    "noUnusedLocals": true,
    "noUnusedParameters": true,
    "noFallthroughCasesInSwitch": true,

    "baseUrl": "./src",
    "paths": {
      "@/*": ["*"],
      "@assets/*": ["assets/*"],
      "@core/*": ["core/*"],
      "@store/*": ["core/store/*"],
      "@user/*": ["user/*"]
    }
  },
  "include": ["src/**/*"]
}

Again, it works, it does compile and run, and I didn't even have to add the aliases to the tsconfig file - which makes sense, I hate having to add it to 2 separate places anyway. But VSCode is still being dumb...

>>

Title: LangGraph Error - Invalid Tool Calls when using AzureChatOpenAI
Body:
I'm following the LangGraph tutorial (from LangGraph) and I'm getting an error when switching from "ChatOpenAI" to "AzureChatOpenAI". This is the code example from the website:
from langchain_openai import AzureChatOpenAI
from dotenv import find_dotenv, load_dotenv
import os

from langgraph.graph import MessagesState
from langchain_core.messages import HumanMessage, SystemMessage

from langgraph.graph import START, StateGraph
from langgraph.prebuilt import tools_condition
from langgraph.prebuilt import ToolNode
from IPython.display import Image, display

load_dotenv(find_dotenv(), override=True)
  

This is the only change I've done, I've modified how to initialize the LLM (I am using AzureChatOpen AI) instead of ChatOpenAI 4o model.
llm = AzureChatOpenAI(
                openai_api_version=os.getenv("OPENAI_API_VERSION"),
                azure_deployment=os.getenv("DEPLOYMENT_NAME"),
                azure_endpoint=os.getenv("AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT"), 
                temperature=0,
            )

Then the remain code:
def multiply(a: int, b: int) -> int:
    """Multiply a and b.

    Args:
        a: first int
        b: second int
    """
    return a * b

def add(a: int, b: int) -> int:
    """Adds a and b.

    Args:
        a: first int
        b: second int
    """
    return a + b
      

tools = [add, multiply]

llm_with_tools = llm.bind_tools(tools)


sys_msg = SystemMessage(content="You are a helpful assistant tasked with performing arithmetic on a set of inputs.")

def assistant(state: MessagesState):
   return {"messages": [llm_with_tools.invoke([sys_msg] + state["messages"])]}

# Graph
builder = StateGraph(MessagesState)

builder.add_node("assistant", assistant)
builder.add_node("tools", ToolNode(tools))

builder.add_edge(START, "assistant")
builder.add_conditional_edges(
    "assistant",
    tools_condition,
)
builder.add_edge("tools", "assistant")
react_graph = builder.compile()

And this is the call (how to reproduce the error):
messages = [HumanMessage(content="Add 3 and 4. Multiply the output by 2. Using the local tool")]

messages = react_graph.invoke({"messages": messages})

print the result:
for m in messages['messages']:
    m.pretty_print()

And this is the error I get:

llm_zero_shot_title: **JSONDecodeError: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0) when calling local tool function**
llm_zero_shot_body:
**Invalid Tool Calls and JSONDecodeError When Using Local Tool**

I am trying to use a local tool to perform a simple calculation, but I am encountering "Invalid Tool Calls" and "JSONDecodeError" errors.

**Code:**

```javascript
const { add, multiply } = require('./local_tool');

const result = multiply({ a: add({ a: 3, b: 4 }), b: 2 });

console.log(result);
```

**Error Message:**

```
Invalid Tool Calls:
python (call_dIYlTQhlfwAkyR3Y7UuIZIvP)
Call ID: call_dIYlTQhlfwAkyR3Y7UuIZIvP
Error: Function python arguments:
...
are not valid JSON. Received JSONDecodeError Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)
Args:
...
```

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect the code to:

1. Use the `add` function from `local_tool` to add 3 and 4.
2. Use the `multiply` function from `local_tool` to multiply the sum (7) by 2.
3. Log the final result (14) to the console.

**Actual Behavior:**

Instead, I am getting the "Invalid Tool Calls" and "JSONDecodeError" errors shown above.

**Troubleshooting Steps Taken:**

* I have verified that the `local_tool` file exists and is accessible.
* I have checked the syntax of my JSON objects.

I am unsure why the function arguments are not being recognized as valid JSON. Any help in resolving this issue would be greatly appreciated.

<<JSONDecodeError: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0) when calling local tool in JavaScript>>
<<I'm trying to use a local tool in my JavaScript code that performs addition and multiplication. I'm getting a "JSONDecodeError: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)" error, and I'm not sure why.

Here's my code:

```javascript
const { add, multiply } = require('./local_tool');

const result = multiply({ a: add({ a: 3, b: 4 }), b: 2 });

console.log(result);
```

The `local_tool.js` file contains the following functions:

```javascript
function add(a, b) {
  return a + b;
}

function multiply(a, b) {
  return a * b;
}

module.exports = { add, multiply };
```

I've tried logging the output of `add({ a: 3, b: 4 })`, and it seems to be returning the correct value (7). However, when I try to pass this value to the `multiply` function, I get the JSONDecodeError.

I'm not sure what's causing this error. I've checked the documentation for `JSON.parse()`, but I'm not using that function directly. I've also tried stringifying the output of `add()` before passing it to `multiply()`, but that didn't work either.

Any help would be greatly appreciated!>>

llm_zero_shot_title: React - Maximum call stack size exceeded error with Array.forEach and useChart.js component
llm_zero_shot_body:
## React app throwing "Maximum call stack size exceeded" error with useChart.js

I'm working on a React application that uses the `useChart.js` library for charting. Everything was working fine, but now I'm getting a "Maximum call stack size exceeded" error in the console whenever I try to render a chart.

Here's the error message:

```
Uncaught runtime errors:
ERROR
Maximum call stack size exceeded
RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
at http://localhost:3002/soft/static/js/bundle.js:175873:27
at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
at processConfig (http://localhost:3002/soft/static/js/bundle.js:175873:10)
at http://localhost:3002/soft/static/js/bundle.js:175892:11
at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
at processConfig (http://localhost:3002/soft/static/js/bundle.js:175873:10)
at http://localhost:3002/soft/static/js/bundle.js:175892:11
at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
at processConfig (http://localhost:3002/soft/static/js/bundle.js:175873:10)
at http://localhost:3002/soft/static/js/bundle.js:175892:11
// ... (similar stack trace repeats)
```

The error seems to originate from within the `useChart.js` library itself, specifically in the `processConfig` function. I've tried searching for solutions online, but haven't found anything that directly addresses this issue.

**Expected behavior:** The chart should render correctly without any errors.

**Actual behavior:** The app crashes with the "Maximum call stack size exceeded" error.

I'm not sure what's causing this infinite loop or how to fix it. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

llm_cot_title: React - Maximum call stack size exceeded error with useChart.js and Array.forEach loop during configuration processing
llm_cot_body:
I'm encountering a "Maximum call stack size exceeded" error in my React application, specifically originating from the `useChart.js` file. The error points to a line within a `processConfig` function that seems to be stuck in a recursive loop involving `Array.forEach`.

Here's the error message:

```
Uncaught runtime errors:
ERROR
Maximum call stack size exceeded
RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
at http://localhost:3002/soft/static/js/bundle.js:175873:27
at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
at processConfig (http://localhost:3002/soft/static/js/bundle.js:175873:10)
at http://localhost:3002/soft/static/js/bundle.js:175892:11
at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
at processConfig (http://localhost:3002/soft/static/js/bundle.js:175873:10)
...
```

The error log shows a repeating pattern of calls to `Array.forEach`, `processConfig`, and `useChart.js`. I suspect there might be a circular dependency or an unintended recursive call within these functions.

I've tried reviewing the `useChart.js` file and the related components, but I haven't been able to pinpoint the exact source of the infinite loop. 

Could anyone provide insights into how to debug and resolve this "Maximum call stack size exceeded" error in the context of chart rendering? Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Title: Which setting autocompletes python code in VSCode
Body:
Vscode autocompletes my python code: for instance, the super.__init__() call (see image below).
However I was not able to find which extension or setting handles this.
My first guess was that pylance is the extension that does this, however i could not find it in its settings.
My colleagues would like to have the same functionality.

llm_zero_shot_title: TypeError: __init__() takes 3 positional arguments but 4 were given when calling super().__init__() in Python
llm_zero_shot_body:
I'm getting a syntax error in my Python code when trying to define the `__init__` method of a subclass. The error seems to be related to the `super()` call.

Here's the code snippet:

```python
class MyClass(ParentClass):
    def __init__(self, id: int, name: str) -> None:
        super().__init__(id, name)
```

I'm trying to initialize the parent class (`ParentClass`) with the `id` and `name` arguments. I'm using the `super()` function to call the parent class's `__init__` method.

**Expected behavior:**
The code should compile and run without errors, properly initializing the parent class.

**Actual behavior:**
I'm getting a syntax error highlighted under the `name` argument in the `super().__init__` call.

I've double-checked that the parent class (`ParentClass`) exists and has an `__init__` method that accepts `id` and `name` arguments. I'm not sure what's causing this syntax error. Any help would be appreciated!

Title: Azure DevOps. Can't trigger a pipeline in Repo A when a commit is done in repo B
Body:
I’m using Version Dev17.M153.5 (TFS), and I have two repositories: my source code is hosted in Repo B, and my pipelines are hosted in Repo A to keep responsibilities separated.
My goal is for the pipeline in Repo A to automatically run whenever a commit is pushed to Repo B. Below is my current setup:
# MY MAIN PIPELINE IN REPO A:
trigger: none
resources:
  repositories:
    - repository: RepoB
      type: git
      name: Project/RepoB
      ref: develop
      trigger:
        branches:
          include:
            - develop
            - master

pool:
  name: 'Test'

variables:
  REPO_URL: 'https://tfs.company.com/company/Project/_git/RepoB'

steps:
  - task: PowerShell@2
    displayName: 'Configurar encabezado GIT_AUTH_HEADER con PAT'
    inputs:
      targetType: 'inline'
      script: |
        # Crear el encabezado de autenticación en formato Base64
        $headerValue = "Authorization: Basic " + [Convert]::ToBase64String([System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes(":" + $env:PAT))

        git -c http.extraheader="$headerValue" clone $(REPO_URL)
    env:
      PAT: $(PAT)  # El PAT como variable de entorno secreta

    #Templates
  - ${{ if eq(variables['Build.SourceBranch'], 'refs/heads/master') }}:
    - template: pipeline-master.yml

  - ${{ if eq(variables['Build.SourceBranch'], 'refs/heads/develop') }}:
    - template: pipeline-develop.yml

The Issue:
This pipeline does not trigger automatically when a commit is pushed to Repo B on either develop or master. I cannot use checkout because it only accepts self or none. However, Repo B is successfully cloned, and the pipeline runs fine if I trigger it manually
Additional Considerations:

Build services have "Read and Contribute" permissions set to "Allow" in both repositories.
Both Repo A and Repo B are part of the same project.
The Personal Access Token (PAT) is correctly configured, and the pipeline passes when executed manually.


Question:
Why is the pipeline not triggering automatically, and how can I ensure it runs whenever a commit is pushed to Repo B?
Update
I have read many posts warning about compiling the YAML file in the default branch. I am compiling it in master, which is my default branch, and still doesn't work
Many thanks in advance!

llm_zero_shot_title: Azure DevOps Pipeline Validation Error - Checkout of Repository Not Supported
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Azure DevOps Pipeline Error: Checkout of repository not supported

I am trying to set up an Azure DevOps pipeline with multiple checkout steps, but I am getting the following error:

> Could not queue the build because there were validation errors or warnings. Checkout of repository [Redacted Repository Name] is not supported. Only 'self' and 'none' are supported. Checkout of multiple repositories is not supported.

Here is my `azure-pipelines.yml` file:

```yaml
trigger: none

resources:
  repositories:
  - repository: [Redacted Repository Name]
    type: git
    name: [Redacted Repository Name]
    ref: develop
    trigger: 
      branches:
        include:
        - develop
        - master

pool:
  name: 'Test'

variables:
  ArtifactName: 'drop'
  JSON_EXISTS: false
  REPO_URL: [Redacted URL]

steps:
  - checkout: self
  - checkout: [Redacted Repository Name] 

```

**Expected behavior:**

I expect the pipeline to checkout both the self repository and the repository specified in the second checkout step.

**Actual behavior:**

The pipeline fails validation with the error message above.

**What I have tried:**

- I have confirmed that the repository name and ref are correct.
- I have tried using different checkout syntax, such as `checkout: git://[Repository URL]` but I get the same error.

How can I checkout multiple repositories in an Azure DevOps pipeline?

llm_few_shot_title: Azure DevOps Pipeline Fails: Multiple Repositories Checkout Not Supported
llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to create a pipeline in Azure DevOps that will trigger on changes to the `develop` branch. However, when I try to queue the build, I get an error message that says "Could not queue the build because there were validation errors or warnings. Checkout of multiple repositories is not supported." The pipeline only checks out a single repository, so I'm not sure why I'm getting this error.

The most important part of the error message is "Checkout of multiple repositories is not supported." This indicates that there is something in my pipeline definition that is causing Azure DevOps to think that I am trying to check out multiple repositories.

llm_cot_title: Azure Pipelines: Checkout of repository is not supported when checking out multiple repositories
llm_cot_body:
I am trying to set up an Azure DevOps pipeline to build and deploy my code. I have multiple repositories that I need to access in my pipeline. However, when I try to run the pipeline, I get the following error:

```
Could not queue the build because there were validation errors or warnings. Checkout of repository [Repository Name] is not supported. Only 'self' and 'none' are supported. Checkout of multiple repositories is not supported.
```

My `azure-pipelines.yml` file looks like this:

```yaml
trigger: none

resources:
  repositories:
  - repository: [Repository Name]
    type: git
    name: [Repository Name]
    ref: develop
    trigger: 
      branches:
        include:
        - develop
        - master

pool:
  name: 'Test'

variables:
  ArtifactName: 'drop'
  JSON_EXISTS: false
  REPO_URL: [Repository URL]

steps:
  - checkout: self
  - checkout: [Repository Name] 
```

I have tried using both the repository name and the repository URL in the `checkout` step, but neither of them worked. I have also tried setting the `checkout` step to `none`, but that also did not work.

How can I checkout multiple repositories in my Azure DevOps pipeline?
