All endpoints worked only delete endpoints not working. I'm working on Base Entity for my code readability:
package com.cloud.atlas.base.entity;

import lombok.Data;
import lombok.EqualsAndHashCode;
import lombok.NoArgsConstructor;
import lombok.ToString;
import lombok.experimental.SuperBuilder;

import org.springframework.data.annotation.CreatedBy;
import org.springframework.data.annotation.CreatedDate;
import org.springframework.data.annotation.LastModifiedBy;
import org.springframework.data.annotation.LastModifiedDate;
import org.springframework.data.jpa.domain.support.AuditingEntityListener;

import javax.persistence.*;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDateTime;

@SuperBuilder
@EntityListeners({ AuditingEntityListener.class })
@Data
@EqualsAndHashCode
@NoArgsConstructor
@ToString
@MappedSuperclass
public abstract class BaseEntity implements Serializable {
    @Id
    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.AUTO)
    @Column(name = "id", length = 50)
    protected Long id;

    @CreatedDate
    @Column(name = "created_at")
    protected LocalDateTime createdAt;

    @LastModifiedDate
    @Column(name = "updated_at")
    protected LocalDateTime updatedAt;

    @Column(name = "deleted_at")
    protected LocalDateTime deletedAt;

    @Column(name = "is_active", nullable = false)
    private boolean isActive = true;

    @Column(name = "is_deleted", nullable = false)
    private boolean isDeleted = false;

    @CreatedBy
    @Column(name = "created_by")
    private String createdBy;

    @LastModifiedBy
    @Column(name = "updated_by")
    private String updatedBy;

    @Version
    @Column(name = "version")
    private Long version;

    @PrePersist
    public void onCreate() {
        this.createdAt = LocalDateTime.now();
        this.updatedAt = LocalDateTime.now();
    }

    @PreUpdate
    public void onUpdate() {
        this.updatedAt = LocalDateTime.now();
    }

    public abstract <T extends BaseEntity> void update(T entity);
}

And Permission model:
@EqualsAndHashCode(callSuper = false)
@NoArgsConstructor
@AllArgsConstructor
@Getter
@Setter
@Entity
@Table(name = "permission")
@SQLDelete(sql = "UPDATE permission SET is_deleted = true WHERE id=?")
@Where(clause = "is_deleted=false")
public class Permission  extends BaseEntity {

    @Column(nullable = false)
    private String alias;
    @Column
    private String author;

    @Column
    private String title;
    @Column
    private String description;

    @Column
    private Integer status;

    @Override
    public <T extends BaseEntity> void update(T entity) {
        Permission permission = (Permission) entity;
        this.alias = permission.alias;
        this.title = permission.title;
        this.description = permission.description;
        this.status = permission.status;
        this.author = permission.author;
    }
}

nput: [100]
output: could not delete: [com.cloud.atlas.domain.Permission#100]; SQL [UPDATE permission SET is_deleted = true WHERE id=?]; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.DataException: could not delete: [com.cloud.atlas.domain.Permission#100]
2024-10-03 10:33:16.710 ERROR 22188 --- [nio-9060-exec-3] GLOBAL_EXCEPTION_HANDLER                 : An error occurred

org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: could not delete: [com.cloud.atlas.domain.Permission#100]; SQL [UPDATE permission SET is_deleted = true WHERE id=?]; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.DataException: could not delete: [com.cloud.atlas.domain.Permission#100]

When I researched this problem, the solution says if you are using a nullable command you need to use a length like this: @Column(nullable = false, length = 4096) and this does not solve my problem.
Wrong but If I can't solve I'm gonna add a Soft Delete endpoint with PUT annotation and just update is_deleted part to true.
Thank you for your help!
Edit: When I delete these lines problem is solved but delete is not soft anymore:
@SQLDelete(sql = "UPDATE permission SET is_deleted = true WHERE id=?")
@Where(clause = "is_deleted=false")

llm_zero_shot_title: Spring Boot DataIntegrityViolationException When Deleting Permission: Could not delete: SQL [UPDATE permission SET is_deleted = true WHERE id=?]
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<Spring Boot DataIntegrityViolationException When Deleting Permission: Could not delete: SQL [UPDATE permission SET is_deleted = true WHERE id=?]>>
<<## Spring Boot DELETE request throws DataIntegrityViolationException: could not delete

I'm working on a Spring Boot application and I'm having trouble deleting an entity. When I send a DELETE request to `/api/v1/permission/{id}`, I get a 500 Internal Server Error with the following stack trace:

```
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: could not delete: [com.cloud.atlas.domain.Permission#100]; SQL [UPDATE permission SET is_deleted = true WHERE id=?];
nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.DataException: could not delete: [com.cloud.atlas.domain.Permission#100]
...
```

It seems like a database constraint is preventing the deletion. However, I've checked my database schema and I can't find any foreign key constraints referencing the `Permission` table. 

**Here's what I've tried:**

* I've verified that the `id` exists in the database.
* I've checked for any cascading constraints on the `Permission` entity.
* I've tried manually deleting the entity through a SQL client, but I get the same error.

**Here's the relevant code:**

* **Controller:**

```java
@DeleteMapping("/{id}")
public ResponseEntity<Void> deletePermission(@PathVariable Long id) {
    permissionService.delete(id);
    return ResponseEntity.noContent().build();
}
```

* **Service:**

```java
public void delete(Long id) {
    permissionRepository.deleteById(id);
}
```

* **Repository:**

```java
public interface PermissionRepository extends JpaRepository<Permission, Long> {
}
```

I'm using Spring Boot 2.x and Hibernate. Any ideas on what might be causing this issue and how to resolve it?>>
llm_few_shot_title: Spring Boot DataIntegrityViolationException When Deleting Permission with ID 100
llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to send a DELETE request to `/api/v1/permission/{id}` to delete a permission with ID 100. However, I am getting a 500 Internal Server Error with `org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException` stating that the permission cannot be deleted. The error message says "could not delete; [constraint][cloud.alias.domain.Permission]". What could be causing this issue and how can I resolve it? 

The most important part of the error is the `DataIntegrityViolationException` and the message "could not delete; [constraint][cloud.alias.domain.Permission]". This suggests there might be a database constraint preventing the deletion of the permission, possibly a foreign key constraint from another table referencing this permission.

llm_cot_title: Spring DataIntegrityViolationException: could not delete entity due to foreign key constraint
llm_cot_combined:
<<Spring DataIntegrityViolationException: could not delete entity due to foreign key constraint>>
<<I am trying to delete a permission with ID 100 via a DELETE request to `/api/v1/permission/{id}` endpoint in my Spring Boot application. However, I am encountering a `DataIntegrityViolationException` with the message "could not delete: [com.cloud.atlas.domain.Permission#100]; SQL [UPDATE permission SET is_deleted = true WHERE id=?];".

It seems like there might be a constraint violation preventing the deletion. I have checked the database and confirmed that the permission with ID 100 exists. I have also verified that no other tables have a foreign key constraint referencing this permission.

I am using Spring Boot with Hibernate. Below is the relevant code snippet:

```java
// Service method for deleting permission
@Transactional
public void delete(Long id) {
    permissionRepository.deleteById(id);
}
```

I have tried debugging the application and found that the exception is thrown during the `permissionRepository.deleteById(id)` call. I have also tried manually deleting the permission directly in the database, but it also resulted in a similar constraint violation error.

I have searched for solutions online but couldn't find any that address this specific issue. Any help in understanding the root cause of this error and how to resolve it would be greatly appreciated.>>

Title: how to use formatjs plugin in rspack's swc loader
Title_Body:
<<how to use formatjs plugin in rspack's swc loader>>
<<Recently I migrated a application from webpack to rspack.
Previously we were using babel-loader to transpile. Now we decided to use rspack's builtin swc-loader.
We are using formatjs for intl support.
here is the swc-loader configuration for rspack
const js = {
  test: /\.js(x)?$/,
  exclude: [
    /node_modules/,
    path.join(config.root, config.paths.src, 'web', 'javascripts/vendors/'),
  ],
  loader: 'builtin:swc-loader',
  options: {
    jsc: {
      parser: {
        syntax: 'ecmascript',
        jsx: true,
      },
      transform: {
        react: {
          runtime: 'automatic',
          development: config.env === 'production',
          refresh: config.env === 'production',
        },
      },
      experimental: {
        plugins: [
          [
            '@formatjs/swc-plugin',
            {
              overrideIdFn: '[sha512:contenthash:base64:6]',
              ast: true,
            },
          ],
        ],
      },
    },
    type: 'javascript/auto',
    env: {
      targets: 'Chrome >= 48',
    },
  },
};

And here is the build error I am facing after using the formatjs plugin:

For reference, here is the explanation for the formatjs plugin
https://formatjs.io/docs/tooling/swc-plugin/
How can I use the formatjs plugin with rspack and swc loader?
>>

llm_zero_shot_body:
## WebAssembly translation error: Error when converting wat: expected `(`

I'm trying to build a project that uses WebAssembly, but I'm getting the following error:

```
ERROR in ./web/javascripts/christmas/index.js
× Module build failed:
× Cannot compile plugin binary
WebAssembly translation error: Error when converting wat: expected `(`
--> <anon>:1:1
1 "use strict";
```

I'm not sure what this error means or how to fix it. The error message seems to indicate that there's a syntax error in my WebAssembly code, but I can't see anything wrong with the line it's pointing to (`"use strict";`).

**Here's what I've tried:**

* I've double-checked the syntax of my WebAssembly code, and I can't find any errors.

Title: Custom-shaped and borderless window in Avalonia UI
Body:
I need to make a custom window in Avalonia UI, free of any OS decorations (Windows 11 in this case). So far I was able to find a bunch of properties that made the window completely transparent, but the border and the shadow won't go away.
So, how can I leave just the green circle and get rid of the rectangular border and its shadow?

Here's copyable XAML for convenience.
<Window xmlns="https://github.com/avaloniaui"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        mc:Ignorable="d" d:DesignWidth="800" d:DesignHeight="450"
        x:Class="avava.MainWindow"
        Width="200"
        Height="200"
        WindowStartupLocation="CenterScreen"
        Background="Transparent"
        TransparencyBackgroundFallback="Transparent"
        ExtendClientAreaToDecorationsHint="True"
        ExtendClientAreaChromeHints="NoChrome"
        ExtendClientAreaTitleBarHeightHint="-1"
        SystemDecorations="None"
        BorderBrush="Transparent"
        BorderThickness="0">
    <Ellipse Fill="Green" Opacity="0.5" Width="150" Height="150" StrokeThickness="10" Stroke="Blue"/>
</Window>

So, how can I leave just the green circle and get rid of the rectangular border and its shadow?

Here's copyable XAML for convenience.
<Window xmlns="https://github.com/avaloniaui"

        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        mc:Ignorable="d" d:DesignWidth="800" d:DesignHeight="450"
        x:Class="avava.MainWindow"
        Width="200"
        Height="200"
        WindowStartupLocation="CenterScreen"
        Background="Transparent"

</Window>

llm_cot_title: How to Create a Transparent Window with Rounded Corners in AvaloniaUI?
llm_cot_body:
I'm trying to create a transparent window with a semi-transparent circle inside using AvaloniaUI in C#. I've set the window background to transparent and disabled system decorations, but the window still has a default white background.

Here's my XAML code:

```xaml
<Window xmlns="https://github.com/avaloniaui"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        mc:Ignorable="d" d:DesignWidth="800" d:DesignHeight="450"
        x:Class="avava.MainWindow"
        Width="200"
        Height="200"
        WindowStartupLocation="CenterScreen"
        Background="Transparent"
        TransparencyBackgroundFallback="Transparent"
        ExtendClientAreaToDecorationsHint="True"
        ExtendClientAreaChromeHints="NoChrome"
        ExtendClientAreaTitleBarHeightHint="-1"
        SystemDecorations="None"
        BorderBrush="Transparent"
        BorderThickness="0">
    <Ellipse Fill="Green" Opacity="0.5" Width="150" Height="150" StrokeThickness="10" Stroke="Blue"/>
</Window>
```

I've tried setting `TransparencyBackgroundFallback` to `Transparent` and using different combinations of `ExtendClientArea` properties, but nothing seems to work. The circle appears correctly with the desired transparency, but the window background remains white.

How can I make the entire window background transparent, including the area around the circle?

<<How to Create a Transparent Window with Rounded Corners in AvaloniaUI?>>

Title: Unable to access the props of fetched data with useQuery
Title_Body:
<> <<"use client"; import { useState } from "react"; import { AnimatePresence, motion } from "framer-motion"; import { IUser } from "@/interfaces/database.interfaces"; import { UserType } from "@/interfaces/userpage.interfaces"; import { useQuery } from 'react-query'; import { Types } from "mongoose"; import RoleSelector from "@/components/User Page/RoleSelector"; async function getUsers(): Promise { const res = await fetch('/api/users', { method: 'GET', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } }); const data = await res.json(); return data; } async function getUserDetails(id:Types.ObjectId):Promise{ const res = await fetch(`/api/users/${id}`,{ method: 'GET', headers:{ 'Content-Type':'application/json' } }); if (!res.ok) { return undefined; } const data = await res.json(); return data; } const User2 = () => { // get User const roles = ['User', 'Maintainer', 'Admin']; const { data:Users, status } = useQuery('users', getUsers); const [openUserId, setOpenUserId] = useState(null); const handleToggle = (userId: Types.ObjectId) => { if (openUserId !== userId) { setOpenUserId(userId); } else if (openUserId === userId) { setOpenUserId(null); } }; if (status === 'loading') { return
Loading...
; } if (status === 'error') { return
Error fetching data
; } // let's not use hooks for now // Pagination // Search somehow? // Filter somehow? // Define Roles here // Make sure: Less definitions in the loops return (
{ /* Restricted Access component */}

Users

{/* */}
{ Users?.map((user) => { return (
handleToggle(user._id)}>

{user.display_name}

{user.email}

{ openUserId === user._id && // fetch some data first and than render the component ( ) }
); }) }
{/* */}
); }; const UserDetails = ({userId,roles}:{userId:Types.ObjectId,roles:string[]}) => { const { data, status } = useQuery(['DetailsUser', userId], () => getUserDetails(userId), { enabled: !!userId, staleTime: Infinity, // Cache the data indefinitely }); if (status === 'loading') { return
Loading...
; } if(status === 'error'){ return
Error fetching data
; } console.log(data); console.log(data?.role) return(

Card number

{data?.card_number}

Card ID

{data?.card_id}

) } export default User2; The above code is rendering a users page of a NextJS application. The issue lies within the UserDetails commponent function, which is fetching a user from the database, based on their user id. After fetching it is unable to access the props of the fetched data. The data that I am trying to fetch in the UserDetails component is based on the following interface: export interface IUser { _id:Types.ObjectId, azure_id: string; email: string; first_name: string; last_name: string; display_name: string; card_id: string; card_number: string; role: string; permissions?: Types.ObjectId[]; } When running console log for debugging: console.log(data); console.log(data?.role) I get the following response: >>
llm_zero_shot_title: Email field truncated when fetching user data from API
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Email field cut off in user object

I am successfully fetching a user object from my API, but the **email** field is being cut off after the 6th character. 

Here is the response I'm getting:

```javascript
user: Object { 
    _id: "5f8ea2e4837b0e44b34edc92", 
    azure_id: "ffd93ac3-b73c-44b0-b89e-c510408b6221", 
    card_id: "B6A36D8B",
    card_number: "0405402058",
    created: "2020-10-20T08:42:12.107Z",
    display_name: "Fernando Ortega",
    email: "feort20, // Should be "feort20@example.com"
    first_name: "Fernando",
    last_name: "Ortega",
    permissions: Array (3) [ "5cc2277e1b5e3310724abae6", "5cc22d0f1b5e3310724abaeb", "5f806621ecb46c4cc13996df"],
    role: "user",
    updated: "2023-06-25T10:23:29.5622"
}
```

**Expected behavior:** The `email` field should contain the full email address.

**Actual behavior:** The `email` field is truncated after "feort20".

I have checked the database and the email address is stored correctly. I am not performing any string manipulation on the email field before it is returned in the response.

What could be causing this issue and how can I fix it?

Title: VSCode Zen Mode: Extend Editor Width (Remove Side Margins)
Body:
Within VSCode's Zen Mode (toggled using the View: Toggle Zen Mode option from the command palette), I'd like to ensure that the editor width always fills my entire window.
Current behaviour: it has huge horizontal margins, minimizing the space available for code.
Desired behaviour: full window is taken up by the code editor, with the horizontal margins removed entirely.
Is there a settings file (as shown in screenshot below) configuration or VSCode extension I can use to achieve this result?

Title: LibGdx projects are failing to build in Android Studio - what is going wrong and how do I fix it?
Body:
I used the project generation tool on LibGdx's website (here: https://libgdx.com/wiki/start/project-generation) to generate a template project (as per their official documentation. I set the project to use the Android SDK installed alongside Android Studio (under C:\Users\<myuserdirectory>\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk). I imported the project into Android Studio, and clicked the run button.
The build failed and the following errors were displayed:

I have little to no familiarity with debugging gradle issues, so I was wondering what exactly is going wrong, and how do I fix it?
Title_Body:
<<LibGdx projects are failing to build in Android Studio - what is going wrong and how do I fix it?>>
<<I used the project generation tool on LibGdx's website (here: https://libgdx.com/wiki/start/project-generation) to generate a template project (as per their official documentation. I set the project to use the Android SDK installed alongside Android Studio (under C:\Users\<myuserdirectory>\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk). I imported the project into Android Studio, and clicked the run button.
The build failed and the following errors were displayed:

I have little to no familiarity with debugging gradle issues, so I was wondering what exactly is going wrong, and how do I fix it?
>>

Title: Angular 17 refuses to instance component
Title_Body:
<> <
And the app-three-js-interactive component: I have spent roughly 5 hours now, trying to figure out why the app-three-js-interactive is not created, and my HTML inspector just looks like this with absolutely nothing inside the component. No constructor call, no ngInit, no ngAfterViewInit, nothing... Even after removing all the code from the component it still does not instantiate anything @Component({ selector: 'app-three-js-interactive', templateUrl: './three-js-interactive.component.html' }) export class ThreeJsInteractiveComponent implements AfterViewInit { @Input() scene!: THREE.Scene; @ViewChild('canvas', { static: false }) canvasRef!: ElementRef; dog!: AnimationController; constructor(private canvasParentRef: ElementRef, private threeService: ThreejsProviderService) { console.log("help!") } ngAfterViewInit(): void { console.log("help!") } The module is declared in the app.module.ts and I've done everything I can think of to get it working but I am completely out of ideas, if I make a new component it works just fine, but this one component just does not want to be created in the place I am trying. It does work in a different location which is puzzling me even more... Does anyone have any idea why this is happening, or any other info you need to help me figure out what is going on... >>

llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to conditionally reflect an element in Angular based on the value of a variable. I have a variable named `ng-reflect-ng-if` that can be either "true" or "false". I want to apply a CSS class called `_ngcontent-ng-c3608827204` to the element only if `ng-reflect-ng-if` is "true". However, it seems that the class is not being applied correctly. The element inspector shows that the class is present even when `ng-reflect-ng-if` is set to "false".

The most important part of the error is that the `_ngcontent-ng-c3608827204` class is present in both cases, regardless of the value of `ng-reflect-ng-if`. This suggests that the conditional logic is not working as expected.

Title: Upgraded .Net 4.8 to .Net8.0 (Core), Microsoft.Office.Interop no longer recognises certain key words
Body:
I've upgraded a legacy C# WPF app from .Net 4.8 to .Net8.0 (Core).
Removed the NuGet packages for Microsoft.Office.Interop both word and excel and replaced with COM references (8.7 and 1.9 respectively).
This is using the same version of office as before the .Net upgrade.
The issue is it no longer recognises certain key words:
Am I missing something obvious or have Microsoft introduced some breaking changes?
Thanks

llm_zero_shot_title: C# - How to add text to header/footer of all pages in a Word document using Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word?
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<C# - How to add text to header/footer of all pages in a Word document using Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word?>>
<<## C# Interop Word - Changes to Headers/Footers not Saving

I'm using C# and Interop.Word to programmatically create Word documents. I'm trying to add text and images to the header and footer of each section in the document. However, while the code executes without errors, the changes to the headers and footers are not present when I open the generated document.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```c#
Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Application winword = new()
{
    ShowAnimation = false,
    Visible = false
};

Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document document = winword.Documents.Add();

foreach (Section wordSection in document.Sections)
{
    wordSection.Headers[WdHeaderFooterIndex.wdHeaderFooterPrimary].Range.ParagraphFormat.Alignment = WdParagraphAlignment.wdAlignParagraphCenter;
    wordSection.Headers[WdHeaderFooterIndex.wdHeaderFooterPrimary].Range.InlineShapes.AddPicture("image.png");

    wordSection.Footers[WdHeaderFooterIndex.wdHeaderFooterPrimary].Range.Text = "Registered";
    wordSection.Footers[WdHeaderFooterIndex.wdHeaderFooterPrimary].Range.ParagraphFormat.Alignment = WdParagraphAlignment.wdAlignParagraphCenter;
    wordSection.Footers[WdHeaderFooterIndex.wdHeaderFooterPrimary].Range.InlineShapes.AddPicture("image.png");
}

Paragraph paragraph = document.Content.Paragraphs.Add();
paragraph.Range.Font.Size = 11;
paragraph.Range.Text = "CRANE HOUSE ERSTLON TERRACE WEST ROAD"; 
```

**Expected behavior:** The generated Word document should have the specified text and image in the header and footer of each section.

**Actual behavior:** The generated Word document does not contain any changes to the default header and footer.

I've tried saving the document explicitly after making the changes, but that didn't help. What am I missing here?>>

Here's the code I'm using:

```csharp
Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Application winword = new()
{
    ShowAnimation = false,
    Visible = false
};

Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document document = winword.Documents.Add();

foreach (Section wordSection in document.Sections)
{
    wordSection.Headers[WdHeaderFooterIndex.wdHeaderFooterPrimary].Range.ParagraphFormat.Alignment = WdParagraphAlignment.wdAlignParagraphCenter;

}

paragraph.Range.Font.Size = 11;
paragraph.Range.Text = "CRANE HOUSE ERSTLON TERRACE WEST ROAD IPSWICH SUFFOLK IP3 9EJ";
```

I've verified that the document has multiple sections and that the loop iterates through each section. I've also tried adding different content to the header and footer in each iteration, but the result is always the same: only the last section has the header and footer.

What am I doing wrong? How can I add a header and footer to each section of the document?>>

Title: RealityKit HasTransform.position throws a runtime exception
Body:
I am working on a React Native app, specifically on the iOS native module with RealityKit.
An apparently unexplainable error keeps happening at runtime, as you can see from the following image:

When I try to retrieve the position of my AnchorEntity relative to the world space (so using relativeTo: nil), it triggers a runtime exception during some of its internal calls:
CoreRE: re::BucketArray<unsigned short*, 32ul>::operator[](unsigned long) + 204
As you can see from the code, my AnchorEntity is not null as there is a guard check.
I also tried to move that code into an objective c static function in order to use @try @catch and catch runtime exceptions, to later realise that RealityKit is not compatible with ObjectiveC.
Do you have any idea/suggestion on how to fix it/prevent it?
Title_Body:
<<RealityKit HasTransform.position throws a runtime exception>>
<<I am working on a React Native app, specifically on the iOS native module with RealityKit.
An apparently unexplainable error keeps happening at runtime, as you can see from the following image:

When I try to retrieve the position of my AnchorEntity relative to the world space (so using relativeTo: nil), it triggers a runtime exception during some of its internal calls:
CoreRE: re::BucketArray<unsigned short*, 32ul>::operator[](unsigned long) + 204
As you can see from the code, my AnchorEntity is not null as there is a guard check.
I also tried to move that code into an objective c static function in order to use @try @catch and catch runtime exceptions, to later realise that RealityKit is not compatible with ObjectiveC.
Do you have any idea/suggestion on how to fix it/prevent it?
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Swift/ARKit - How to get the position of an anchorEntity in ReplateCameraView?
llm_zero_shot_body:
**Swift/ARKit - Cannot retrieve anchor position**

I am trying to get the position of an `anchorEntity` in my ARKit scene. I have verified that the anchor is set, but when I try to access its position, I get a nil value.

Here is the code:

```swift
guard let anchorNode = ReplateCameraView.anchorEntity else {
    safeRejecter("001", "[ReplateCameraController] No anchor set yet", NSError(domain:
    "ReplateCameraController", code: 001, userInfo: nil))
    return
}

// Use the Objective-C helper to safely retrieve the anchor position
let anchorPosition = anchorNode.position(relativeTo: nil)
```

**Expected behavior:**

`anchorPosition` should contain the position of the `anchorNode` in the scene.

**Actual behavior:**

`anchorPosition` is nil.

**Question:**

Why am I unable to retrieve the position of my `anchorEntity`? What am I doing wrong, and how can I fix this?

Title: Docker not launching Blazor WebAssembly App .NET 8 as expected
Body:
I've recently created a new Blazor web assembly app and added Docker support to the project. Then, I performed the following steps to build and run the container:

Build Docker image:
docker build -t blazorapp .

Run container:
docker run -d -p 8080:80 --name myblazorapp blazorapp

However, after executing these commands, nothing happens. I expected the application to run and be accessible via port 8080, but this is not occurring.
Here's the content of my Dockerfile:
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/aspnet:8.0 AS base
USER app
WORKDIR /app
EXPOSE 8080
EXPOSE 8081

FROM mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/sdk:8.0 AS build
ARG BUILD_CONFIGURATION=Release
WORKDIR /src
COPY ["BlazorApp2/BlazorApp2.csproj", "BlazorApp2/"]
COPY ["BlazorApp2.Client/BlazorApp2.Client.csproj", "BlazorApp2.Client/"]
RUN dotnet restore "./BlazorApp2/BlazorApp2.csproj"
COPY . .
WORKDIR "/src/BlazorApp2"
RUN dotnet build "./BlazorApp2.csproj" -c $BUILD_CONFIGURATION -o /app/build

FROM build AS publish
ARG BUILD_CONFIGURATION=Release
RUN dotnet publish "./BlazorApp2.csproj" -c $BUILD_CONFIGURATION -o /app/publish /p:UseAppHost=false

FROM base AS final
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=publish /app/publish .
ENTRYPOINT ["dotnet", "BlazorApp2.dll"]

I will be grateful for any help you can provide.
Title_Body:
<<Docker not launching Blazor WebAssembly App .NET 8 as expected>>
<<I've recently created a new Blazor web assembly app and added Docker support to the project. Then, I performed the following steps to build and run the container:

Build Docker image:
docker build -t blazorapp .

Run container:
docker run -d -p 8080:80 --name myblazorapp blazorapp

However, after executing these commands, nothing happens. I expected the application to run and be accessible via port 8080, but this is not occurring.
Here's the content of my Dockerfile:
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/aspnet:8.0 AS base
USER app
WORKDIR /app
EXPOSE 8080
EXPOSE 8081

FROM mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/sdk:8.0 AS build
ARG BUILD_CONFIGURATION=Release
WORKDIR /src
COPY ["BlazorApp2/BlazorApp2.csproj", "BlazorApp2/"]
COPY ["BlazorApp2.Client/BlazorApp2.Client.csproj", "BlazorApp2.Client/"]
RUN dotnet restore "./BlazorApp2/BlazorApp2.csproj"
COPY . .
WORKDIR "/src/BlazorApp2"
RUN dotnet build "./BlazorApp2.csproj" -c $BUILD_CONFIGURATION -o /app/build

FROM build AS publish
ARG BUILD_CONFIGURATION=Release
RUN dotnet publish "./BlazorApp2.csproj" -c $BUILD_CONFIGURATION -o /app/publish /p:UseAppHost=false

FROM base AS final
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=publish /app/publish .
ENTRYPOINT ["dotnet", "BlazorApp2.dll"]

I will be grateful for any help you can provide.
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Blazor WASM - Two "Program.cs" files in Solution Explorer - How to structure?
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Blazor WASM project structure missing Razor Class Library

I'm working on a Blazor WebAssembly project in Visual Studio and I'm noticing something strange about my solution structure. I seem to be missing the typical Razor Class Library (RCL) project that usually accompanies a Blazor WASM client project.

As you can see in the screenshot, my solution 'BlazorApp2' contains two projects:

1. **BlazorApp2:** This seems to be the server-side project with a standard Blazor Server structure.
2. **BlazorApp2.Client:** This is supposed to be my Blazor WASM client project, but it's missing the usual RCL structure. There's no `Shared` folder or any indication of Razor components being shared between the client and server.

**Expected Behavior:**

I expect to see a separate Razor Class Library project within my solution that houses shared components, models, and other logic used by both the server and client projects.

**Actual Behavior:**

The solution only contains a server-side Blazor project and a client-side project that lacks the typical RCL structure.

Am I missing something obvious here? Is there a different way to structure Blazor WASM projects that I'm not aware of? Any help in understanding this structure or how to fix it would be greatly appreciated.

llm_few_shot_title: Blazor WASM - Two Program.cs Files
llm_few_shot_body:
I have created a new Blazor WebAssembly App project. I then added a new Blazor Server App project to the solution. When I try to add a project reference from the Server app to the WebAssembly app, the WebAssembly app does not show up in the list of projects available to reference. 

The most important part of the error is that the WebAssembly app is not listed as an available project to reference. This is unexpected because both projects are in the same solution.

I have tried restarting Visual Studio and cleaning and rebuilding both projects, but the issue persists. How can I fix this?

I have tried restarting Visual Studio and cleaning and rebuilding both projects, but the issue persists. How can I fix this?>>
llm_cot_title: Blazor WASM - How to share code between BlazorApp2 and BlazorApp2.Client projects?
llm_cot_body:
I have a Blazor WebAssembly project named "BlazorApp2.Client" within a solution that contains another project named "BlazorApp2".  Both projects have a `Program.cs` file at the root level.

**My goal is to move the `Program.cs` file within the "BlazorApp2.Client" project into a subfolder.** I tried creating a new folder and moving the file, but when I run the project, I get an error saying "The program entry point could not be loaded."

I've tried cleaning and rebuilding the solution, but the error persists. I've also checked the documentation, but I couldn't find any information on how to change the location of the `Program.cs` file in a Blazor WebAssembly project.

How can I move the `Program.cs` file to a subfolder without breaking my Blazor WebAssembly application?

I've tried cleaning and rebuilding the solution, but the error persists. I've also checked the documentation, but I couldn't find any information on how to change the location of the `Program.cs` file in a Blazor WebAssembly project.

How can I move the `Program.cs` file to a subfolder without breaking my Blazor WebAssembly application?>>

Title: JS console logging using styles (%c) adds unintended line breaks
Title_Body:
<<JS console logging using styles (%c) adds unintended line breaks>>
<<I'm working on some debugging logging prettification and I noticed that when you do longer chunks of styled text, the console tends to add line breaks. I wonder if I can prevent this behavior. Maybe there's something in the styles that could prevent it elegantly?
Here's an example:
const cssHeadField = `border-bottom: 1px solid grey;font-family: 'Courier New',monospace;font-weight: 600;font-size: 1.2em;background-color: Orange; color: black`;
const cssError = `background-color: Red; color: black`;

console.log(`no formatting at all %c and now head field kicks in and now it stops: %c and now a bunch of text that has no formatting, oop! %can error here%c some more text with no for... %coh, another error!%c`, cssHeadField, "", cssError, "", cssError, "")
console.log(`no formatting at all %c and now head field kicks in and now it stops: %c and now a bunch of text that has no formatting, oop! %can error here, maybe a longer error description too something that would be multiline or something right?%c some more text with no for... %coh, another error! This one is supposed to be long too just to test it out I guess%c`, cssHeadField, "", cssError, "", cssError, "");


>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Javascript console.log() CSS formatting breaks after a certain length
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<Javascript console.log() CSS formatting breaks after a certain length>>
<<## Console log styling breaks after a certain length

I'm trying to style my console logs using `console.log('%c styled text', 'style')`, but the styling seems to break after a certain length. 

Here's my code:

```javascript
const cssHeadField = `border-bottom: 1px solid grey; font-family: 'Courier New', monospace;font-weight: 600;font-size: 1.2em; background-color: Orange; color: black;`;
const cssError = `background-color: Red; color: black;`;

console.log(`no formatting at all %c and now head field kicks in and now it stops: %c and now a bunch of text that has no formatting, oop! %can error here%c some more text with no for... %coh, another error!%c`, cssHeadField, "", cssError, "", cssError, "");

console.log(`no formatting at all %c and now head field kicks in and now it stops: %c and now a bunch of text that has no formatting, oop! %can error here, maybe a longer error description too something that would be multiline or something right?%c some more text with no for... %coh, another error! This one is supposed to be long too just to test it out I guess%c`, cssHeadField, "", cssError, "", cssError, "");
```

**Expected behavior:** The styling defined in `cssHeadField` and `cssError` should be applied to the respective parts of the log message, regardless of length.

**Actual behavior:** The styling works for shorter messages, but for longer messages, the styling breaks after a certain point. The rest of the message is displayed without any styling.

Is there a limit on the length of the string or the number of style arguments that can be passed to `console.log`? How can I ensure that the styling is applied consistently to the entire message?>>
llm_few_shot_title: Google Apps Script Execution API Returning "ERR_BLOCKED_BY_CLIENT"
llm_few_shot_body:
I am trying to send a POST request to "https://play.google.com/log?hasFast=true&auth=CAsi..." using Javascript's fetch API, but I am getting an error message that says "net::ERR_BLOCKED_BY_CLIENT" in the console.

The request seems to be blocked before it even reaches the server. I am not seeing any CORS errors in the console. 

What could be causing the browser to block this request? Is there a way to debug this further?
llm_few_shot_combined:
<<Google Apps Script Execution API Returning "ERR_BLOCKED_BY_CLIENT">>
<<I am trying to send a POST request to "https://play.google.com/log?hasFast=true&auth=CAsi..." using Javascript's fetch API, but I am getting an error message that says "net::ERR_BLOCKED_BY_CLIENT" in the console.

The request seems to be blocked before it even reaches the server. I am not seeing any CORS errors in the console. 

What could be causing the browser to block this request? Is there a way to debug this further?>>
llm_cot_title: Javascript console.log() styling breaks when string contains newline characters
llm_cot_combined:
<<Javascript console.log() styling breaks when string contains newline characters>>
<<I'm trying to apply CSS styles within a `console.log` statement using `%c` format specifiers. However, the styling seems to abruptly stop after a certain point, and the rest of the text remains unstyled.

Here's my code:

```javascript
const cssHeadField = `border-bottom: 1px solid grey; font-family: 'Courier New', monospace;font-weight: 600;font-size: 1.2em; background-color: Orange; color: black;`;
const cssError = `background-color: Red; color: black;`;

console.log(`no formatting at all %c and now head field kicks in and now it stops: %c and now a bunch of text that has no formatting, oop! %can error here, maybe a longer error description too something that would be multiline or something right?%c some more text with no for... %coh, another error! This one is supposed to be long too just to test it out I guess%c`, cssHeadField, "", cssError, "", cssError, "");
```

The first `%c` specifier with `cssHeadField` works as expected. However, the subsequent `%c` specifiers with `cssError` don't seem to have any effect, and the text remains unstyled.

I've tried different CSS properties and string lengths, but the issue persists. Is there a limit on the amount of text that can be styled within a single `console.log` statement? Am I missing something in my implementation?>>

        bracketSameLine: false,
        semi: true,

      },
    ],

      2,
      {
        code: 120,
        tabWidth: 2,
        comments: 120,
        ignoreComments: false,
        ignoreTrailingComments: true,
        ignoreUrls: true,
        ignoreStrings: true,
        ignoreTemplateLiterals: true,
        ignoreRegExpLiterals: true,
      },
    ],

    'react/jsx-filename-extension': [1, { extensions: ['.tsx', '.ts', '.js', '.jsx'] }],

      },
    ],

    'jsx-a11y/no-static-element-interactions': [0],
    // Redux toolkit rules

    // Common rules

Title: is getenv_s not part of cstdlib?
Body:
C11 added new bounds-checked functions to the standard library, such as getenv_s.
However, when I include <cstdlib>, I do not have std::getenv_s, only getenv_s (global namespace).
cppreference has the following note:

As with all bounds-checked functions, getenv_s is only guaranteed to be available if __STDC_LIB_EXT1__ is defined by the implementation and if the user defines __STDC_WANT_LIB_EXT1__ to the integer constant 1 before including <stdlib.h>.

Even when I define __STDC_WANT_LIB_EXT1__ as 1, My compiler (MSVC C++23) does not find the std::getenv_s function.

Isn't <cstdlib> supposed to bring every symbol of <stdlib.h> into the std namespace?
Title_Body:
<<is getenv_s not part of cstdlib?>>
<<C11 added new bounds-checked functions to the standard library, such as getenv_s.
However, when I include <cstdlib>, I do not have std::getenv_s, only getenv_s (global namespace).
cppreference has the following note:

As with all bounds-checked functions, getenv_s is only guaranteed to be available if __STDC_LIB_EXT1__ is defined by the implementation and if the user defines __STDC_WANT_LIB_EXT1__ to the integer constant 1 before including <stdlib.h>.

Even when I define __STDC_WANT_LIB_EXT1__ as 1, My compiler (MSVC C++23) does not find the std::getenv_s function.

Isn't <cstdlib> supposed to bring every symbol of <stdlib.h> into the std namespace?
>>

llm_zero_shot_title: TypeScript: Type '"default value" | NonNullable<T>' is not assignable to type 'T' when using optional callback with generic return type
llm_zero_shot_body:
## TypeScript error: Type '"default value" | NonNullable<T>' is not assignable to type 'T'

I'm getting a TypeScript error in my code that I can't seem to figure out. 

Here's the code:

```typescript
function callbackWrapper<T = string>(cb?: () => T): T {
  return cb?.() ?? 'default value';
}
```

The error message I'm getting is:

```
Type '"default value" | NonNullable<T>' is not assignable to type 'T'.
'T' could be instantiated with an arbitrary type which could be unrelated to '"default value" | NonNullable<T>'.  ts(2322)
```

**Expected behavior:**

I want the `callbackWrapper` function to return the result of the callback function `cb` if it's defined, otherwise it should return the default value `"default value"`.

**Actual behavior:**

TypeScript throws the error mentioned above.

I understand that the error is because the type of the expression `cb?.() ?? 'default value'` is `'default value' | NonNullable<T>`, which might not always be assignable to `T`. However, I'm not sure how to fix this while maintaining the desired behavior.

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

llm_cot_title: TypeScript: Type '"string" | NonNullable<T>' is not assignable to type 'T' when using optional callback with generic return type
llm_cot_body:
I'm having trouble with TypeScript generics and default values. I have a function that takes an optional callback function as an argument. The callback function can return any type `T`, and the main function should also return the same type `T`. If the callback is not provided, I want to return a default value of type string.

```typescript
function callbackWrapper<T = string>(cb?: () => T): T {
  return cb?.() ?? 'default value';
}
```

However, I'm getting the following error:

```
Type '"default value" | NonNullable<T>' is not assignable to type 'T'.
'T' could be instantiated with an arbitrary type which could be unrelated to '"default value"'
```

I understand that the error occurs because `T` could be anything, and the default value might not be compatible. I've tried casting the default value to `T`, but that didn't work.

How can I fix this type error while keeping the function generic and providing a default value?

Title: Which App Description is Used in the SharePoint App Store: package-solution.json or Submission Input?
Body:
I'm developing a SharePoint app using SPFx and am preparing to publish it for the first time in the app store. I've added the app description in the package-solution.json file as instructed. However, during the submission process, I'm prompted to enter the description again. My question is: which app description will be used in the app store—the one in package-solution.json or the one I enter during submission?
I'm asking this because I've encountered an issue with the package-solution.json file: the description does not support HTML tags. There's an open issue on GitHub regarding this.
https://github.com/SharePoint/sp-dev-docs/issues/9522
When I manually deploy the app in the app catalog, the description appears as plain text. However, in the app store, it is showing in a rich text control.
Title_Body:
<<Which App Description is Used in the SharePoint App Store: package-solution.json or Submission Input?>>
<<I'm developing a SharePoint app using SPFx and am preparing to publish it for the first time in the app store. I've added the app description in the package-solution.json file as instructed. However, during the submission process, I'm prompted to enter the description again. My question is: which app description will be used in the app store—the one in package-solution.json or the one I enter during submission?
I'm asking this because I've encountered an issue with the package-solution.json file: the description does not support HTML tags. There's an open issue on GitHub regarding this.
https://github.com/SharePoint/sp-dev-docs/issues/9522
When I manually deploy the app in the app catalog, the description appears as plain text. However, in the app store, it is showing in a rich text control.

>>
llm_zero_shot_title: SPFx package-solution.json - How to define "screenshotPaths" for multiple images?
llm_zero_shot_body:
**SharePoint Framework (SPFx) package-solution.json - screenshotPaths not working**

I'm building a SharePoint Framework (SPFx) solution and I'm trying to include screenshots in the package. I've added the `screenshotPaths` property to my `package-solution.json` file, but the screenshots are not showing up when I upload the package to the app catalog.

Here is the relevant section of my `package-solution.json` file:

```json
{
  "solution": {
    // ... other properties
    "screenshotPaths": [
      "assets/screenshot1.png",
      "assets/screenshot2.png"
    ],
    // ... other properties
  }
}
```

The screenshots are located in the `assets` folder at the root of my project. I've tried both relative and absolute paths, but nothing seems to work.

**Expected behavior:**

The screenshots should be visible in the app catalog when I upload the SPFx package.

**Actual behavior:**

The screenshots are not showing up.

**What I've tried:**

* Using both relative and absolute paths for `screenshotPaths`
* Clearing the browser cache
* Redeploying the solution

Any ideas on what I might be doing wrong?

Title: Http 429 is not returnable in status code from C# ASP.NET Core Web API
Title_Body:
<<Http 429 is not returnable in status code from C# ASP.NET Core Web API>>
<<[Route("{route}")]
[HttpPost]
public async Task<System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage> Post([FromBody] dynamic data)
{
    var test = new HttpResponseMessage(HttpStatusCode.TooManyRequests);
    return test;
}

Implementing an ASP.NET Core Web API controller. The intention is to return HTTP 429.
However, the 429 is returned in the response body but the actual response is HTTP 200
Example response from Postman below
{
    "Version": "1.1",
    "Content": {
        "Headers": []
    },
    "StatusCode": 429,
    "ReasonPhrase": "Too Many Requests",
    "Headers": [],
    "TrailingHeaders": [],
    "RequestMessage": null,
    "IsSuccessStatusCode": false
}


Any ideas how to fix this please?
I want the response in Postman to have a HTTP 429 status code.
Ideally, my expectation is that both response body and response header should be containing HTTP 429 (here, the response payload status is 429 but the response header contains 200)
>>

Title: How to use switch branch button only seems to work for single repo in multi-root workspace
Body:
I am used to looking at the source control checkout button in vscode as a quick indication of what branch the IDE thinks I'm working on.
This button is in lower left of the status panel as seen here:

When I have several folders open in a multi-root workspace, each with their own repo, this button only works for one of those repos - I can't figure out how to get it to show branch options for any of the other repos.
I've done all sorts of searches like "vscode multi-root switch branch", etc. Found nothing that addresses this.
Vscode documentation only address the use of this button in the context of single root repo.
I've also right clicked the branch in the scm view and selected "make default" - which didn't help.
How does vscode determine the repo in which to display the current branch?
How can I tell vscode which of the multi-root repos to use for display and actions?
Title_Body:
<<How to use switch branch button only seems to work for single repo in multi-root workspace>>
<<I am used to looking at the source control checkout button in vscode as a quick indication of what branch the IDE thinks I'm working on.
This button is in lower left of the status panel as seen here:

When I have several folders open in a multi-root workspace, each with their own repo, this button only works for one of those repos - I can't figure out how to get it to show branch options for any of the other repos.
I've done all sorts of searches like "vscode multi-root switch branch", etc. Found nothing that addresses this.
Vscode documentation only address the use of this button in the context of single root repo.
I've also right clicked the branch in the scm view and selected "make default" - which didn't help.
How does vscode determine the repo in which to display the current branch?
How can I tell vscode which of the multi-root repos to use for display and actions?
>>
llm_zero_shot_title: Visual Studio Code - How to debug "Cannot find module './plistParser'" error?
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Autocompletion/IntelliSense not working for Node.js `require` in VS Code

I'm working on a Node.js project in VS Code, and for some reason, I'm not getting any autocompletion suggestions when using `require` to import modules. 

Here's a snippet of my code:

```javascript
var path = require('path');
var fs = require('fs');
var plistParser = require('./plistParser');
var request = require('request');
```

**Expected behavior:**

I expect VS Code to suggest available modules as I type within the `require('')` statement, both for built-in Node.js modules and for modules within my project.

**Actual behavior:**

No suggestions are appearing, and I have to manually type out the entire module path.

**Things I've tried:**

* Restarting VS Code
* Ensuring that JavaScript is selected as the language mode
* Checking for any relevant settings in VS Code settings

I'm using the latest version of VS Code and have the necessary extensions installed. 

Any ideas on what might be causing this issue and how to fix it?

llm_cot_title: How to convert TextMate grammar to VS Code grammar in a VS Code extension?
llm_cot_combined:
<<How to convert TextMate grammar to VS Code grammar in a VS Code extension?>>
<<I'm working on a project that involves parsing and converting grammar files in a Visual Studio Code extension. I'm encountering an issue in my `grammarConverter.js` file where I need to populate an `extensionConfig` object with information extracted from a grammar file.

Here's the relevant code snippet:

```javascript
function convertGrammar(location, extensionConfig) {
  extensionConfig.languageId = '';
  extensionConfig.languageName = '';
  extensionConfig.languageScopeName = '';
  extensionConfig.languageExtensions = [];

  if (!location) {
    extensionConfig.languageContent = '';
    return Promise.resolve();
  }

  // Logic to extract information from the grammar file and populate extensionConfig
}
```

Currently, the `extensionConfig` object is being initialized with empty strings and an empty array. I need to replace these placeholders with the actual values parsed from the grammar file.

I've already imported necessary modules like `fs` and `path` for file system operations. However, I'm unsure about the most effective way to:

1. Read and parse the grammar file content based on its format (e.g., JSON, XML).
2. Extract the required information like `languageId`, `languageName`, etc.
3. Populate the `extensionConfig` object with the extracted values.

Could someone please guide me on how to achieve this grammar file parsing and `extensionConfig` population within the `convertGrammar` function? Any code examples or suggestions on suitable parsing libraries would be highly appreciated.>>

llm_zero_shot_title: "How to fix 'InvalidModules: This module cannot be imported from a Client Component module' error when deploying to Convex?"
llm_zero_shot_body:
## Convex deployment error: "This module cannot be imported from a Client Component module"

I'm trying to deploy my Convex application, but I'm getting the following error:

```
* Error: Unable to push deployment config to https://silent-grasshopper-634.convex.cloud
* Error fetching POST https://silent-grasshopper-634.convex.cloud/api/push_config 400 Bad Request: InvalidModules: Hit an e
rror while pushing:
Loading the pushed modules encountered the following
error:
Failed to analyze middleware.js: Uncaught Error: This module cannot be imported from a Client Component module. It should on
ly be used from a Server Component.
at <anonymous> (../node_modules/server-only/index.js:1:2)
```

It seems like I'm trying to import a module (`middleware.js`) in a Client Component, but it's only allowed in Server Components. However, I'm not sure where this import is happening. 

**Here's what I've tried:**

* I've checked my `convex/` directory for any direct imports of `middleware.js` in Client Components, but I couldn't find any.
* I've tried searching my `node_modules/` for the `server-only` package mentioned in the error message, but I haven't found anything relevant.

**My question is:**

How can I track down where this incorrect import is happening? Are there any tools or techniques for identifying imports within my Convex application? 

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Title: NestJs/Bull, runs fine locally but does not work in the cloud
Body:
I'm facing an issue with implementing a Bull queue in my NestJS application. I'm using PM2 to manage the application and NGINX as a reverse proxy. The job IDs are stored in Redis, but for some reason, everything just stops and the Bull queue doesn't process the jobs as expected.
I've tried the following:
Using both local Redis and cloud Redis (e.g., Redis Cloud).
Verified that Redis is running and accessible.
Ensured that my Bull queues are correctly initialized in NestJS.
Restarting the app with PM2.
However, the issue persists, and jobs in the queue don't seem to get processed consistently. Any ideas or suggestions on what might be causing this?
Tech Stack:

NestJS (using @nestjs/bull)
Bull (v4.x)
PM2 (for process management)
NGINX (for reverse proxy)
Redis (both local and Redis Cloud)

Additional Info:

Redis connection is established successfully.
Jobs get queued but are not processed.
Everything stops after a while, and Bull doesn't seem to be running well.
Thank you for your help!
Title_Body:
<<NestJs/Bull, runs fine locally but does not work in the cloud>>

Verified that Redis is running and accessible.
Ensured that my Bull queues are correctly initialized in NestJS.
Restarting the app with PM2.
However, the issue persists, and jobs in the queue don't seem to get processed consistently. Any ideas or suggestions on what might be causing this?

Thank you for your help!


>>
llm_zero_shot_title: How to switch between Redis instances (local and cloud) in a Node.js application using BullMQ?
llm_zero_shot_combined:
<<How to switch between Redis instances (local and cloud) in a Node.js application using BullMQ?>>
<<**NestJS BullModule - How to switch between local and cloud Redis instances?**

I'm using the BullModule in my NestJS application and I'm trying to find a clean way to switch between my local Redis instance and my Redis Cloud instance depending on the environment.

Here's my current setup:

```typescript
@Module({
  imports: [
    BullModule.forRoot({
      redis: {
        host: 'redis-xxxx.redis-cloud.com',
        port: 14166,
        password: 'xxxx',
        // host: 'localhost',
        // port: 6379,
      },
    }),
    // ... other modules
  ],
  // ...
})
export class AppModule {}
```

Currently, I'm commenting and uncommenting the `host` and `port` lines to switch between environments. This is obviously not ideal. 

What's the best practice for configuring different Redis connections based on the environment (development, production, etc.) in a NestJS application using BullModule?>>
